Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel, great Staff”
Reviews.Author: joebloggins13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed often at le Place D'Armes. Consistently good service and comfortable place to stay. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jodi L
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at Place d'Armes in Montreal. What a great hotel. From the minute we entered the door until we finally drove away we were treated fabulously. The hotel itself is beautiful with a sophisticated boutique hotel feel. Our room was well appointed and the large rain shower was a fun way to start the day. The room was clean and felt well kept. The bedding and bed were crisp clean and comfortable. The best part of our stay was meeting Magill the concierge. She was so helpful in confirming and changing reservations we already made and making new ones along with great reccomendations. She not only helped plan our days but called ahead for times and availability. We travel often and her level of knowledge, willingness and service was top rate. Much thanks to all the staff, we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Fine boutique hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Threedogstwokids
Reviews.Content: Hotel Place D'Armes is really good boutique hotel in Old Montreal. The rooms are very quiet and well appointed. I find it great for business travel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: addie00063
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place D'Armes Hotel and Suites for 3 nights in a Junior Suite with Balony. The room was very clean, comfortable and of a very high standard. The bathroom was very large with a stand-alone tub and extra large shower. The balcony is quite large with outdoor patio furniture and offers views of the city. The staff was very quick to serve us and always polite and helpful. On the final morning of our stay we received a note under our door advising that the hotel was offering guests a complimentary breakfast as an apology for a fire alarm that went off the previous night (at 10:30pm). We were not there so did not know about the alarm but we had a wonderful breakfast! Overall, a very well-run hotel that places high importance on it's guests needs and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Did not wantTo leave”
Reviews.Author: Kzbroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my husband. Old Montreal charm and service only found in a boutique hotel. Classic King room was spacious, sky high ceilings, quality furnishings and linens. Turn down service and charming staff. Very professional and caring service. Stayed in room 1703 great view of the square and Basillica Walking distance to everything. Superb value. No detail was missed including complimentary umbrella in our room and top quality toilettries We are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first time in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: niquita84
Reviews.Content: My husban and I had never been to Canada and as part of our honeymoon roadtrip we went and stayed here! Excellent decision! I just happened upon it online in a search for hotels and the pictures on their website are true to what you get. We had a suite that had a living room area with an electric fireplace, large flat screen tv, comfy couch, stocked fridge/bar, dining table for 4, a desk, seperate bedroom with 2 closets! The bathroom was gorgeous! A large rain shower, jetted tub, rain spa amenities, large and spacious with 2 nice bath robes. We also had a smaller bathroom with a sink and toilette near the entrance. They have valet parking and we only used our car once-we walked everywhere! There was even a starbuck across the street! It was close to the bank and notre dame and a couple of restaurants! We took advantage of their rain spa with a couples massage...best decision ever! The massage therapists we had were friendly and wonderful! We also used the Hammam after which is a like a giant sauna. We also ordered room service our first night-ordered burgers...no joke, best burgers we have ever had!!! The cheese was amazing...yum! Everyone there spoke english and french so we had no issues with communicating! Best hotel we have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: catt2322
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with a few friends back in November to celebrate my 30th birthday! We splurged a little on the hotel...you only turn 30 once, right?! :) We were very impressed. It was exactly what we were looking for. We wanted a true Montreal feel. Very french in other words. The staff was beyond friendly, and helpful. We arrived right around 10pm on a Thursday evening and the hotel restaurant/bar was hoppin'! The rooms were so clean and smelled sooooo lovely! They had classical music playing in our room when we arrived. We enjoyed it so much, we never turned it off! The room service was speedy as well. Well, for a bucket of ice anyway :) We opened a bottle of bailey's in the room for a little pre-party one night and they quickly responded to our request for ice. The only negative I have is the size of the room. We had just a standard room, which was fine for our quick weekend getaway. But, if you have a lot of luggage, it will be VERY tight. We had to stick our 2 suitcases in nooks and crannies in the room just to get around. But, I suppose this should be expected in such an old, unique hotel. My brother and sister in law upgraded their room to a King/corner room and they had MUCH more space. So just something to keep in mind if you are a heavy packer! There is a wardrobe to store you clothes. Last but not least, make sure you look over your bill before you leave. We were charged things out of our mini bar that we never had. So just be aware! I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A little dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: rickj_9
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, but for the price they did not WOW us...the service coudl have been better, and the staff friendlier... The air circulation system in the hotel is very noisy... it woke us up at night...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: daisiekat
Reviews.Content: We booked at Le Place d'Armes and we are so happy we did. This boutique hotel is located in Old Montreal, walking distance to Chinatown, and great shopping on St. Catherine and St.Laurent. We visited the rainspa and prior to our side by side massages, we spent some time in the relaxing steam bath. Our hotel room was upgraded for 20$/day to a 800 sq ft suite, which we thoroughly enjoyed. Our fireplace in our room created a cozy atmosphere, and the rain shower was the perfect way to start each morning. We spent an evening at the bar 701, which was beautiful. The front desk always had fantastic restaurants to recommend, some affiliated with the hotel and some not - we loved each and every recommendation. I also left my tablet in the room and when I called, the hotel had it locked in their safe and it is on its way back home as we speak. The only complaint that we had was that we did not have a coffee maker in the room, which would have been a nice addition to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hellomichelle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Montreal and had an amazing time and Place d'Armes! We booked a junior suite with balcony and it was amazing. The room was vet spacious with an amazingly HUGE bathroom...great walk in shower, jetted tub, and lots of space and ammeneties. The room includes a fireplace (which was nice during our cold stay), great views, and a really comfy bed. Every evening they offered turndown service which included complimentary bottled water. Absolutely loved our room and would book again. The hotel is also lovely - gorgeous decor and very hip. The lobby had a billiard table and we played often. We took full advantage of the hotel, got drinks at the bar, had dinner at AIX, and booked couples' massages at the spa. The bar is very nice and quite happening. The hotel offers a complimentary drink upon check in, which is a nice perk. We stayed in the bar to have additional cocktails before dinner and was bet pleased. Unlike the bar, AIX restaurant was very empty. Food was amazing nonetheless. Rainspa was average. The steam room (hammam) was really nice, but locker rooms were insufficient. Women's locker rooms are on another floor of the hotel (also where hotel rooms are) so they make you walk with a robe and take the elevator from one floor to the next. This I didn't enjoy. Men's locker rooms don't exist at all...simply some lockers in the hallway of the spa. Locker rooms were also lacking in ameneties for a spa. Luckily, because we stayed in the hotel, we used our amenities in our room and skipped the lockers. The couples' massage was really nice though...and we got a discount coupon upon check in! Overall, loved my stay at Place d'Armes. I've stayed in many luxury-type hotels worldwide and this was really one of my favorites...great service and great ammeneties.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: MattH009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a Superior King room in mid-March. The room was absolutely one of the cleanest, most spacious, and best furnished hotel rooms we'd ever seen. The rain shower was awesome, and so was the electric fireplace (which gave off a surprising amount of heat). We took advantage of the welcome cocktails and the complimentary Wi-Fi was fast and worked great in the room, which allowed us to avoid expensive data roaming charges. Location was excellent, and the staff was extremely friendly and willing to assist in any way they could. Room service breakfast was served at precisely the requested time, and was delicious. Couldn't recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “2 stays - both great!”
Reviews.Author: felecia2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was one of the best. The hotel decor is very nice both in the common areas and in the rooms. The location is great for exploring the historic area. The valet parking is amazingly fast and we never had a problem being able to pull right up to the front entrance of the hotel with our car and luggage. The food in the bar was good, and the free welcome cocktail is a nice perk. There are great rooms with outstanding bathrooms. Hotel staff were really nice and helpful. There are good deals available on their website. Our first stay there we booked a jr. suite that was a big size with a fireplace, walk in shower, soaking tub and nice furnishings, and got a great deal through the website. The second stay there we also booked a jr.suite, but this time the room layout was completely different and it was in a different part of the hotel than the first time we stayed there. Although this room was very nice, there were things that made it not as nice or new as the first room we stayed in. BUT, we only had to say "I am not happy with my room" at the front desk and they immediately found us another room without us having to say another word, and were very friendly and helpful. So, as with most boutique hotels, rooms can vary in newness, layout and furnishings, but I am sure there is a great room there for everyone's taste and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Deb_Cpep
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. The location could not have been any better. Can walk to fabulous restaurants and shopping in Vieux Montreal but also close to metro. We had the King Classic......lighting a bit dim in bathroom and temperature control an issue. Continental breakfast just OK but convenient. Staff very accommodating. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandaGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Place d'Armes hotel from March 1-4. The rooms were very spacious, modern decor and very clean. The crown molding, fire place and windows that opened to the street were great touches that made the room just a bit more special. The bathroom was quite large by hotel standards - especially the shower. We didn't really deal with much of the staff but those we did encounter were friendly and smiling. Overall the hotel we pretty quiet and a great stay. My only negatives would be that for a hotel that nice there was way too much black grime (mould?)in the shower for such a nice hotel. As well the lighting isn't great for trying to apply make up etc. Overall the hotel we pretty quiet and a great stay. I would certainly stay again and perhaps love to get a room that had the bathtub which I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: RunninAllOver
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a mid-winter weekend get away to Montreal. We picked this hotel due to its location in Old Montreal, close to restaurants, Notre Dame and the cobblestone streets. From the moment we arrived when the valet service looked after the car until we checked out the service of the staff was top notch. The rooms were nice with hardwood floors and exposed brick. The bar, Suite701, is the perfect spot for a night cap. We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel suite yet!”
Reviews.Author: T15T
Reviews.Content: Just had a stay in the Penthouse Suite at this hotel. Simply unforgettable! I was trying to choose a 4star+ hotel for days and could not make a decision after reading countless reviews. I wanted something cozy since I was only going to be there the 1 night and wanted to relax in room. I wanted space since I was not traveling alone, and I wanted something with restaurants nearby. This hotel is perfect in every category. The suite priced at under $400 was a steal. It was absolutely huge, a gorgeous condo located on the top and 7th floor. 2 bathrooms, master had large shower and tub. The living room area and dining area were so beautifully decorated I could have just sat there and stared around the room the entire evening. From the moment I checked in, service was impeccable. The welcome cocktail and free wi fi were appreciated, as was the continental breakfast in the morning that I did not get to take advantage of. Room service: outstanding! The food was plentiful and delicious. King size bed was comfy with nice bedding, many lamps for mood lighting and gorgeous high ceilings that made you feel you had the entire hotel to yourself. I did not visit the spa this time however, that will be happening in the near future. I can not say enough good things about this hotel- treat yourself and book a suite!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Greatly exceeded my expecations”
Reviews.Author: Chris O
Reviews.Content: Rooms are huge and very comfortably appointed. Small fireplace was completely unexpected but very nice to warm the room each evening. From facilities to toiletries, the bathroom was excellent (rainforest shower, plenty of space, immediate and copious hot water). Definitely consider bringing the family here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't get any better..Second time at the hotel, and loved it as much if not more as the first time!”
Reviews.Author: BanditAngel
Reviews.Content: This time stayed in a junior suite with a balcony on the top floor with terrific views of downtown Montreal! Again, the staff and service was excellent! Can't wait to go back in the summer and will defiintely book a similar room with a balcony so as to enjoy the beautiful sunshine and views!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: PetieNYC
Reviews.Content: Not as great as expected. I had the executive suite....1707. It was two levels and had a super small living room. I'm glad we didn't have friends join us for drinks....there would have been no where for them to sit! Not what the photos show at all! Secondly..... I ordered champagne and cheese for my husbands birthday....even confirmed it when we checkedin....it never arrived...lastly...the bathroom was dirty...cob webs on the floor where the toilet is housed. All in all not the "best in class" service I was expecting. I will choose another place when I return. If you decide to stay make sure they don't do the bait and switch with the rooms......

Reviews.Title: “Made a difficult weekend wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWajs
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I met at this hotel coming from 2 different directions last June. We needed to take a trip out of the country to satisfy his visa waiver requirements. I got stuck in Chicago in a tornado, and he had trouble at the border and was told by the Canadian customs he'd likely get turned back when he tried to come into the US. When we finally met up, the US border patrol informed us that Canada doesn't count as leaving the country any more, so we had to regroup instantly, stay another night, then he had to fly to the UK from Montreal (don't even get me started on the cost and inconvenience of this-thanks uncle sam). The staff in the hotel were absolutely fantastic. They upgraded us to a suite, which was probably the nicest room we've ever stayed in. We had so many logistics and complications, and they were with us every step of the way. I have actually called up since and asked if I could buy the shampoo and conditioner because I've never found anything as good in 25 years of business travel. The first floor and lower level restaurants were both delicious. I cannot say enough about how great it was. If we are ever able to stomach going out of the country again by car, we will head straight to Le Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Johnquardt
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes is a fantastic boutique hotel located in the Vieux-Port. My husband and I went for a romantic weekend and absolutely loved it! Our suite was spacious and decor modern - the red brick wall in the room is a great accent piece. Soaker tub in the large bathroom was nice, but the jets quite noisy. The staff was very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: cjm_miller
Reviews.Content: My anniversary falls within days of Valentines Day making it both a fun and expensive time to celebrate. This year my husband and I decided to leave the kids home and head to Montreal for a romantic evening away. We decided on the Le Place d'Armes based on the reviews and the Valentines Package they offered. The package included a junior suite, half hour massage at Rain Spa, welcome drink at the bar, small bottle of champagne and cookies at turn down and an in-room continental breakfast. The suite was huge and comfortable. Everything was clean and the hotel was quiet. I loved the jetted soaking tub. My husband was partial to the huge rain shower. The fireplace was electric and we could not seem to get it to work, but that was not a big deal to us. The spa was located in the hotel building. A restaurant and upscale cocktail lounge ( that also serves food) were located on site as well. In the summer it's great to walk around the city, but when it's freezing outside it's nice to be able to have everything in one location! We had dinner at the lounge and enjoyed good drinks, food and interesting people watching. We did choose to walk around a bit (Rue St. Paul) and visited some Old Montreal shops which were only a few blocks away. The in-room breakfast was quite good and large. It included a hot beverage, juice, toast, baked goods ( muffins, croissants,) protien (yogurt, hard boiled egg) and fruit. We only spent a day, but left feeling recharged and refreshed. The hotel is located close to the science museum, so we are looking forward to returning with the kids. FYI- if you are looking for the stores and excitement of St. Catherine Street prepare for a long walk or stay somewhere closer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TogaTravellers
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here back in early December during a weekend trip to Montreal. The room was just beautiful. I loved the decor and the bed was very comfortable. The location is perfect. Plan to stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in the midst of refined old architecture in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LilyPod72
Reviews.Content: We spent Valentine's night at this grand hotel as we were lured by the attractive package which included: A junior suit with a fire place and a big soaker tub and rain shower, bottle of good champagne, 30 min massage each, a rose turn down, macaroons and a continental breakfast for two... IN BED. This made for an unforgettable Valentine's day for us both and we will be sure to stay at the Place d' Armes again. It was AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: V M
Reviews.Content: Went for a romantic getaway for one night and we went all out renting the executive suite. Pros: Clean Big room Very fast service Great bathroom (Jet tub and rain shower) Comfortable bed Room Service (Great flank steak and breakfast service (didn't even have to call; you fill out a form and leave it on the door)) Cons: TV in bedroom did not work (called maintenance and told us "This is the worst TV and the only one that gives us problems!" We ended up only being able to watch one channel once they opened it for us) Kinda chilly, fireplace is just for looks No mini-fridge Fire station right across the street (hope you like hearing sirens all night) P.S Heads up don't touch or use anything unless reading the card, you might have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat-and we will!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaLovethesun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Montreal this past weekend for an overnight stay- a change of scenery and to spend some quality time together. I found Le Place D'Armes hotel after looking on TA for something special, a hotel that wasnt a cookie cutter from a chain The reviews were excellent and just were just what we were looking for. We requested an early check in by email and received a response within 24 hours that they would try their best to accomodate our request. Upon arriving at the hotel, almost 2 hours before check in, we were greeted by Nicholas and we were happy to see our request was met. He also let us know that for a small fee, we could upgrade to either a king room for $20.00/day or to a junior suite with a king bed, fireplace, jacuzzi tub and balcony for $35.00/day. I asked to see the rooms and Nicholas was extremely pleasant, giving us a tour of the hotel, explaining the history and the different additions to the hotel. We loved the jr suite he showed us and didnt think twice about upgrading. The room was twice the size of the standard room we had booked, with a brick wall running through the bedroom to the ensuite. A huge kingsize bed, a lovely sitting area, with wall unit that had a flatscreen tv over the electric fireplace, and floor to celing windows that lead to a balcony made up the room.The bathroom was beautiful. It was spacious, with a large walkin in rainshower, a stand alone jacuzzi tub for 2, with a tv and sink and vanity. Bathrobes included. We fell in love with the room immedidately! We received a card for 2 free drinks in the lounge Suite 701 which we used after a day of shopping (value $22.00), which in our minds made up for the $25.00 cost for valet parking. We had a great night at the hotel and just loved the atmosphere, the surroundings and the helpful and friendly staff. When we got up the next morning, we were dismayed to find that we had no hot water for a shower before leaving for breakfast. We called down and were told it may take up to an hour for the problem to be fixed, so we requested a complimentary room service breakfast be sent up and the gentleman at the front desk didnt hesitate for a second and told us to give our order to room service and it would be on the hotel. Breakfast arrived and it was fantastic! The water still wasnt fixed before we left, but the manner in which the problem was dealt with, did not change our opinion of the service and experience we had! We plan to go back in the summer when the weather is nicer to visit the rooftop terrace and the Rainspa and make it a tradition when we need a little getaway! Thank you Hotel Place D'Armes!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and winter prices”
Reviews.Author: Bondsammax
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in an Executive suite which was quite large with a living room, bedroom both with TVs), a large bathroom and a powder room. There was a DVD player, a large bathtub & an electric fireplace. The water was hot and there was good water pressure except if you used the rainshower- it was too big for the amount of water pressure so the water was only a trickle. The fireplace did little except make a lot of noise & turn on by itself in the night. The room was on the floor with the spa so you walked by treatment rooms on the way to the room. Otherwise, a nice room. The staff were friendly. The location in old Montreal was great. There are 2 Starbucks nearby, places for breakfast (a bit fewer on weekends) and nice restaurants all within walking distance. The metro is 1 block away so it is easy to get to other places in town. We like the area and come here about every 18 mo & will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms in the heart of old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: RandRTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were fantastic - high ceilings, beautiful sitting area and the bathrooms are stunning. Really enjoyed the bath room product - very high quality. The restaurant (Suite 701) in the hotel was very good - had a 3 course table d'hote January special that was delicious. Would only recommend adding coffee service in the mornings in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: plattsburgher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the first time at this hotel two weeks ago. We have stayed at many great places in Montreal, but this one has quickly risen right to the top! Fantastic location in Old Montreal, very walkable to nearly everything or via Metro access. Beautiful facility, classy, modern rooms with great amenities. Service was ultra-gracious and we had a fantastic time. Since it was sub-zero during our visit we spent a lot of time indoors and greatly enjoyed both the lounge and restaurant as well. The only minor detraction is that on-site costs are fairly high, but high quality. This was probably more noticeable to us because we did not want to venture far for snacks/food/drinks, etc. Beautiful facility- you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Montreal ...”
Reviews.Author: DogwoodTravelAgcy
Reviews.Content: I have been to Montreal many times, this was my first time staying at Le Place d'Armes. First I am a high end hotel person, who is very picky, and our clients also have the same taste. Let me say, this hotel was five star all the way. The concierge staff was always around, extremely helpful and got us to where we wanted to go. A reservation at Garde Manager was the icing on the cake! Everyone from reception, to room and turndown service was exceptional. The hotel bar/lounge 701 is quite a hopping scene, great people watching, and the Manager was extremely friendly and gracious to the guests. The pool table in the lobby was also a nice place to kick back on a snowy afternoon, watch some hockey and play some pool. Also, to note, the RainSpa. It was fabulous. Anyone who says otherwise, and reading some of the reviews, is totally befuddling. The space was great and Diana was terrific. I have stayed at 10 or more different hotels in town, and this has been bar far the best. Great location in the Old City and absolutely terrific and friendly staff. I will be coming back, and will be recommending my clients go as well! Thanks from the NY'ers!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutyfree1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing...right in the heart of Old Montreal, it features incredible decor, architecture, amenities and service. The junior suite was beautiful with a grand bathroom that featured a claw foot tub and rain shower. The spa in the hotel is also fantastic. The entire experience was wonderful and even though we live close by Montreal, I felt like we were in a beautiful hotel in Europe - even if only for a weekend. Well worth it! I travel alot on business and this hotel is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to enjoy Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Melissa H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great (I've stayed in a lot of hotels). Their lobby is top-notch with a nice lounge. It's right in the heart of Old Montreal, but easy to get to and they have a very helpful valet service. The Penthouse Suit was nice and spacious with a great soaker tub, but it did not include a kitchenette or mini-fridge. The min bar is well stocked and reasonably priced. I had my 10-month old son with me and they even had a crib made up for him. This is a nice change from a chain hotel and add a lot of charm and character to your Montreal trip.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: MandySue_86
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing, the service was excellent the room was spectacular & the location was great! Notre dame was right across the road & we were walking distance to everything ! Will definitely be staying here when we get the chance to return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SydFam40
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here a week before Christmas - and what a wonderful time we had. We stayed in a Junior Suite - with the kids in the City package. The room had a great amount of space - the kids were accommodated upstairs on a sofa bed and rollaway - provided at no extra charge - and we in a king bed downstairs. There was a toilet and hand basin upstairs which was very handy and the spa bath in the downstairs bathroom was fantastic after a cold day out and about. There was a second TV upstairs for the kids, which again was handy and meant we could have some space and quiet time! We had breakfast included - which was a continental buffet - which was a perfectly adequate start to the day - the bagels and pastries where nice and fresh. The location of the hotel was perfect for everything we wanted to see, and most everything was within walking distance. The complimentary hot chocolate in the evening was lovely when coming in from the bitter cold. This was a great hotel with wonderful staff. We would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to discover Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: mannemel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Labor Day weekend 2011. I booked through hotels.com for a Queen room and got a small room; however, it was charmingly decorated and overall we really liked the hotel. It is well located on the fringe of Old Montreal, but easy walking distance from downtown. We enjoyed cocktails in both the restaurant as well as the roof bar, and I also used the gym (which was not very large but serviceable). I would definitely consider staying here again when I come back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Classy. The location and rooms are second to none, however, not a home away fro”
Reviews.Author: Wells72
Reviews.Content: We had a junior executive suite and were happy with the size, cleanliness and location. The staff cleaned our room twice a day. Our fireplace was not working the first day and upon calling recepetion it was fixed in under 30 mins.This hotel was great, however, the wifi was constantly in and out, the room service breakfast was cold, expensive and not very good. If you required additionals like a coffee maker, newspaper or tea, there were additional charges. It has all the feeling of a hotel and little of the feelings of a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time!”
Reviews.Author: kadustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight at Le Place d'Armes. Our room was gorgeous - very clean and spacious. Loved the fireplace in the room and the shower was amazing with the rain showerhead. The staff was attentive and helpful in recommending local restaurants and getting us reservations. We enjoyed a drink at the bar in the evening and a continental breakfast at the hotel in the morning. We had a package that included parking, a cocktail when we arrived, and continental breakfast. The breakfast was good, but expensive. Had we not had it included in our package, we definitely would had skipped it. The location of the hotel was excellent. We were able to walk the city from the hotel and not use our car until it was time to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience; accommodating, comfortable & effortless.”
Reviews.Author: Valeriejeans
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Old Montreal and right near the train station for further exploration. Notre Dame is literally one street over on a diagonal. Stayed for 3 days which was a perfect amount of time to see the neighborhood vicinity. Close to all sights but just out of the way enough to avoid noise and bustle. Also must make it a point as to how nice everyone was at this hotel (and the city in general!) Due to an overbooking, we were asked if we'd be willing to step down from our junior suite to a king suite in which they offered us daily continental breakfast for two and parking included (a major value) for the "inconvenience." If you can call it that, even! Everyone was happy to assist in any way possible. You can tell they very much care about the quality of your stay. Definitely reccomend, but I'm curious about their affiliated hotels as well (all very close by.) Free Internet was nice, only it didn't work great in our room. Possibly the brick walls? Hallway and lobby had full strength. Used the welcome cocktail vouchers for cappuccino to go, which was cool. Rain shower and was awesome, super roomy and easy for couple showers.

Reviews.Title: “Andrew's visit”
Reviews.Author: Andrew K
Reviews.Content: Our visit was on 29-12-11 & 30-12-11. Would recommend to anyone - especially for romantic getaway. A great boutique hotel with character and great location. Service was excellent. Friendly, knowledgeable staff - eager to assist you. Excellent restaurant recommendations. Located in Old Montreal. Room was clean perhaps newly renovated. Great bar/club located in hotel. Perfect for us. Dress up or go semi-casual. Hotel staff - excellent. Thanks again. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty but a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: geetabix
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and in a really convenient location (in Old Montreal, a short walk from downtown and steps from the Metro station). We were upgraded to a Superior King which had incredible high ceilings, huge windows, exposed brick, and a lot of space. Honestly, it was huge! The bathroom was as big as our bedroom at home. The room was clean and modern and the bathroom with the huge rainshower was also very upscale (although the dark grey decor a bit prisony!) It was very nice that the hotel was willing to hold our luggage for us as we checked out a few hours before our flight. There were a couple of downsides: Wi-fi was free, but signal was a little hard to find as everything was brick. On the last day of our stay, our room was not cleaned and the towels were not changed. The fireplace did not work. I'm not sure whether or not this had anything to do with the hotel, but the sidewalk on the east side of the building was not salted while there was freezing rain, so it was treacherous getting up the hill. This would be a big problem for anyone with mobility issues. We got a deal for $125/night so it felt like reasonably good value, but I'm not sure I'd feel the same at $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Alexandrac126
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Place d'Armes in Montreal. The hotel is beautiful, the staff are wonderfully polite and helpful. True professionals. We were given an upgrade to a beautiful room. Bathroom are large and spa like. The hotel is very well appointed and I would go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “NYE trip”
Reviews.Author: Firstimer40
Reviews.Content: -10 hr. drive from PA was well worth it! - friendly staff - great location to Notre Dame and St. Paul Street - classy, yet not too stuffy - accommodating front desk - helped to make NYE dinner reservations - two classy restaurants open - poor water pressure for shower - TV remote didn't work

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: RedSeaNomad
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this Notre dame gem. The rooms are spacious albeit with more than a hint of 70s decor, however the exposed red brick improves the ambiance. After a misunderstanding at breakfast the restaurant manager went out of her way to be helpful and impressed us with her service. I would stay here again if I visit Montreal again. I used tripadvisor find this and many other hotels, so this is to give something back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, some kinks to work out”
Reviews.Author: Quarkstream
Reviews.Content: We just spent three night in a junior suite at Place d'Armes. Everyone we dealt with, from the valet to the concierge to the bartender, was unfailingly polite and pleasant.The building itself is beautiful, and our room and bathroom were huge, clean and well appointed. Suite 701 is a very lively hotel bar which was a nice place to have a drink before heading out to dinner, and my partner raved about Rainspa, where he had a soak and a massage.That said, there were a few quirks. The bathroom had a marvelous jacuzzi bathtub - that once started, wouldn't shut off. The wifi is free - but my ipad kept losing the signal, and when I could connect, download speeds reminded me of my first dial-up modem 15 years ago. We came back to take a nap the first day at noon, to find the cleaning lady just arriving. She said she'd come back later - but she clearly forgot, and after we left and came back again at 6, the room still hadn't been cleaned. The place has the feel of an ambitious startup - everyone seems keen to make a good impression, but there seem to be a lot of "newbie" mistakes that are a bit odd for a hotel 10 years old. Had we paid full price and had the staff been less pleasant, I'd likely look elsewhere next time we head north. But the "buy two stay a third night free" deal is excellent, and the staff was so nice, I would go back and hope for a smoother experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, decor, restaurant and staff. Stayed there with extended family - the teenagers enjoyed the billards table and variety of public places to 'hang out'. Large lodging rooms with fireplaces and roomy bathrooms. Front desk staff was most gracious and welcoming. Look forward to going back.Highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: deanhToronto
Reviews.Content: Great location, great amenities and GREAT SERVICE! I have stayed at this property twice. During my first stay I had some minor service issues. I brought them to the attention of Jennifer, the Front Office Manager and she immediately addressed them for me. My second stay was flawless! The staff was incredably helpful and friendly. It was my birthday and several of the staff acknowledged it during my stay. You don't get that everywhere!! I am returning again this week for another special occassion in Montreal. Can't wait to get there! Don't hesitate to stay at this property. They will make your next trip to Montreal memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Place D'Armes”
Reviews.Author: 2travel65
Reviews.Content: Penthouse suite is a must, Excellent service, they brought me up a fruit and cookie tray for a welcome gift, hotel staff very friendly and quick service if you order anything for your room. My favorite place to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Surveillez votre carte de credit !”
Reviews.Author: roclic71
Reviews.Content: Si vous allez a cet hÃ´tel, surveillez les frais qui seront facturer sur votre carte de crÃ©dit. Peu de dÃ©tails fournis au check-in et peu d'explications fournis par la suite, aprÃ¨s votre dÃ©part. Service aprÃ¨s-vente inexistant et loin dâ€™Ãªtre a la hauteur de cet Ã©tablissement. Ã‰videment, compte tenu de mon expÃ©rience , je dÃ©conseille fortement cet Ã©tablissement pour les raisons Ã©voques ci-haut. Sauf si, bien sur, les frais ne sont pas sur VOTRE carte de crÃ©dit !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: teeceeTO
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel perfectly located near Old Montreal and the downtown core. Literally a stone's throw from Notre Dame Cathedral. Well-appointed and spacious room, free wi-fi, large clean bathroom. Great for business, but also a perfect choice for touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff, fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: andreavermont
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel the night before going to Montreal (we are only 90 minutes away) based purely on tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. When we arrived (early) the man at the desk was very polite and let us know to come back in an hour. So we roamed Vieux Montreal and when we came back our room was ready and not only was it ready, but we had been upgraded to a Junior Suite! It was really well appointed, tastefully decorated and had an awesome soaking tub and rain shower. The hotel was in the perfect location, just between Old Montreal and within a 10 minute walk of St. Catherine Street and Eaton center. The room overlooked a major street in Montreal but was very quiet. If you have the option, book room 2503 and you will see what I mean. I will absolutely stay there again! And it was reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge Man to the Rescue...”
Reviews.Author: Quynh G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into this hotel really late on Nov 24th. We were exhausted and needed sleep ASAP. A Filipino woman at the front desk was really nice but gave us the most horrible room on the first floor right next to the room where the cleaning staff constantly went in and out of. We kept waking up throughout the night and in the early morning because of the cleaning staff and footsteps (not carpeted on the first floor). We were miserable. The following morning, Nov 25th, we went to the concierge and the older Frenchman with glasses (had a very friendly smile and soft spoken voice) was SO AMAZINGLY KIND to us! I was too shy to get his name. But he upgraded us and put us on the other side of the building and gave us a great room. He was just so nice to me and my husband. It really made our whole trip pleasant and so much better. He is the reason why we will stay there when we return in the summer. Every concierge should have someone like him! He made sure we were happy and comfortable. Thank you!! Quynh & Peter Glasson

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Jamie P
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night and had our room upgraded to a superior king! The bathroom was bigger than my bedroom at home. Bed was enormous and comfy - welcome cocktail voucher was provided, though, they were using Suite 701 for a special event, so we had to forfeit our voucher. Chocolates on the pillows were tasty, WiFi was fast, staff was inviting and accommodating. Fire alarm went off, but I'd rather be safe than sorry. Rooms were quiet and we slept like babies. Would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Event at Opera room”
Reviews.Author: jprlauzier
Reviews.Content: With my student association, we organized a professional cocktail for 90 attendees. It's the second year that we choose this hotel for this event. Two times at Opera AB room. We also had conferences, so one side of the room was with chairs (Theatre configuration) and the rest for the cocktail. It's really great to work with the staff. They are present during all the evening to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of old and new”
Reviews.Author: steakum1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed three times now. Twice for business and once for leisure. In all instances this hotel has exceeded expectations. It has a rambling lobby layout with separate rooms including a billiard table and lots of cozy nooks to relax or meet informally. The real win is the rooms. I had the pleasure of an executive suite this past time complete with self cleaning jetted tub. Two flat panel tvs, stereo, rain shower, and bug comfy bed. Easily my favorite hotel out there and I stay 40+ nights a year in hotels. The service is great as well. When I left my passport behind they called me!

Reviews.Title: “A decent choice, good location but very "1990s" dated.”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days on business and the location is very good as the hotel straddles downtown and Old Montreal perfectly and I could walk to both without a problem. The suites are large and quite comfortable but the rooms have this very 1990's aesthetic that I can't really explain. Nonetheless, the poor aesthetic is quickly replaced by beautiful bathrooms and decent service. Next time, I would likely stay at the St. Paul as it seems to be a more interesting option in the heart of Old Montreal but this hotel works just as well. Also, the breakfast is terribly dissapointing and the service in the morning is bad. Opt out of a breakfast package and get something in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Room and Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: FTopGirl
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a few nights on business and checked in to the Place d'Armes. Fabulous! The bathroom is enourmous with a huge white tub and separate shower (also huge). The king bed was extremely comfortable, the temperature in the room was perfect. The television was also very large and clear. Wi-fi internet was free and the connection was excellent. The work chair at the desk was uncomfortable, but I was only sitting there working for a few hours befre heading to meetings. The location in Old Montreal is equally fabulous! On Place d'Armes Square, facing the Notre-Dame Basilica, it is steps away from a metro station. Highly recommend this property - would like to have stayed longer and have included my boyfriend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: ColadaRC
Reviews.Content: My husband, another couple and I just returned home from a weekend in Old Montreal, staying at Le Place d'Armes and we couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel. We were looking for a mature, classy hotel that was surrounded by a good selection of restaurants. This was the perfect spot to satisfy all of these... and one of the nicest hotels my husband and I have ever stayed at. The service was excellent, the rooms were very clean, spacious and stunning, the location was perfect for our demographic. We all agreed to come back another time during the summer. Special thanks to the concierge for their restaurant recommendations and help with directions. We will definitely be back to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at..”
Reviews.Author: Pdorgan
Reviews.Content: Close to Old Montreal, a great hotel plenty of character, excellent staff, just a delight to visit. stay here about 2 to 3 times per year when in Montreal would stronglynreccomd it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed from the start!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Le Place d'Armes as we toured New England and Montreal (Quebec). From the moment we stepped in the hotel we were welcomed with smiles and hospitatilty, critical for us first-timers to Montreal. The hotel was class, the resturaunt was fabulous, and we had a great time relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Vieux Montreal describes itself as a boutique but if is closer to a full service hotel as it offers room service, has a fitness centre and spa, is attached to meeting rooms, has two restaurants and bars. The building is three historic buildings and thus the rooms vary in size and layout but they all appear to offer mice modern appointments and amenities. The standard king we stayed in was quite roomy. The only complaint about the room was the lack of a coffee maker which we find more convenient than calling room service or going out to one of the many nearby coffee shops. The location is excellent for walking around old Montreal, a 10 minute walk to Place des Beaux Arts and a little further to the main downtown area. We found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and helpful. Because we were attending for a conference, we received a very reasonable rate for the room. I would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “MEDZONE advisory meeting”
Reviews.Author: e S
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel in the early AM for an important advisory meeting with medical specialists. This hotel responded to all our business needs and the staff was proactive, gracious and pleasant. Coincidentally, I went back for a completely different business meeting 6 hours later with another group of medical clients. The night time ambiance was friendly, trendy, chic and engaging. The staff found a quiet corner away from the crowds and set me up to have a relaxing drink and appetizer prior to meeting my second group of VIP clients.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: mambola1
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mix of old and new. Nice old building with well appointed rooms - dark woden floors, nice black and white floor tiles in the bathroom - bit of a modern twist on old style charm. Comfortable bed. Shower pressure was useless but apart from that pretty decent. Would be pleased to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dave and Julie M
Reviews.Content: Le Place d'Armes is fantastic. My wife and I loved the room â€“ the bed was extremely comfortable and the dÃ©cor was excellent. Each and every one of the staff were completely accommodating. It is obvious that all staff take great pride in their work however, housekeeping deserves special mention for their attention to every single detail, every single day of our seven day stay. I rate their customer service at 100 percent. Its location in old Montreal is superb and you are right on top of great restaurants, art galleries, shopping and pubs. You practically walk out of the back door, cross the street and are at the subway station. Cross another street and you are in Chinatown. If you like to walk, you are only 20 minutes or so from St. Catherine Street and excellent shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Night!”
Reviews.Author: Veronique_Mtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Place d'Armes Hotel and Suites and it was a pure delight! When we entered our room, dimmed lighting, slight classical music was playing and the room was warmed just enough (not too much) by the fireplace: we were already under the spell of the hotel! We have dinner at the brasserie 701 which is connected to the hotel; we had excellent beef tartare with a glass of delicious Pinot Grigio. We've slept heavenly in the bed until we've awaken the next morning with the firm belief that we have to come back; it was just that great!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Nordi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in this hotel once before, in a Junior Suite, and when we decided to spend a night away from the kids in Montreal again, we naturally chose this hotel. We again chose the Junior Suite (the price of the room was actually cheaper than a deluxe room when we booked). The Suite is large and equipped with a sitting area, King size bed, VCR/DVD, LCD TV and a VERY large bathroom (with both a Jacuzzi tub and a multiple nozzle shower). Within an hour of checking in, management sent along a 'welcome' fruit plate. Staff was extremely eager to please and helpful (our door keys wouldn't work when we first arrived, and the front desk staff accompanied my wife back to check the door, open it for us, and then rekeyed the cards and brought them to us in the room - I've stayed in places where I've had to rekey the cards at least once a day, and the ownice is on the guest to do everything!). The location is fairly central in the Vieux Port - bars, restaurants and shopping are within walking distance (Rue Saint-Catherine is only about a 10 minute walk). We didn't experience the restaurant or the spa, so we can't comment on those, but the bar was fairly lively (although a bit expensive), and served a good Continental Breakfast the next morning. Would I stay here again? Definitely! Because of the location and quality of the room, I would have expected a higher price, but it is a moderately priced and inexpensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: LaCoquette
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel recently, for a 2 nights stay. The staff is very nice, polite, and when we needed something, it was done by the minute. We had a junior suite, the bed was comfortable but the pillows we didnt like. They are long and not very puffy. Nice continental breakfast at Suite 701 restaurant, we also had diner there, if you go on friday/saturday make sure to reserve. It's the perfect hotel for couples who visit Montreal, just beside Notre Dame church.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercerjd
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled to Montreal for a short getaway. The hotel was in a great location. Upon arrival, the staff was very helpful and upgraded our room. There was a wonderful fitness center and water was provided to us throughout our stay. Our room was well apportioned with two queen beds and a fireplace. We enjoyed meals at Aix Cuisine du Terroir and Suite 701. Suite 701 was by far our favorite. The portions were very generous. Le Place d'Armes is in a great location. It is close to Notre Dame and other sites so you won't mind walking. There is also a metro station in close proximity. We used the metro several times without any problems. Also, there were plenty of restaurants and coffee shops around the hotel as well. You have a good selection of food choices if you choose to eat outside of the hotel. During our stay, there was road construction on the street leading to the hotel. This was in mid June 2011. So, access to that street was blocked for vehicles and traffic was re-directed. But, the road construction didn't interfere with our travel since we were traveling on foot. And, amazingly, we were not disturbed by construction noises in our hotel room. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again when traveling to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kalane1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011, this hotel is truly wonderful! The location is within walking distance of all attractions! The rooms are very large and very clean, they are well appointed. We loved the rooftop bar it was a great place to relax. All the staff is so very helpful and eager to please. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and right in old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jmctex60
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a wonderful stay. The bed was comfortable, in view of Notre Dame, Montreal. There was no coffee in the room and we called down and in 5 mins a pot and supplies were delivered for our next morning wake up cup.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Weekend Getaway - Le Place d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: ToddlerTravelNYC
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very relaxing stay at Le Place d'Armes Hotel last weekend - for a children-free short. The hotel lived up to all of the good recommendations online. The staff was exceptionally helpful and kind, pointing us in all of the right directions for restaurant recommendations. Many thanks to Jose who spent generous time trying to book things for us. I also want to highlight the great spa service I had at the hotel's Rainspa. I last minute scheduled an early am massage before we left with Quentin - having had no point of reference (not something I would do in NYC). It was one of the best massages I ever had. Having a history of lower back pain - I am still pain free almost one week after the treatment. We highly recommend the hotel for a weekend getaway or longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Lucky find of a good hotrl in the old town in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Walter H
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed an excellent two-night stay in the Hotel des Armes in Montreal so we thought we should tell you about it.. Apart from being in an excellent position, actually in the Old Town, the hotel, is in three original old buildings which have been beautifully restored and stylishly furnished to give spacious accommodation and airy reception, lounges and comfortable rooms. We found that there were three restaurants but we only ate in the restaurant/brasserie on the ground floor. We enjoyed superb food both evenings we were there. Over the two evenings we noticed that the manager of the restaurant, Eric, was almost ever-present in the restaurant, chatting with the diners and his staff and generally ensuring that his staff who we must say were very friendly, were able to serve all the guests in good time.

Reviews.Title: “Conference room rental”
Reviews.Author: Sandra F
Reviews.Content: Our company has rented conference rooms and held many meetings and corporate events at Place D'Armes and we were extremely satisfied with their service. There was always someone to greet and help with the setup and make sure we have everything we needed. More importantly, technical service was efficient and really went out of their way (even when it is your own equipment). The rooms are clean and beautiful and staff is great. The only negative thing is that they charge for the conference room for the whole day regardless if you only need it for half a day or an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rinkrat
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this fabulous hotel. Had I known in advance how wonderful it was...I would have spent our entire vacation here. Stayed in the penthouse suite which was amazing and definately worth the additional charge. Very roomy and comfortable. (best soaking tub ever!!) Had a minor problem with the AC...but the hotel was very quick to address and correct the problem. Had breakfast and cocktails at the 701 and service was wonderful at both occasions. Location was perfect for visiting old Montreal. Metro was nearby, but we walked everywhere. I also visited the spa...which of course... was wonderful. (seems to be a repeated comment !!) Special thanks to Madeline (I hope I have that correct) for making this the best Anniversary trip ever:)

Reviews.Title: “A MEMORABLE TWO DAYS”
Reviews.Author: Ronald M
Reviews.Content: Smooth checkin upon arrival. Excellent drinks and desserts at the street level cocktail lounge. Possibly the best cosmos in North America! Same for the roof top restaurant! The front end staff is to be especially commended. Magil was outstanding! She gave us clear directions and even made reservations for us at a nearby restaurant! My daughter Linda and I will be sure to return!!! Ron Mather Peabody Massachusetts.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: DennisPolly
Reviews.Content: Everything of this hotel is fantastic. The staff are as good as one can hope for.The restaurant is a fine food experience. The only issue that we had was a creaking floor in the bedroom. Yes, i woke my wife every time i went to the bathroom during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Alain F
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel mostly because it is just next to the convention center (Palais des congrÃ¨s) where I was going. But next time I'm going to Montreal that's my hotel. The staff was great very helpful to find good restaurants in the area and they serve you with a smile; that does make a difference. The breakfast at the hotel is delicious. It made my stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, location, food. Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: algreen2000
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Place d'Armes once before and at its sister hotel the Nelligan several times. The last time we were at the Place d'Armes we had a larger room on the same side (facing China town) but I liked this room much better since 2 walls had big high windows with wide enough sills to sit and watch the view. It was in the oldest part of the building so it's smaller but very comfortable. We also ate at the hotel restaurant Aix. The food was fantastic and the service superb! This is a great place to pamper yourself and it's very convenient for sightseeing in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NorthShoreZfoodie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning hotel. We stayed in a suite with exposed brick, beautiful furnishings and a sense of charm rarely had at such a price. The complimentary cheese and wine were an extremely nice touch every evening. Location was great and would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AgathaSFO
Reviews.Content: Everything was just as it should be. We stayed in a junior suite. More room than we needed but worth it for the tub and little extras. Good movie choices. Room service food isn't overpriced as in most hotels, breakfast choices were good, food fresh and well prepared and the coffee is stupendous. We enjoyed an evening in the bar and the little promo stuff they give you. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a meeting.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: Even though it was a small meeting, every detail was gone over meticulously and double checked. The Salon was perfect, the AV team top-notch, the wait staff perfect and the food was outstanding. Special congratulations to Carole, Raphael and Ricky.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in glorious Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with the Hotel Place d'Armes. We had a great Junior Suite that was full of amenities and even an electric fireplace. The bathroom was truly luxe with a huge jetted tube and a stall shower with two showerheads--one hand-held and the a rain shower. The service is top notch. We had the great good fortune to avail ourselves of the superb concierge service provided by Mlle. Magil Tertrault. She managed to get us into every restaurant we wanted and where we received VIP treatment at every meal. I would highly recommend this place...and it's not even that expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, discreet.”
Reviews.Author: aorrdalca
Reviews.Content: A stylish and well-located hotel in Montreal's old neighborhood. Very close to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, excellent service, but a few bad points”
Reviews.Author: IowaCityMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept, with some friends. It is a very convenient hotel, service was excellent. Room decor very interestingmix of old and contemporary. However, avoid the 2 rooms on the first floor located near the conference rooms. They are VERY noisy, especially early in the AM when the staff is setting up. Our friends had to move becseu the noise was so loud. Also, we had substantial problems with the Wi-Fi in these rooms, When we mentioned both these problems, they said, yes, these rooms are a problem and are the last to be assigned! They offered us a wired connection for the internet, but that's no good for an iPad. Both if you avoid these rooms, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The mark of a good hotel is....”
Reviews.Author: albion223
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay @Le Place D'Armes since 2009... Basic facts: The hotel is chic, possessing a blend of old architecture with a contemporary decor. Located on the fringes of Old Montreal and a short walking distance to the many shops and restaurants of the old city. Rooms are clean, comfortable and well maintained, staff polite and helpful (which was a definite plus...read below for details). Our review: When we arrived our reservation was erroneously logged by the hotel for another weekend. The front office manager, Ms Jennifer Fabris, took charge of this oversight and took personal care in making sure that both my wife and I were satisfied with our accommodations, and left us a personal note with a bottle of wine in our room. To me the mark of a good business/hotel is making sure that your customers are treated with respect and when a problem occurs that it is taken care of promptly and to the customers satisfaction. On all accounts Le Place D'Armes met and exceeded in rectifying this error. Our accommodations were great, the rooms beautiful and the bathroom was spotless and well appointed. The only downside was the late night noise from a few well intoxicated walkers on the street below that woke us up on two nights. Other than that we enjoyed our stay very much, and with our daughter considering attending McGill University, we may find ourselves at the Place D'Armes a few more times in the future....

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: svansleet
Reviews.Content: At first I was concerned because there was no where to park in front of the hotel. When I went in to ask what we should do no one appeared to want to help or to speak with me. Once I got an attendant's attention things changed completely. We were treated very well. The room was very nice. LOVED the rain shower. The hotel is in a great location close to everything. It was more pricey than hotels we usually stay at but it was totally worth the extra money. LOVED the AIX restaurant located in the hotel. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pearl657
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here. The first time was in a regular room, this time in a junior suite. The first thing I could say is "what's the difference?" For the extra 10 feet of living room, we were paying about $10 per foot extra. The hotel is beautiful. It is a refurbished military building (last century), lots of exposed brick, high ceilings, big windows (that open), and stunning bathrooms that rival European hotel rooms in size. There is a fantastic restaurant in the hotel on the lower level as well as a stunningly beautiful bar at street level. Take heed though, this bar gets going on weekends and we have heard that you don't want a room over top of the bar if you are a light sleeper. This time around we were blessed with beautiful weather and the rooftop bar was open. It was a great spot to chillax in the afternoon after a day of walking through town. We didn't go, but it must be gorgeous at night. Upon arrival guest are given a coupon for two complimentary drinks. These are not for premium drinks and can only be used at the lobby bar. The restaurant is great value for the quality of food and the service is outstanding. Both times we stayed in building three and highly recommend it, although we never stayed "on the other side". Our junior suite had a beautiful jet tub and a shower you could park a Harley in. I thought the rain head was just a gimmick....it was lovely. The only reason I gave it a 4/5 was since we came last year, the hotel is looking a tad run down. Water stains and bubbling wallpaper in the halls, chips in the wood, the odd scratch and ding in the drywall and a loose window railing in our room. Am I picky?, not really...do I notice little things? yeah. I would still recommend this hotel. The staff are pleasant, it's a beautiful hotel in a great location with a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Aix Du Terroir Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Eventsmontreal
Reviews.Content: The food, service and wines chosen by the sommelier were all excellent. Yannick, our head waiter made sure that all 40 of our group were satisfied and served.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel very well situated”
Reviews.Author: forbes1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 4 nights in this hotel and really enjoyed it. Friendly staff and reasonably priced food in the restaurants. The "smart" restaurant is specially good value. A good location in the old town for the tourist. We had a junior suite and it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel with fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: BanditAngel
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights in this luxurious hotel a few weeks ago..Took advantage of the Rainspa where I treated myself to a Tropical massage..OUt of this world fantastic!! Our room was exceptionally big (with two bathrooms, separate living room, windows)! The jacuzzi bathtub was amazing..rain shower with great pressure...huge bathroom!! The terrace on the roof was superb serving great food and the best Bloody Caesars!! The staff was exceptionally good, with first class service! Definitely would stay here again..and again..and again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKIpal
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel in a great location in the old part of town. We spent 4 nights at this hotel and loved the room and the bathroom. We had drinks on the rooftop bar,one evening, which enabled great views of the city. There was torrential rain on one of the days were there and after we returned to the hotel, dripping wet, we decided it was unwise to leave the hotel for dinner. Unfortunately the Bistro/ Bar was closed for a "private booking" (rather disapponting) so we had little option but to book into the more expensive, downstairs Restaurant. It seems that a lot of other guests were forced into a similar position as the restaurant was extremely busy. However, it turned out to be a blessing in disguise as the food was fabulous. This hotel had been recommended to me by a friend and I would have no hesitation in passing on that recommendation .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, classy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Toronto90
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for touring the old city; across from Notre Dame Cathedral. We also walked to shopping on St. Catherine and Crescent Street. Parking is all valet and worked fine; the attendant was friendly and efficient. Check in staff were very friendly; offered an upgrade to a much larger room for $20 but we did not take that. The standard room was a tad small but fine for two people; nicely furnished and a gorgeous bathroom! We were on the sixth floor so no street noise at all. Very comfortable bed. Did not eat at their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “"Enjoyed our stay"”
Reviews.Author: Tessauy
Reviews.Content: It's our first time in montreal & we really had a great time:) the hotel is a perfect location close to old montreal & the basilica. We stayed at the junior suite of the hotel. The staff is very polite, courteous & helpful. Will definitely come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lot's o staff but little service”
Reviews.Author: Mymonae
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a mini vacation and I'd read some great reviews online re this hotel. Plus bonus was that it's located in old Montreal. The room was a junior suite and it was two floors which was lovely...unfortunately the air conditioner was on the fritz and the staff didn't see capable of fixing it. So we graciously accepted another room which was again very nicely decorated and spacious. Aesthetically this hotel is really good value for the dollar that you'll spend but unfortunately there are a couple of places where it falls down. Namely staff service levels. I must have called down to the front desk at least 3 times in one day about the smell of cigar or cigarette smoke wafting through the vents into the room and each time I got the same response...which was that they'd look into it but the problem never did go away. We tried the restaurant/bar for lunch and the service was sub par at best. Although there were clearly more staff than customers you still couldn't get attention to save your life and practically had to stick out your leg and trip a waiter to get the final bill. Room service fare was cold and not only did the toilet break on our stay but the in room cordless phone didn't work. This will be our last stay here. If only aesthetics were enough.....

Reviews.Title: “Workshop for small groups”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: CCA, our company, organised a one day workshop called Applied Creativity for the Business world in this Hotel . We have rented the room called 'St-Jacques' and it was perfect for our workshop - The staff is professional and courteous, the hotel is beautiful and the buffet was exactly was we needed. Here's a little tip for activities occurring during the weekend ; an outside parking is available in front of the hotel. http://cca.vpweb.com/default.html

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place we've ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: nphummel
Reviews.Content: Le Place d'Armes is simply perfect. For the price, I don't think it can be beat. A sizeable hotel with the service of a bed and breakfast. The rooms are immaculate. The concierges are so incredibly friendly and helpful--our personal favorite is Magil. She taught us how to use the Metro was eager to make reservations for us at places that are difficult to get into. The valet guys are friendly and helpful as well. Our ongoing joke involved the stealthiness of the housekeepers--they were like invisible fairies. We'd leave our room for a moment and we'd come back and it would be cleaned top to bottom. Little touches like a card on the nightstand letting you know what the next day's weather would bring, chocolates, and a night-time water bottle are so inviting. If we are ever blessed with the opportunity to visit Montreal again, we will undoubtedly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The best !!!”
Reviews.Author: MTL_John_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is built within two beautiful historic buildings and has been wonderfully renovated. We had a suite which was beautifully designed, very luxurious and comfortable. The hotel is well situated close to shopping, old Montreal, China town and many other features. There is a restaurant/bar on the top of the hotel and the food was really good, the prices reasonnable and the service was excellent. All the hotel staff were extremely nice, polite and helpful. We were there for only one day but plan on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Vinci2008
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the hotel for a long weekend in August. The hotel is in a great location and I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nice, my only comment is that a hotel in this class should have spotless bathrooms and while the bathroom was nice, it was showing some age. There was some construction right next to the hotel which may be complete now, but I would check if you are concerned about noise. This is a beautiful hotel in the heart of Old Montreal just having a few issues that are not uncommon, I would stay again. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! A wonderful part of our visit!”
Reviews.Author: JUng0909
Reviews.Content: From the welcoming staff, beautiful property, well-accommodated room and perfect location, Le Place d'Armes Hotel is a wonderful place to stay in Old Montreal! The place had a very upscale boutique feel...the restaurants and bar in the hotel were superb as well -- but most of all, the service was excellent. The free high-speed wireless internet service helped us stay connected. We were able to walk to anywhere in Old Montreal -- being right across the street from Notre Dame Basilica was wonderful! And even when we wanted to go outside of Old Montreal, the Metro subway was only 2 blocks away. We would definitely stay here when we return to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Friendly Staff, BEST location!”
Reviews.Author: Pooks2Go
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for a long weekend in August. It was the second time we've been to Montreal (first time was in 2006) so we had an idea of neighborhood we wanted to stay in (Old Montreal) and also a familiarity with the city. We picked the Place D'Armes hotel based on a recommendation from Gilt Groupe/Jetsetter.com and we were quite impressed. Location: Best place to be if you want to be in old Montreal. It's right by the Church as well as the waterfront. Hotel: When we arrived the register guy was super friendly and nice. The hotel is a conglomerate of 3 huge old buildings, each has a separate elevator but connect in the lobby. The lobby itself was quite nice and huge considering it's 3 buildings however, it's split into separate rooms and areas so you don't realize how big it is until you walk through it all. The main lobby has a waiting area and there is delicious ice tea available for free. There is also a bar connected to a restaurant (we didn't go) as well as a billiards room which was empty. We stayed in the middle building facing uptown/Chinatown. We had a pretty good size room (we're from NYC so room size is relative to what we get here!) and a great bathroom. Wifi worked well and was free (a plus). Huge flat screen TV with surround sound speakers (although I couldn't figure out how to work them), DVD player, etc. A lot of lamps in the room which was great. Super comfortable king size bed. It was clean and well appointed. The only minus was you can't open the windows - I like fresh air and don't like breathing recycled air. The room was quiet, too. Bathroom was spacious with a huge shower for 2. I would have liked 2 shower heads since it was so big. Bathroom was a tad dark so it was hard to see when getting ready. Great towels. Overall, a great way to spend the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Highflygal
Reviews.Content: There were only three negative points: no complimentary coffee/tea in room; long check out line with only one attendant @ front desk; the server/host @ Suite 701 was terrible: clearly he has chosen the wrong career as he tried to convince every person who entered that they should go elsewhere and his manners were rude (excessively, and I am from Europe where slight rudeness from servers is the norm)!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne Y
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic. RIght in the heart of old Montreal. Everything was close by, and we walked everywhere. The service was terrific, we requested a superior room and the king size bed was massive. In addition the washroom was spectacular. Walk-in rain shower and a soaker tub with jets, so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PBNelson
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our stay. The staff was helpful, our room was spacious and lovely, the location was ideal. The hotel is perfectly situated within a short walk of coffee shops, a Metro station, restaurants, beautiful historical buildings and the stunning Basilique Notre Dame de Montreal. There was construction going on and the Place d'Armes square was closed off, so I was sorry to have missed seeing this, however, there were plenty of other beautiful parks and interesting neighborhoods to keep us happily exploring via the nearby Metro. On the first day of our stay one of the hotel staff recommended getting a day pass instead of paying for individual train rides. That was a great suggestion and we actually bought a 3-day pass, which saved us time as well as money. We had drinks, dinner, or dessert at 2 of the 3 restaurants at the hotel; we did not try the higher end one. The food was good, the staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel for so many reasons, and would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerRach
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Le Place d'Armes Hotel for 3 weeks, and what a wonderful place it has been to explore from.
