In the heart of Old Montreal, less than 20 mins (interesting and optional underground!) walk from Downtown, 5 minutes from China Town, a hop skip and jump from the great metro system. The hotel itself so comfortable, and the staff incredibly helpful and friendly in every department- concierge, restaurants, housekeeping.. (eg one of the conceirge staff volunteered to drive me and my child to the Montreal Children's hospital at 11 pm one night) the food is great in the restaurants, and the roof top terrace is a great spot for a drink and a view over Montreal. The spa bath has been delicious at the end of a day of gadding about, and I expect it would be super cosy in Winter with the gas "log" fire on in the bedroom. We also feel that we have received extremely good value for money in the hotel and its restaurants. Overall a great and satisfying experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room average”
Reviews.Author: Fstrraveler
Reviews.Content: We got queen room average price was $210 before taxes but the room was small, had a very old TV and remote did not work. There were not anything extra in the room. I expected a nicer TV, coffee machine and ice bucket as minimum. The fridge was stuffed with over priced beverages like $4 pop and $7 for a bottle of water. Other than that lots of liquer which we dont drink. The location is great and the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: clancyaustin
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the suites so we could have a separate bedroom for our infant and were given a free upgrade when we arrived. The room was fantastic, as was the service - at the front desk, room service and the valets. The room service was from their restaurant, which was very tasty. We would definitely book again. The hotel was right near Notre Dame and only a short walk to the waterfront area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrevorNYC_11
Reviews.Content: Great location, extremely comfortable hotel. Great staff and helpful concierge. Only downside was that the WiFi didn't really work in the room. I'd also spring for the Jr Suite!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kame78
Reviews.Content: Our room was fine - reviews touting decoration are sadly mistaken as the look is quite dated. What was noteworthy was the service which was a disaster. When we called for our car to be brought around it was never communicated to the valet, when we called for a cab twice neither time was it called, to top it off in our junior suite there were multiple cobwebs over our bed and the cleaning service broke a glass and left half of it on the ground. We also asked the concierge for help booking restaurants which twice they just didn't do. The final straw was when we asked a staff member for help getting to the terrace and he made a face and was very rude to us. One last item of note was that when I tried to book a massage at Rainspa no one ever answered despite three attempt. I don't know what was happening with the staff over weekend but it was frankly ridiculous for a highly rated and supposedly high end hotel. I would not recommend staying here as the management seems to be completely incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. Beautiful rooms and decor. Unbelievable location...a block from the metro, in the heart of the Old City, block away from downtown. Plus, the people that work there are incredibly knowledgeable and charming.....Jose, Rene, Madeleine, and Sylvia couldn't have made our stay better. They answered ALL our questions and gave us explicit directions. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking, comfortable bed, great service, perfect for girl's night out!”
Reviews.Author: SarahMarguerite
Reviews.Content: I just recently visited this hotel with a friend of mine for some shopping, a little partying and some R&R in Montreal. Firstly, it was a little tough to access by car because of construction, and there isnt a proper place to pull over in front of the hotel. Once we were there with our four ways on, they whisked our car away, and we were welcomed into the lobby, which is not grand like the major chains, but modern and sleek. The desk staff was kind and checked us in early without a problem. Our room was on the 4th floor, facing the street. This is a boutique hotel, so the layout is not your typical mega-chain layout, its intimate and inviting. The elevators are small, but luckily it wasnt busy. This hotel is in a PERFECT location in Old Montreal. Right next to the metro Place D'Armes for easy access to all parts of Montreal, but literally right accross the street from Notre-Dame Cathedral, which is beautiful and has very nice concerts at times. Its about a 5min walk to the Old Port, which is picturesque this time of year. Our room was a king size room, with a nice big flat screen tv, rain shower, robes, fully stocked mini-bar, ipod docking station, and a nice table and chairs by the window. The space was clean, and our housekeeper left us a bottle of water and some lindt chocolates. We bought our own snacks for dinner, and ate them in the room, but there wasnt any cutlery or plates, so I called down to get some delivered to the room, which was done in less than 5 minutes. We could not hear anything from any of the other rooms, it really felt like we were the only ones in the hotel! We also didnt see too many other people. We pumped up the music in our room for our girl's night out, and no one complained :) We also had a welcome cocktail included in our package, and we enjoyed that at the bar. The bar was fairly empty, but such is life on a weekday. My drink was a fresh basil and raspberry martini, which was delicious and refreshing! After a night on the town, we crashed in our king size bed and I slept like a log! Lots of pillows too. I called down to reception in the morning and they gave us a 2 pm checkout without a problem, nice. We visited the RainSpa, which they say is a turkish hammam, but it wasnt that great. It was a nice treat after a night out on the town, but it was just a steam room, no baths or hot tub or anything. I wouldnt pay full price to go to it... Overall, our experience was amazing, the hotel is beautiful, the bed was comfortable, the location was perfect, the staff was great. Thank you Hotel Place D'Armes for a wonderful girl's night!

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm, contemporary upgrade in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mcex
Reviews.Content: This hotel consists of several buildings converted into a luxury boutique-type hotel in the Old Montreal part of town. The room had high ceilings, polished wood floors, black & white tiled and marbled baths, comfortable bed with down comforter, and really nice lighting and art touches throughout. Great personalized service including reception, concierge, room service. Nice contemporary first floor lounge which was popular on weekends. There is a spa, roof-top bar restaurant with great views of city. If you want to be in the heart of Old Montreal, a short walk to Notre Dame Cathedral, great restaurants, museums and the port area this is a great place with reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Style + Service: A Rare Combination”
Reviews.Author: Shuguh
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Le Place d'Armes HÃ´tel and was impressed by both the level of service and by the property itself. The young and attractive staff was professional and very helpful without the tiresome "hipper-than-thou" attitude that can afflict style-conscious boutique hotels. The hotel is well-positioned on the eponymous historical Place D'Armes on the border of Vieux MontrÃ©al with the magnificent Gothic Revival Basilique Notre-Dame across the square. It is an easy walk to Boulevard RenÃ© Levesque where the 747 Express Bus from the airport drops you off (stop #8, Saint-Laurent) which, by the way, is quite reasonable at CAD$8 (which includes 24 hours on all public transport). The Metro is one block away (Station Place D'Armes) which makes getting around town easy and convenient. Canadian design can sometimes try to be something it isn't and ends up a bit ungapatchka (look it up), but this hotel has managed to integrate the old and the new with a remarkable aplomb. My guest room was spacious, with large couch separating the capacious bed from the TV and desk. It had three large windows and exposed brick walls which with the contemporary design blended quite well. The bathroom was vast with a separate shower and Jacuzzi tub and still had heaps of room in it. The bed linens and sheets were all of a very high quality. I had breakfast at Suite 701, the ground floor hotel that opens directly onto the square. It was satisfactory, but I will withhold judgement until I dine there at lunch or dinner. All-in-all a great experience, and I look forward to a longer visit in October to my beloved MontrÃ©al and another stay at Le Place D'Armes HÃ´tel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianneKelownaBc
Reviews.Content: We struggled with the decision about where to stay - downtown or Vieux Montreal but we're delighted we chose Old Montreal and Le Place d'Armes Hotel. The staff was excellent right from the valet parking attendant when we first arrived, the checkin girls, the bellmen, the bar and restaurant staff and the concierge. We upgraded to a junior suite and were overwhelmed when we got into our room. It was so spacious and beautifully done - sitting area with sofa and 2 chairs, fireplace, large flatscreen TV and small round dining table and 4 chairs. The bed was a king platform bed with wonderful linens. There was a desk and chair and a large armoire. The bathroom was huge with a large glass and tile shower and lovely jetted tub. It was a gorgeous hot day and we started our Montreal experience at the rooftop restaurant - a special place. Breakfast was included in our room rate and we had it served in our room. It was very good. Wifi was also included - and parking - it was excellent value. Some people mentioned that the rooms were quite dark and yes - the lights could've been a bit brighter but it's a small small thing! There was a very good reading light on each side of the bed. We'll definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again when we go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: webbhaus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. From the very moment we arrived at the hotel we were greeted and treated open armed. The room, a jr. suite, was perfect, spacious and quiet. The location was right at the start of the beautiful section of Old Montreal and was walking distance to everything. The restaurant on the roof top was fun, casual and delicious. Tip - check out their internet special tab on the home page. We paid regular room rate for a jr. suite. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and facilities but pricey food”
Reviews.Author: WAMArt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is handily located on the edge of the beautiful old town and across the street from Notre Dame Basilica. The rooftop bar is fab with great views over the city. The gym was well-equipped and kept cool by efficient air-con. Staff were friendly and an issue we had with swapping feather duvets and pillows was rectified very quickly. The concierge was helpful and the car was valet-parked and returned promptly. All staff we encountered did their jobs very well. We got a great deal and so splurged on junior suites which were huge and plush. The bathrooms were amazing with a free-standing whirlpool bath and enormous shower cubicle. We had breakfast in the hotel and were disappointed the prices were so higjh. It's always the case that hotels charge you an arm and a leg but this did feel too steep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: lislewis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is several beautiful old buildings cleverly put together into one lovely comfortable boutique hotel. The rooms are charming and modern, with beautiful black and white bathrooms, comfortable beds. Even though it is perfectly located in the middle of the old Montreal, the rooms are quiet. The staff was exceptional, especially our concierge, Jose. He helped us plan our day and gave us excellent advice. Montreal is a fascinating city and this was a perfect home base to explore it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service in 701 bar”
Reviews.Author: Jo64027
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was lovely, it was a two story room with a super comfy king size bed, a pull out sofa and a second washroom upstairs. Service was amazing at the hotel and the staff was extremely friendly and catered to our every need. Try the raspberry mojitos in the hotels bar and talk to Sandra the bartender. She planned our whole trip and provided my group with an excellent selection of restaurants, attractions, and nightlife spots to attend. She was extremely helpful and made our MTL girls weekend a success. Thank you, Sandra for all of your help and the fabulous Mojitos.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Novascotia12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a really nice place with great rooms and a good location, however the running of the hotel and staff is not great. We tried to order room service from the menu in our room, but were told there was none of the things we wanted - and were not offered an explanation as to why we could not order from the menu and we were not offered an alternative. We also tried to have a late breakfast in bar 701 but we were told different things on different days by different people leaving us confused about opening hours and the services available. It seems like the information in our room was completely different to the services available. The staff were not helpful with explanations of services and seemed uninterested I'm helping us. We ended up going elsewhere for food that should have been easily available to us. This was a shame as the hotel itself is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort”
Reviews.Author: viajerafeliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for the first three nights of our honeymoon. When we arrived we were told that we had been given a complimentary grade to a junior suite since we were on our honeymoon. In the room we were greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and a basket of other goodies and discounts. The room was incredibly comfortable. Jacuzzi tub, two kinds of shower heads. Fireplace in the room. Nightly turn down service. It was a truly pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aandpmi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our anniversary trip. Hotel and room was absolutely charming. Clean and comfortable. The staff was quite pleasant. The hotel is within walking distance of Notre Dame Basilica (a few hundred yards). The gym was decent. Be sure and go up to the terrace for a cocktail-hard to beat the setting!

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance and location”
Reviews.Author: jlsny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a beautiful mix of old Montreal and modern architecture. Big, romantic, luxurious rooms, for a decent price. Located in Old Montreal, this hotel was walking distance to several restaurants and sites. You can't go wrong staying here, especially if you are interested in making your hotel stay part of your vacation. I went with my boyfriend for a weekend getaway and we really enjoyed it. Also, I got a great deal on travelzoo that included free 24 hr parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tcufaude
Reviews.Content: If in Montreal...I would definitely recommend staying here. It is trendy, chic, clean, spacious and in a great location. A boutique hotel. Has a super trendy hotel bar that gets packed at night. Fun place to stay. People are friendly and will help with all of your needs. A great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Top Service”
Reviews.Author: usakomodo
Reviews.Content: Living only 90 minutes from Montreal has made it easy to drive there and back home. We found the Place d'Armes Hotel to be in anexcellent location in Vieux Montreal and within walking distance of many of the sights we wanted to see. The Metro was easily available as well for points faurther afield. The hotel was most accomodating in providing us with a room up several stories to keep us away from road construction happening whle we were there. The room had an in-closet safe, small refrigerator and full bathroom (with tub), well supplied with travel needs. Service at the front desk and in the restaurant was efficient and helpful. The Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Be aware that valet parking (which one needs due to location) is around $25 per day (you do have in-and-out privileges if needed). Restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bugs - Bugs and more bugs”
Reviews.Author: Ledge21
Reviews.Content: Came back from the Casino to a dark room at two in the morning, When we turned the light on in the washroom there were black and white crawly bugs (baby milipedes). Had to sleep with the lights on. When we adressed the problem to the front desk in the morning, they said they would take care of it (didn't even offer a room change). The next two nights were the same - NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and staff”
Reviews.Author: JR1278
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the best places to stay while visiting old city Montreal. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooftop bar and restaurant was beautiful with a view of Notre Dame Basilica. We stayed in Junior Suite 3402 and really appreciated the ambiance and decor. If I were to visit again I would think of staying in 3602 (second digit is the floor). The street noise was not bad however you will have early morning local truck deliveries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bahaohcebol
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in the center of old Montreal....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelmop_10
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel right in the heart of the Old City in Montreal. Spectacular architecture and interior design. Easy walking distance to subway station for convenient access to all of Montreal and directly across the plaza from Notre Dame. This would be excellent choice for a business trip or couple traveling. Meticulously clean throughout. If you want to be in the Old City I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place if you have young kids”
Reviews.Author: angelainnewyork
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite which had almost as much room as our NYC apt! It even had a dining table for 4 which was great. The room service food was actually so delicious we ordered in most nights (kids 2 & 4). It was very clean with lots of space and windows. The location is nice and close to most things in the old town. We walked everywhere. The value was fantastic. We would definitely stay here if we go back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Started badly but still a good place to stay - great room”
Reviews.Author: areopagus
Reviews.Content: I was at the Place d'Armes Hotel on a business-and-holiday trip to Montreal over the Canada Day long weekend. The stay started badly. I arrived in the evening around 9.30 pm. I made the mistake of taking the airport bus into town even though I had two pieces of luggage. I had overshot the stop nearest the hotel and got lost. I found myself in a well known square (Place Jacques Cartier) and called the hotel on my mobile phone, which was running out of power. Despite my giving the name of the square I was on and describing my location, it took some time for the third person I got on the phone to give me directions. I only got to hear the first part of her instructions before my phone died. Once I arrived at the hotel, somewhat exhausted, I found it strange that there was nobody at the front to help with luggage or even just hold open the door. I got to the registration desk. There were two people there. The younger fellow checked me in but he seemed somewhat distracted as he did so. The check-in process went on somewhat longer than I thought it would. I then asked about items that were in the package that I had booked. The gentleman was confounded. He said he knew nothing about a package. I asked specifically about the Montreal Museum Pass. Again, he knew nothing. He asked his colleague, who similarly said he did not know anything about this special package. I suggested they check the hotel's own website to see the various items in this package. They did but that didn't really help. I asked again about the Museum Pass. The only reply I got was that they thought they had passes but that "everything is locked up now". I felt compelled to tell the younger fellow that I felt the check-in process and service had been "amateur". He simply stood there somewhat perplexed as I went up to my room with my two rollerbags and my hand carry. Not a great beginning. The room was lovely - a spacious junior suite with lots of room and a large bathroom. I found it odd that the doors of the rooms on the floor would shut very loudly - why don't they have those devices that slowly shut doors? The bed was very comfortable.I sent off an email to the manager about the problems at check-in and did get a response from an executive of the hotel but not until my last day. Separately, this lady had heard about the questions I had - presumably the fellow who checked me in had informed her - and I received a card from her on my second day at the hotel telling me that she had briefed the registration staff on the information I had wanted that they did not know. I was too busy to follow up and never actually got any of the items in the package, including the Museum Pass, which probably was just as well. But if I had known that the hotel staff weren't all that aware of these "special" packages, suggesting that they aren't all that special, then I would have just booked the room. Otherwise, I had a good stay, though we were a little disappointed when we went up to the roof terrace to have dinner our second night. When we arrived, it was very hard to see because of the dimmed lighting. The staff seemed confused about whether there was space or not. Somebody led us to this very crowded area in the back, which was noisy, but then she disappeared and we were left unattended. We found somebody else to help seat us and said that the area we were in was too loud and couldn't we sit in the front area which seemed to have more space. We walked back there, but again, because of the dim lighting, I nearly tripped. They couldn't decide for a while whether they could give us a table. But after a couple of minutes, they sat us in an area which actually had a lot of space, though it was far too noisy. Not a very relaxing option if you are looking for a laid-back dinner alfresco. The bar downstairs was even noisier. I would come back to this hotel as the rooms are very good. The area around the hotel is currently under reconstruction so walking around may require some detours. But the hotel's location is very good. And to be fair, there was a sincere attempt to remedy the problem I had, though the matter wasn't really resolved since I never managed to follow up on the questions I had at check-in due to my busy schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcoming and recommended”
Reviews.Author: critictogo
Reviews.Content: Great location near cathedral, port, restaurants and metro. Beautiful room with brick wall. Excellent restaurant and lovely terrace bar on the roof with great view. Exercise facilities. Only issue was that the wonderful bathroom was too dark. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TaniaArtinian
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel with great service. Not only are you stunned by the architecture of the building upon arrival, however, when the doorman opens the door for you and you get a glimpse of the inside, you are blown away. The service at the front desk was great. They were efficient, friendly, and full of great suggestions. The rooms are spectacular, especially the rooms with a terrace. Excellent!!! I would recommend it to anyone and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: BrocktorWho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding night in the junior suite of this hotel. The room was very spacious and elegant! We found the service to be efficient and polite and we were especially grateful for the help of Sebastian and Jonathan, two valets who went out of their way to help us. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in old montreal”
Reviews.Author: Nscc2
Reviews.Content: Superb rooms-very high quality and spacious. Bathroom was exceptional. Free wireless Internet though this was a little erratic at times. Friendly staff though French was their first language. Excellent food. Excellent location for old Montreal I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN MONTREAL!!!!!! HANDS DOWN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vatchep
Reviews.Content: The Place D'Armes Hotel was absolutely wonderful. A little bit of background about my trip - 3 couples (myself and my fiancee included). The hotel is in beautiful downtown montreal near the port. Walking distance to St. Catherine street. The valets are extremely quick and courteous. The check-in was flawless and the front-desk staff are very accomodating and helpful. The hotel is comprised of 3 buildings. We were in building 3 on the 7th (top) floor. We ended up having 3 rooms with huge balconies that connected to each other. Our room had anything and everything we could ask for - LCD tv with surround sound speakers in the room. Mini-fridge. Exposed brick walls!!!!! The bathroom was gorgeous with a HUGE shower (both handheld and rainfall showerheads). Soaking tub with a TV directly above it. I will definitely stay here again. The hotel is amazing in both location and amenities. I have NOTHING negative to say. Jen at the front desk was awesome and took care of everything we needed. The beds are super comfortable, as are the pillows. The fireplace in the room was an awesome touch, as was the free wifi and cordless phone. The balcony was aboslutely amazing with a stunning view of old montreal. FIVE STARS FOR SURE!!!1

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Definitely will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Spark_HK
Reviews.Content: Rooms - were AMAZING!!!! jacuzzi, fireplace, everything was new, bathroom was huge, bedding was clean and comfortable, top of the line Service - very friendly staff, anything we needed at anytime was brought up to the room, all staff was very friendly and happy to help with anything Location - definitely would come back to this hotel just for the location, right in the old port, walking distance of everything, was able to walk to dine at the finest restaurants, did not need to use the car once the whole weekend. We are already talking about planning the next trip just so we can experience this hotel again. Definitely recommend it for anyone that appreciates experiencing french culture, you will feel like you are in a different country!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unless you speak French and are interested in only the Old City, this is not the hotel for you.”
Reviews.Author: findlocals
Reviews.Content: Our biggest disappointment with this hotel was the maitre d service. Not just one individual person, several people. We had one experience with a manager who was able to help us quite a bit but other than that, every encounter with anyone at the front desk was quite frustrating. They did not understand (or chose not to?) our English and did not have much knowledge of areas beyond the Old City (but still within the city of Montreal!). Other staff at the hotel - at the bar, restaurant, etc. - spoke better English. It was actually while at the bar - which has full table service - that we learned we can order food from the restaurant. No one else mentioned this when we inquired about a dinner reservation at the restaurant and were told they were completely booked for the entire night. Admittedly, we are not typical tourists. We are more interested in exploring a city on our bikes, our feet, or via mass transit - to find the areas were the locals hang out - than we are interested in known tourist attractions. This was not easy to do with Le Place d'Armes as our home base. Once we stopped asking for help from the staff, our trip got much better.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Montreal and can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Parsippany1986
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Montreal and after reading all the reviews, we choose to stay at the Place d'Armes. It is centrally located and you can walk to many of the major attractions and areas in Old Montreal very easily and quickly. We had an Executive Suite which had gorgeous views and was clean and neat and was well appointed. The master bathroom was so spacious with a very large shower with 2 heads and an enormous jetted tub; the 1/2 bath was very convenient. The only disappointment was that the mini-bar wasn't refreshed each day but we drove from NJ (not bad 5.5 hrs) and had brought some snacks with us. Sylvie at the front desk (thank you for the continental breakfasts) and Jose the concierge were especially helpful. Jose actually took the time to walk us to the tour pickup stop. The hotel valet parked our car and it was returned with no problems. We stayed 5 Days (July 7-11th) and are looking forward to returning to Montreal and staying again at the Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Street construction noise do not come here.”
Reviews.Author: pkhowong
Reviews.Content: Do not come here unless you want to wake up at 7:30 every morning due to drilling on the square right in front of the hotel. The construction is extremely loud and you will not be able to relax in your room. We are from Manhattan and are used to street noise but construction noise is unbearable. This hotel is average. It tries very hard to be hip like the W hotels, white curtains, neon lights, black everywhere etc. This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel but they don't even have coffee in the room. Do not come here if you are looking for an elegant place. The best hotel to stay in Montreal is St. James where U2 stayed.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: aisgb
Reviews.Content: The hotel has historical feature and modern charm. Close to must-see spots, (across from Notre Dame church), close to the metro station, sea port, restaurants and stores. Hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful, and guests get complimentary welcome cocktails, however bar staffs are a little stuffy. We stayed in superior king room. The room was very specious and gorgeous, there was nothing to complain. Overall, this hotel is A+, and we definitely recommend to our friends and would like to stay again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: doolittle33
Reviews.Content: We had room 1403 and it was very nice. Comfy beds, soft music was playing when we arrived, they have a CD player/T.V. Our friends room was smaller for the same price so ask for this room! super staff, I would recommend the terrace restaurant ,nice view,a bit pricey but worth it. They also give you a complimentary drink downstairs . It's location was within walking to the old port and China town, and easy for the metro also. We would go back. Tips: no coffee in your room, bring water + drinks from the States, Alcohol is expensive but available for purchase around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Central, plush, pleasant - have fun with the lighting system in the bedroom”
Reviews.Author: ParisFifi
Reviews.Content: Third time to stay in this hotel and it's always a pleasure. Staff very helpful, rooms spacious and very comfortable. Takes a while to figure out the lighting system - room stays very dark if you can't. Also a bit of a challenge to locate the minibar! But comfy bed and definitely a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: michy2781
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Place D'Armes for 1 week. Upon arrival, I was immediately impressed with the hotel's service. Firstly, although I had originally booked a queen room, the hotel upgraded me to a junior classic suite at no additional charge due to my longer than normal stay. In addition, the staff are very welcoming and helpful at all levels, from reception to the doorman to housekeeping. The hotel itself is in a great location, easily within walking distance to every major attraction along the Old Port. The room itself was large and quiet. I found it to be very clean and in excellent condition. The only downside was that a large portion of the streets immediately outside the hotel were under construction and blocked off (this construction has been going on for over a year apparently); therefore, we often had to walk around the block to reach the Notre Dame Basilica, etc. And also, as a result, no view of the Notre Dame. Overall though, I was very impressed during my stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful and cozy setting”
Reviews.Author: JanetTNT
Reviews.Content: We booked a conference room at this hotel and were very impressed with the attentive service and warmth from the staff. The surroundings were beautiful and the decor was charming and perfectly suited for Old Montreal. Being a charity, we also appreciated the reasonable prices. I highly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ExNewY0rker
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Place D'Armes Hotel. Thanks to Madeleine, the manager, we had a spacious, nicely decorated room overlooking a small park. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful, but Madeleine was exceptionally accommodating to our needs. The location of this hotel is also very convenient. It's only one block to Notre Dame Cathedral, around the corner from a Starbucks and two blocks to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHarveyCT
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded upon arrival. And the room was superb. High ceiling (15 feet), decorative fire place, large room, and excellent service. In house restaurants were a bit pricey, but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “We did love the hotel and would definitely go there again as well as recommend it to others.”
Reviews.Author: frankie33804
Reviews.Content: If you love boutique hotels, or smaller renovated hotels, you'll love this. Its in beautiful historic Old Montreal and everything is within walking distance. Although very nicely appointed our room was very small - so if I went again I would ask because in reading other reviews there are large, spacious rooms. We got a special rate so maybe that was why. Staff was great. Very quiet. We were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be happy to recommend to friends and family”
Reviews.Author: LindaChalem
Reviews.Content: Old world charm with modern facilities, well trained and friendly staff, over the top comfy bedding, beds, and pillows, outstanding food service, easy access to elevator and rooms, great air conditioning, quality bath and hygiene products, the most wonderful air freshener smell throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: JenniBean75
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here this month for 2 nights, and we really wish we could have stayed longer. Our room was huge with a fantastic view and an amazing bathroom with rain shower and jet tub. Everything we wanted to do & see in Old Montreal was within walking distance so we didn't even need to get our car from the valet once. All of the staff was very accommodating and pleasant. We will absolutely stay here again the next time we're in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with wonderful and Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye048
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful and spacious. Beds are very comfortable. The hotel staff was very gracious and made certain all details and requests were handled perfectly. Would highly recommend this location for business and social functions. Made us feel welcome and special on our visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “"An absolutely fabulous place to stay!!"”
Reviews.Author: gsa2923
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, from its location, to its incredible staff and service, the gorgeous rooms and the delicious food! It is a charming and beautiful building, completely redone in a very warm and modern decor, the beds are super comfortable and the staff there are so welcoming and very very kind. We were a group of 90, and they treated us all like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kms21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal. Shopping, great restaurants and Notre Dame Basilica are within walking distance. We reserved a junior suite and it did not disappoint! Lovely charming decor. The only downside was no coffee pot in room. Although room service was quick, it was a hassle not to have that first cup right there each morning. Staff was very welcoming and the concierge (both Magill & Jose) were wonderfully helpful before we arrived and during our stay. The AIX restaurant in the hotel was a perfect choice for our last night there as we decided to dine in & not go out in the heavy rain. The food - outstanding! As my husband was discussing the wine list with Max our waiter, he kindly suggested wines that were not on the menu - something special he said. And we were so pleasantly surprised! Marvelous choices. I would go back again & again! Do not let the fact that it is in the hotel stop you - just go & enjoy! The city of Montreal is in the process of redesigning the street area just outside of the hotel. So there was a short detour, both while leaving the hotel entrance on foot, as well as when driving to the hotel entrance. The front desk staff upgraded us a junior suite located in building 3, which was as far away from the construction noise as possible - without our having to ask! Should we go to Montreal again, we would stay at Le Place d'Armes Hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Le Place to be!”
Reviews.Author: AHS22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Place d'Armes for my first night in Montreal for a little respite and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel itself is beautiful, with everything to finished to a very high standard. The staff were friendly yet efficient. I had requested a room with a bath and originally was given one with just a shower. I called down to reception and a porter came straight up and moved me. The room was gorgeous, plush and cosy and the bathroom was divine! The bar downstairs was very busy and but I couldn't hear a thing from my 5th floor room. I just wanted to veg out so I ordered room service, a steak and chips, which was delicious, hot and very reasonably priced. There are loads of TV channels, a radio/ipod dock and a full stacked mini bar. I really enjoyed the Montreal guides left in my room. The bathroom is also stocked with toilettries from the hotel spa, fluffy robes and gowns. Slippers would have completed this but I'm just fussy. Before bed I was bought a booklet containing the weather forecast for the next day along with some chocolates. It's touches like that that you're paying for. I had a brilliant nights sleep and woke up feeling refreshed. I had breakfast sent to my room for an extra charge, and it was delicious. The porter came to collect my bags for check out and stored them for me all day while I explored the city. There are also complimentary computers available downstairs for internet access/printing. I would recommend Le Place d'Armes, it is a truly beautiful hotel with super service. I paid around Â£170 for the most basic room, I have heard this was due to the season (a week before Grand Prix). I think this was a little over priced but it's worth it for a treat! Bear in mind, you are oblidged to tip every time someone does something for you so keep some cash handy. Merci pour tout!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique-type hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Loving_Canuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Place d'Armes Hotel this past week for two nights as we held some business meetings there. I'd go back to this hotel with no hesitation. They did a great job of hosting our business meetings - excellent service, very good lunches & breakfast, and well lit meeting rooms. We also had a fun & memorable evening enjoying drinks on the rooftop terrace - what a spectacular spot! Our attendees were all thrilled with their rooms. Each room was different, but I heard nothing but positive comments - big bathrooms, fireplaces, great furnishings, and comfortable beds. The location is fantastic. Step out the door & you're in Old Montreal. It was also easy to get in & out of with convenient valet parking. Only two complaints I could make: wireless internet access was challenging & you had to run the water for a VERY long (5-10 mins) time before it got hot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: SGMCanada
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel. On the door step to old Montreal. Easy walking throughout the old streets and port area. Hotel room lovely. Exposed brick wall. Clean, quiet and full of charm. Roof top terrace is lovely. Breakfast served on RC and at a cost of $10.00 per person plus taxes. Served from 6:30 am to 10:30 am. No need to rush. Relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great city central hotel”
Reviews.Author: LHSTruckee
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: near metro, near Vieux Montreal and the river. Room had great character, comfortable work space, great bed and was surprisingly quiet for a city hotel. The bar was happening every night and the food (in the bar and room service) was surprisingly good. Loved the hardwood floors in the room. Staff was friendly and helpful when we needed help.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend it. I'd definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Lasso2
Reviews.Content: The location is great - in Old Montreal. Beautiful hotel. The staff was wonderful - gracious and very helpful. No complaints. I definitely recommend it and will be back if I'm fortunate enough to go to Montreal again. Loved the hotel and the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Montreal, loved the room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: quickgetaways
Reviews.Content: Having spent four days walking around the city, I can say with confidence that the Place D'Armes Hotel is the best place to stay in Montreal. Its close proximity to Old Montreal and the Notre Dame Basilica are great selling points, and you're only a short walk from the St. Lawrence river and parks. We had one hiccup with the air conditioning unit in our suite, but it was solved immediately by the hotel staff and handled with professionalism. Great amenities and service, although I would recommend venturing out to find some great restaurants in the area before settling for Suite 701 or AIX. Overall great trip, and I will DEFINITELY be booking with them again when I return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Get confirmation of room rate at CHECK IN”
Reviews.Author: julesBocaRaton_Fl
Reviews.Content: Before launching into my tirade, I will state that I was remiss in not confirming our rate when we checked in for three nights last week. I had tried to book online and the website kept bouncing me out. I called and made the reservation directly with the hotel by phone. At the time I was assured that the rate would be the same as I was quoted online. Imagine my surprise when I was handed the bill with a "floating" rate for the 3 night stay-- does anyone do this outside of Las Vegas??!! The floating rate, needless to say, was considerably more than the web rate on all 3 nights. When I mentioned this to the girl at the front desk (very nice, BTW), she went to the management and was told that unless I had a confirmation (I never received one-- should have insisted) there was nothing they could do. Had I confirmed prior to check in, I would have moved uptown to another hotel; too many nice (cheaper) places to stay in Montreal. So my advice is: get it in writing!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury, incredible service, beds to die for, and a bathroom you can get lost in.”
Reviews.Author: AngieH73
Reviews.Content: The surrounding area is absolutely gorgeous and within walking distance of shopping, dining, and site seeing. The lounge staff is amazing as is the fare. The limited number of suites makes the stay all the more pleasant, knowing you can return from a night on the town to a quiet sanctuary with a bed you won't want to climb back out of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MiloK2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the OLD Town part of Montreal by the Notre Dame Cathedral and short walking distance to the rivers edge. This hotel was a great value and the staff and location were excellent. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel that are very highly rated. The staff and service were excellent. The rooms are specious and nicely decorated The bathrooms are very nice with very big bathtubs. There is also a roof terrace to have drinks and enjoy the views. Couldn't use because it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: skjsms
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Place d'Armes during a recent conference at the Palais de Congres. The hotel is only a block from the conference and very convenient. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, quiet, and nice in every way. We had a junior suite and it was very roomy, a plus since I had brought my 7 month old and my mother to act as a babysitter. The only minor complaint I have is that the wireless access in the room was spotty and often not usable. The best feature of the hotel, though, was the service. The staff were wonderful about helping to find the things we needed for the baby, even bringing us a fridge when the minibar wouldn't keep her milk cold enough. I recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Chic comfort matches impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: nic_nmkelly
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes was the perfect location for a weekend trip. Not only was the hotel comfortable with casual chic decor, but the staff went above and beyond to ensure every detail of each request was met. The room was spacious with a relaxed/romantic feel and plenty of closet space to keep luggage and belongings organized! Concierge Renee helped us find the best restaurants and nightlife while Suite 701 catered to all our culinary preferences. For anyone interested in art history or arichitecture, Place d'Armes is in the perfect spot for you to enjoy historic buildings, galleries and excellent nearby food+drinks! I would most definitely return to this hotel for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: herve_b43
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - great service and location. Rooms are spacious and very cosy / functional, lobby not particularly impressive at first, but bar and restaurant top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, perfect location, just right in every way.”
Reviews.Author: donnelpd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 4 night stay here. We booked the hotel online, based on the photos and the reviews, and were not disappointed. The hotel was lovely, the staff welcoming and friendly but respectful of our privacy. Our room was magnificent - large, with a seating area, an enormous bathroom, and very attentive housekeeping staff. We arrived mid evening after a long drive from Boston and chose to eat in the hotel restaurant - Suite 701 - enjoying a complimentary cocktail and a great dinner. The hotel is located in the old part of Montreal and was ideal for many nearby dinner options and a run by the Lachine canal in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to Play Tourist”
Reviews.Author: tmandgs
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Place d'Armes in early April to celebrate her birthday. We have lots of family and friends in Montreal but told no-one, so this was our chance to play tourist for a while. Hotel has a good location in Old Montreal, no more than a ten minute walk from every shop, bistro or gallery in the area but right near the Metro and a quick 8$ cab ride to the heart of shopping on Ste Catherine. Our room was a junior suite w/ balcony - very roomy, yet cozy, comfortable and romantic. We took full advantage of the soaker tub, room service (for breakfast both days) and electric fireplace. Service was impeccable from the doormen, front desk staff, and the manager at Suite 701. A few minor blips w/ housekeeping were resolved quickly and exactly as requested (and to be fair - we didn't leave room til 2, they cleaned it between then and 4 without us calling or anything, and all they forgot was to refresh the bath salts and switch the glasses). Value-wise: we took advantage of a pretty good discount fare, but we plan on coming back in the summer to take advantage of the rooftop lounge regardless of the price, so suffice to say we believe we got our money's worth. Had the look and feel of a small Parisian boutique hotel, with bigger rooms and better prices. Would it be nice if room had a flat screen TV? Yes. Did we care? No. Make sure you use the bath salts and tub; have a late night snack at Suite 701 (we did oysters and fish and chips w/ martinis - excellent all around); if you get out to eat try Barroco on St Paul for dinner but make a reservation first, or the shnitzel at Stash Cafe for lunch. And if you're travelling from toronto and can spend the dough, fly Porter and relaaaaxxxxx.....

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: WanderingDoc182
Reviews.Content: I could say a lot about the architecture, style of the rooms and especially service. But on the latter this pretty much sums it up: We are from Indiana, academics in town for a conference. The national semi-final games for the NCAA collegiate basketball tournament were on the Saturday night of our stay, and one of our local teams (Butler) was playing. After trying for over an hour to find us a bar where we could watch it (unsuccessfully; the Canadiens were playing for a playoff spot that night), they allowed us to watch it in the pool room off the main lobby, complete with food and drinks brought to us from the bar. In addition to a beautiful hotel, fantastic rooms and otherwise great service, making sure we could watch the game as a group somewhere more inviting and comfortable than one of our rooms was truly above and beyond what I would expect from a hotel. I have never been in any hotel that put guest satisfaction higher.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel - willing to go the extra kilometer”
Reviews.Author: Type-A_Planner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for five nights while he attended a conference. The location was wonderful - right by the metro, convention center, the basilica, Rue St. Paul. The room is amazing! By far the most luxurious bath we've had in a long time. The staff goes above and beyond. While we took a break from our home life in many ways, we couldn't bear not watching our alma mater in the March Madness Final Four. After a desperate search for a sports bar that wasn't obligated to turn all TVs to hockey, we gave up, returning to the hotel to watch the game in our room. After sharing our situation with the concierge, he very graciously let us set-up camp in the billiards room. The manager and staff from the bar kept the food and drinks coming until the end of the game. We can't thank them enough for giving us some space to cheer on our home team.

Reviews.Title: “Probably our favourite hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1966
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times now and have always had an enjoyable stay. On our most recent visit we got a particularly good deal for a one bed suite which was spread over 2 levels which while still fairly compact gave us plenty of space to spread out. Very comfortable beds and nice modern bathrooms. Furnishings and carpet on the upper level were a bit tired in comparison to the rest of the place but it wasn't a big deal. Their continental breakfast is also pretty impressive, for a continental. Great bar for a quick drink before you head out on the town and on a previous visit, we did dine in and although I can't recall what we ate, I remember that it was good and the service was impressive. In short, it's everything a weekend getaway in Montreal should be....we will be back again I'm sure....

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: nanoucy
Reviews.Content: I booked this room to celebrate my husband's birthday and to give us a little getaway for the weekend. We were not disappointed. Our room wasn't ready on time so the amazing staff offered us free cocktails and a platter of chocolate-covered strawberries. You can't ask for more friendly and accomodating staff. We reserved a junior suite and the room is pretty spectacular. Gorgeous bathroom with pedestal tub and rain faucet in the large glass shower. Exposed brick walls, plush bedding and fireplace in the sitting area made the room very cozy. The hotel is right in the heart of Old Montreal and next to the Notre Dame Basilica. Excellent location. We would stay at this hotel again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Gold_Coaster_2020
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Place d'Armes was fantastic, starting with an unexpected complementary upgrade from a junior suite to an executive suite. The room was beautiful, spacious, quiet and luxurious; the service was first-class from start to finish. The bar and restaurant are also definitely worth checking out. Special mention is warranted for the Front Office Manager (Jennifer Fabris), who went out of her way to make my stay as close to perfect as possible; she seems to be one of the remaining few in the hospitality industry who understands the concept of "client service." I would absolutely recommend this hotel, primarily for a romantic getaway but also for business purposes; it will be my first choice next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: nt_lc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Hotel Place d'Armes last weekend and we loved our our stay there. Bonus: we were upgraded to an executive suite and it was wonderful! The hotel is 2 mins away from Station Place d'Armes, which was convenient. The welcome cocktail was a nice touch to get our shy butts to their Suite 701 Lounge. The raspberry mojito suggest by the bartender was as tasty as the pink lighting and the pretty chandelier in the lounge. We also liked the pool table on the ground floor by the conference rooms. The staff were very friendly which is a hard thing to see in Old Montreal. We would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: photollew
Reviews.Content: Had the chance to spend 2 nights here in early March 2011. We had one minor snafu that the hotel staff took care of right away. Our first room had a malfunctioning heating unit....the room was 85 degrees, so they moved us to another room. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. There were a couple of things that I wasn't crazy about. For starters the valet parking that I paid $48 for for two nights. (I knew that before I got there) When I have to pay to have my car parked I expect at the very least it be parked someplace protected. I pulled up to the front of the hotel in late afternoon and as of 11 pm that night it was still parked on the street in front of the hotel. I did notice the next morning it was gone from the street. However later in the day I noticed my car once again parked on the street across from the front of the hotel. For starters why is my car being moved? And secondly for $50 I could have parked my car on the street. Also my experience at the suite 701 was also the same as someone listed below. VERY poor service. The package we had purchased came with a free drink there. Got seated right away, but took close to 10 min to take our drink order. We also ordered some dessert...got that long before our drinks. Then our waitress simply disappeared...finally after watching the entire 1st period of a hockey game on the TV finally went and found someone to give me our bill. Though as I said I'd gladly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Nelligan's Sister Hotel Doesn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: stebonnie
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Place d'Armes in the past year. The first on business, the second for a vacation with my wife. The quality of the bedding is second to none. The staff is attentive, the restaurant / bar quality are second to none. The location in the old part of Montreal offers ample access to great shops and restaurants. The only downside right now, which the hotel can not control is that the street is being torn up for water pipe replacement. It makes driving to and walking around a bit treacherous and muddy! This is the only negative thing I have to offer on the hotel which I hope will be remedied in a few weeks or months time.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Valentines Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RenM02
Reviews.Content: Hotel Place D'Armes is a wonderful hotel! I live north of Montreal, and for a valentines day getaway my boyfriend and I decided to stay in a nice hotel. We decided on Hotel Place D'Armes and I am glad we did! First not being from montreal, we got lost of course, so we decided to call the hotel, the front desk receptionist Madeline was so helpful, she stayed on the phone and directed us to the hotel. Then at arrival we were greated with big smiles, and things only got better when we saw the room! Oh my goodness the bathroom was amazing, and the rooms as well. Everyone was always willing to help us, and they made us feel very imortant. We will forsure return!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've had...”
Reviews.Author: JLawless
Reviews.Content: We opted for the Junior Suite and it was exceptional. Unique and cozy with brick walls, fireplace and incredible bathroom. As good as the room was, the service was better. Right form the moment we arrived we were treated so well. The attention to detail was so good that it actually stood out and became a topic of conversation for us. Such a good time and such a nice facility. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Montreal i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: petpeter
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great! starting with a warm and friendly reception on arrival by a young lady named Madeleine who made me feel so welcome things only got better! great rooms and everything works! a great 24 hour gym and Spa...and all the staff including Madeleine ofcourse were great! highly recommended!!! and the free wifi in the rooms works great!

Reviews.Title: “HÃ´tel Fabulous/Lounge Staff Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Barb048
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really wonderful. We had a junior suite with a balcony which overlooked Chinatown. The whirlpool tub and rain shower were some of the best I have experienced. The only negative I would add is that after staying at Hotel Nelligan, a sister property in Old Montreal, I found the Lounge/Bar area staff quite non-chalant about service. At Hotel Nelligan they do a wine and cheese for guests which is quite lovely, at Place Des Armes they do a cocktail for guests. We attended the lounge and received a cocktail but requested a menu to order something light, although we received the menu, we have not yet had an order taken, nor did any wait staff return to see if we wanted another drink or anything to eat. As we had concert tickets for that evening we left and had something quick to eat at another location. We did not return to the bar at anytime during our stay, our initial experience was so unsatisfactory we attended other locations away from the hotel. The hotel itself as far as quality is wonderful and all other staff were more than accomdating. It is unfortunate that the Lounge left us with a negative feeling as the rest of the property was certainly merveilleux.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay atPlace d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: starfish1
Reviews.Content: Great location a short walk to the Metro, the spacious junior suite with fireplace was a pleasure to come back to at the end of a day. Nicely appointed, very comfortable bed and warm, friendly staff made this a great experience. I'd highly recommend the hotel and will return when in Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Unique experience”
Reviews.Author: stockholmerinsydney
Reviews.Content: Les Place dArmes Hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in in North America. Polished and chic - combining the charm of French Speaking Quebec and the service mentality of North America. The location is great for Montreal old town - a quick walk to the shopping district of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Take a break at Le Place d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: Lets_Cruise_11
Reviews.Content: Our welcome was just nice. In early February it was our first time at this boutique hotel and as we got in we were served a complimentary dring at the bar. The junior suite we had was very spacious, clean with a very comfortable king size bed. The modern bathroom was enormous and had everything you wished for, including an impressive rainshower and a luxurious soaking tub. Everybody from the front desk staff to the bartenders at Suite 701 are professionnel and very friendly. We enjoyed our mid-winter break and we hope to be back at Le Place d'Armes in Montreal during the summer months to visit more of the vieux port and try other excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a romantic getaway in montreal”
Reviews.Author: LisaCorinne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the place d'armes for a romantic weekend away. We were in a junior suite and the room was beautiful. The front desk staff were extremely friendly to us and took extra time to show us destinations and restaurants on a map. The bar at the hotel is also really fun and the free cocktails are a really nice plus. Lastly, the location is amazing-its right across from the notre dame basilica, close to the subway, and if you are going in the winter, the skating rink is very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - perfect all-around”
Reviews.Author: poirier_al
Reviews.Content: My first time at this hotel and it compares with the likes of Sofitel. The room was spacious, clean, very comfortable king size bed, the bathroom had everything you needed, including lots of space and towels. Everybody from the staff at the restaurant to the bartender at the bar and the people at the the front desk are professionnel and ultra friendly. Maybe have better TVs but apart from that little inconvenience, I truly enjoyed my stay and will come back for my next trip to Montreal. Always nice to receive a complimentary drink when arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, room beautiful and spacious, bathroom luxurious...”
Reviews.Author: 60745Sandra
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Our room, a junior suite, was top notch. The suite included a king size bed, sofa, faux fireplace (which generated plenty of heat), and small dining area. No expenses spared. The location was 2 blocks from the metro. Will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, strangely poor service”
Reviews.Author: jlillicrop
Reviews.Content: Here is the following review I sent to the manager of the hotel over a week ago and I have not heard a response from. To highlight the pluses: The people where very nice when dealing with the negatives of this hotel. The room if gorgeous. The location is great. Now for the negative. 1. Front desk needs to be able to answer the phone when a customer calls down. We stayed there for 3 days and never once got anyone on the phone. This is not their fault but something needs to be done. 2. Make sure the rooms are spotless. We had red wax dripped all over our bathroom floor when we got there (doesn't give you the nicest welcome). 3. In the information binder about the hotel services under the food section you need to remove the statement about a complimentary continental breakfast is available in 701 suite. This is untrue unless it is included in your room price (which means you are paying for it and itâ€™s not complimentary). We were disgusted to pay $38.00 for a VERY continental breakfast. I had more options and hot food at a holiday express in Buffalo 2 months earlier. We were able to get the charges removed and they were very nice about it but it was embarrassing to say the least. 4. If you are not going to update the windows then donâ€™t have deliveries at 6:30am just outside your guestrooms. Pepsi delivery people had their truck idling for 30mins. I have 2 year old to wake me up at 6:30 hence the need for the vacation to your hotel. The people you have working at your hotel were very nice but the details are not there for the price you are charging. Hope this helps. Happy Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Still good.”
Reviews.Author: alex1012hearts
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. Once for New Years Eve - 2011 and once in the summer of 2006. My recommendation is to definitely get the suite if you can afford it. This is where I stayed in 2006 and it remains my favourite stay in a hotel EVER. This time I stayed in the hotel part and although the room is still nice, it feels like you're in a different hotel altogether (you actually are in a different building). There was some damage to the walls and the windows are painted shut (they open completely in the suites) but the bed is very comfy and the place is quiet. The only complaint I have is that although they offer free wi-fi, it doesn't work in the room. I had to sit in the hallway with my computer.

Reviews.Title: “They never cleaned the room”
Reviews.Author: Alleycat88
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for one night for a business meeting in the area. I checked in around 9pm. The bed was made when I went into the room and given that it was late, I went straight to bed. The next morning when I went to take a shower, I noticed that the bathroom had not been cleaned from the previous person that had stayed in that room. The shampoo bottle was empty, the soap was missing. The bathrobe was hanging on the hook - used. Then I noticed that the garbage had not been emptied. The name tag of the previous patron was still in the garbage can, along with the several items from the minibar. I notified the front desk of this inexcusable finding and I proceeded to my meeting. The meeting organizer spoke to the hotel and the cost of my stay was refunded and I received a gift certificate for another stay. I was going to let this go and not write a review but then I noticed that the hotel had the nerve to charge my credit card for the minibar items that I had explicitly told them I did not use - the previous patron had used them and they never cleaned the room!! There is no way that I would ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, staff and value!”
Reviews.Author: Nez28
Reviews.Content: You may pay more but it is worth every cent of your Canadian dollar! The superior room was just that, a brilliant choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ALL GOOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: 65Pony
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is exceptional. Location is perfect, service is outstanding, rooms are gorgeous (we had a Junior Suite) and the atmosphere is welcoming and cool. We did a third night free package which made this a bargain too! Not a detractor, but they should consider having coffee available in your room. There are plenty of places to get coffee in the area, including in the hotel restaurant, but in the 5 degree F weather in December, you can't just stroll out to Starbucks; it's a project........

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Techyling
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent getaway at this quaint hotel in Old Montreal. The welcome was warm and I was nicely surprised with a room upgrade to a beautiful room. This hotel is perfect if you would like to enjoy a quiet getaway in Montreal, and is ideal for a stay in the Vieux Montreal. Rain Spa, which is at the hotel is ideal if you're staying the night. It has so many treatments to offer but I'd definitely recommend booking this in advance. If I had more $$ to spend on a relaxing break in the city, I'd definitely stay here. This is a warm and inspiring place to delve into your creative thoughts!

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic and Stylish in Old Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: pmbpmb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very clean and outstanding service. Stayed in an upgraded suite, fantastic decor, furnishings and views. Must check-out the in-hotel Spa, ask for Genevieve. Will visit again for sure! PMB from Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Pacifici
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Place d'Armes for one night. We were given a room on the 3rd floor of the Alexander Cross building with 20 feet high ceiling, floor to ceiling windows, confortable king bed and huuuge bathroom with rainshower. Check-in was a breeze and the complementary drinks included a nice selection of wines - about 10 bottles to choose from. Contrary to what others have said, we found the hotel very quiet even though there was a wedding party taking place. Breakfast was good with nice selection of pastries, pÃ¢tÃ©s and fruits. On the negative side, we would have appreciated to be offered French baguettes at breakfast but there was none. Also, too bad espresso and cafÃ© au lait were not included in the breakfast. Finally, valet parking is 25$ per night. Not outrageous but I don't understand why they ask clients staying at the hotel to pay for parking. All in all, a great stay at a great price. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mother daughter weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: cocoamigo
Reviews.Content: This was my third time at the hotel, first with my young daughter. The staff remembered me, treated us like royalty, and it could not have been more perfect. I ususally go with my boyfriend, for a romantic getaway but the hotel is located in such a perfect spot, and the staff has always been so lovely, that when I wanted to take my daughter to Monteral, I wouldn't go anywhere else. The hotel has a spa, and she got her first experince there, also fantastic. The staff helped her practice french, they treated her like the young adult she thinks she is... (11) It is not easy traveling alone, and I felt safe and my needs were met whenever I called to the front desk (and she did too!). I have never been to a hotel where every single staff member is kind and helpful. The rooms are fabulous, luxurious but sleek at the same time. This one felt like we were in an old flat with high brick walls, The bathrooms are awesome with jet tubs and rain showers. You actually want to hang out in your room. I have never rated a hotel on a website either. So, there you have it. Go to this hotel. It's the only place I will stay at in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and best location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Marlene192
Reviews.Content: This is not a large hotel like the chain hotels in most large cities. It is located in the midst of the old town and you can walk to Chinatown and the river very easily. Metro and bus service is also located close by. The hotel staff welcomed us as soon as we entered the lobby. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful with local information. Our room was quiet and elegantly appointed. Taking a shower in the rain shower was heavenly. Breakfast was included in our package and served in the bar/lounge of the hotel. Overall this hotel is one of the most pleasant experiences I have had in recent travels.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loretta711
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, very clean, comfortable, pleasant staff, immediate response to any of your needs - this is the 3rd year we have stayed and will stay again in October 2011. The suite was beautiful and the balcony in the evenings was wonderful. You are in the heart of everything and a mere walk to anything. Again the staff is friendly and very helpful. I just love staying here every year.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: FriendsFromDallas
Reviews.Content: Beautifully updated boutique hotel with a marvelous, efficient staff. (A special thank-you for excellent customer service by Nadia, Carolina, Pierre and Raymond.) We would definitely return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard”
Reviews.Author: Toronto0008
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. However, this hotel pretends to play in the same league as boutique hotels such as Le Nelligan, Le St-James or Le Germain but the offering is below par. We had booked a room with a queen size bed on the hotel's web site for $178. Upon arrival, we upgraded to a room with a king size bed. We were hoping for a free upgrade but they charged us $20, which is not the end of the world. However, the room was not what we expected at all. It was straight out of Wall Street, circa 1987, complete with VHS player and fake electrical fireplace!!! Needless to say, we couldn't dock our Ipods anywhere. The TV was so old we couldn't figure out the Habs players' numbers on their back. We were in for more surprises the next morning: the shower door didn't close properly and the oversized rain shower head would only let a trickle of water down. Thanks for the hand shower option!! Hopefully they've started renovating some rooms. In addition, not the hotel's fault, but there were kids running around at 7:30 am just outside our room. We managed to fall asleep again but the fire alarm went off at 10:00 am. That's two rude wake up calls in one day! Finally, we had brunch at the hotel's restaurant. The food was passable at best. My omelette was burned on one side and undercooked on the other. Lattes ($4.50!) were cold and freshly squeezed orange juice ($6.00!) straight out of a bottle of Tropicana. Hotel Place d'Armes, glad we tried you, but we will go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & venue”
Reviews.Author: Satisfied_customer97
Reviews.Content: Le Place D'Armes is an amazingly elegant hotel with staff that have a beautiful authenticity about them. The comfort and design of the rooms is worth the price and is a great fit for both business or personal occasions. If you are planning a trip to Montreal you simply need to check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel right in historic area”
Reviews.Author: MrTico
Reviews.Content: Stylish boutique hotel centrally located in historic district. Very helpful and friendly hotel staff. Also close to metro. Quiet clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BabsBillingsley
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. We stayed in a junior suite - after the first one wasn't to our liking (it was split between 2 floors), a staff member took us by two other rooms and we chose the one we liked the best. I thought the front desk service was very good - I noticed some people said that they were not very receptive, but we found them very helpful. We did not ask for a lot of suggestions or help (and it's true that when I asked them when their partner hotel's restaurant - Verses - closed for lunch, they told me 3, but it was really 2, so we were pretty disappointed when we showed up at 2:02 for lunch!). Our key cards stopped working twice, which was annoying (and must happen a lot if it happened to us twice in four days!). Our room was lovely, though it was a little dark. The bathroom was REALLY dark, but fine since we didn't need a lot of light in there. :) We faced downtown and though there was a fire house down there, we slept great all four nights. They let us check out at 2pm with no charge since the hotel wasn't full the day we left. The bar was nice, we didn't eat at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kiffs
Reviews.Content: I'd never heard of this hotel before a friend invited to to her wedding which what taking place at the hotel. I couldn't have asked for a better venue or place to stay. I grew up in Montreal and have stayed in my far share of hotels downtown and The Place d'Armes Hotel is by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and certainly the best hotel I've stay in in Montreal to date. It's very modern and chic but cozy and inviting at the same time. I was in Montreal for a wedding (taking place at the hotel actually) and I was able to check in early and relax in a comfy bathrobe in my room for a few hours prior to the wedding. My room was lovely and was extremely comfortable. Check out was a breeze and when I asked for assistance with getting my luggage out of my room, not only did they send up a bellboy, they also took my car out of parking and had it waiting for me at the front door. Although I did not eat in the restaurant, other people from my party mentioned that the continental breakfast and well as the standard breakfast was delicious. If the meal that I ate at the reception was any indication of the kitchen's/restaurants culinary expertise, they food is likely excellent. It's certainly not the cheapest hotel in Montreal but I found it to be worth every cent and then some. I'm looking forward to going back in the near future for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent food, great cocktails.”
Reviews.Author: BrewTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with my husband who was travelling for a conference. We compared notes on our rooms with coworkers (5 in total) and each one was completely different (shower/bath; king/queen/double beds; spacious/tiny; dated/modern etc.) Seemed there was no consistency from room to room which can be expected when three historic buildings are joined together. Bar often had lots of afterwork activity with a loud DJ. Good if you're interested in being at one of the "it" places. Rooms were not cleaned to a very high standard (used razor in the bathroom, hairs, dust). Beds were very comfortable. Quiet room (unless you're on top of the lounge).

Reviews.Title: “Plush, Worth the Price but watch the extras.”
Reviews.Author: ivyjusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights to celebrate an anniversary/ babymoon. We were in a King Deluxe room on the 3rd floor and we were happy with everything. The room is beautiful, the bathroom to-die-for, service is impecable, views, I could go on and on. I used the gym which was nice and well stocked and I also visited the Spa and the Lounge downstairs. Beware the price of the minibar, room service, and spa services and products. Most items are charged THREE seperate taxes - Federal, Local, and then a lodging tax. Our room-service lunch, though delicious, ran us upwards of $50 (for one shared plate plus beverages!). The spa was very nice but I felt pressured to by products which lessened the enjoyment of the spa treatment. The lounge/bar (Suite 401?) on the gound floor had great service, and a very nice atomsphere but the food left something to be desired. Overall I highly reccomend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, building and rooms a few service issues”
Reviews.Author: jadrake_ta1
