Reviews.Content: The Place d'Armes is in a great location, just a few blocks from the subway and close to all the tourist sites without feeling too touristy. The building is great with modern interior complementing the historic exterior. The staff was very friendly; however our room was not cleaned before 4:00PM in any of the 3 days we stayed here. Also we got 2 free vouchers for drinks upon check-in, so we went up to the roof bar the last night we were there and asked if we could use them there. The hostess said yes and seated us. A few minutes later they came by and told us they were incorrect and we couldn't use them. Seemed strange to backtrack like that at such a nice hotel. The roof bar on a summer evening was great through.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel full of charm”
Reviews.Author: DNBinNC
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded from a Junior Suite to an Executive Suite. WOW - room was amazing - really spacious and comfortable. Modern inside but surrounded by the charm of the original buildings. I was in the third building (Alexander Cross) - the newest building but two walls were the original brick walls - very cool! Large seating area with couch, fireplace, minibar, dining table and large desk. Most comfortable bed ever (and faux fur throw), huge bathroom with rainwater showerhead, jetted tub built for two and an additional powder room. Lots of closet and drawer space. Very quiet! Was just completely wowed - Especially given the amazing price I got the room for through Tablet. Visited the bar/restaurant (701) every night I was there - service was great, martinis were amazing and the food impressive. Prices were high - but I found that to be true all over Montreal. Location can't be beat - across the street from Notre Dame and you're right in the middle of Old Montreal and all of its bistros and shops. You will love this place - give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Old world Charm, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: andrea_jamieson8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Place d'Armes September 27th - 30th, 2010. The hotel was beautful with a great ambiance however i found the front desk service and rooms mediocre. When i arrived in the evening i was given an extremely dark room (3201) with a view that was completely blocked by a large tree, you could literally see nothing out the window and also the tv remote did not work (frustrating after a long day of travelling). On the plus side room was very clean. The next day i went down to ask to switch my room and it almost appeared that my request was bothersome, when i told the two front desk staff members which room i was in, they said something in French pointed at there computer screens and giggled. I have know idea if they were laughing at me or something totally unrelated but it was extremely rude. i was actually in shock that they did that in my presence. I did get transferred to another room, which was much brighter and also very clean and pleasant. Also my colleague booked through the same travel agency and recieved a much higher price was told the reason for the price increase was that there were no more rooms available only junior suites, but how can that be when i was offered a choice of two rooms when i requested to switch to another room in my price range? She was also informed that her breakfast was not included and my breakfast was. Being that were both from the same company and my colleague paid more for the room, shouldn't breakfast be included for the both of us? something fishy...Breakfast was good overall, enjoyed the montreal bagels, would have been great if they offered a few different options on different days...I'm choosing to recommend this hotel for the location, but i wouldn't recommend it if you are big on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: Other than the fun, helpful and uber friendly bellman the staff was horribly rude and unhelpful. We loved the convenient old town location, huge room and fast internet but all else fell short. I couldn't believe the attitude of the front desk staff. Each time I'd approach the front desk the staff acted as if they were bothered. There was no concierge to help with directions and recommendations so often I'd ask the front desk staff and they would not even get back to me/us. The hotel just didn't feel clean. The floors were dirty. The glass in the elevator was broken. The gym was unkempt. The room was generally clean, though. The room was a bit dark. We stayed in the largest room at the top which offered a great amt of space. Wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Better Hotels available at lower price”
Reviews.Author: Pawan_Review
Reviews.Content: I paid Canadian Dollars 245 + taxes per night without Breakfast for this hotel. Poor Service, Slow Internet connection. I am a frequent traveller and I believe that this was one of my worst hotel experience so far. On the day of checkput on Friday, the hotel enforced the 12:00 Deadline without fail. The hotel has a cancellation policy which levies one days charge if you cancel ( less than one month) or depart early.. Beware - I would not go to this hotel in my life even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Special”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple425
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times, but our last time was for our destination wedding in Montreal. We had no worries recommending place d'armes for our friends and family, and I heard nothing but rave reviews! The staff is wonderful, particularly the concierge team and front desk. They have gone above and beyond for us more times than I can count. Rooms are incredible, and a great value as well. A large portion of our guests work at luxury properties in NYC, and they were blown away. Amazing stay, can't wait to return..... I will say that I previously didn't recommend it for families, but I was proven wrong this trip, our guests with kids were just as happy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: WoldTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married on Aug 14th of this year at La Place D'Armes. From the first time we met with Dawn Scott, we knew we were in great hands. After visiting numerous venues, from the West Island, to Downtown, to Tremblant and the Old Port, this was indeed the best bang for the buck and location Simply could not be beat. In an attempt to hold a cocktail dinner style wedding, Dawn and the team used their creativity to come up with a design and style that matched our personalities. All the comments we received were all positive. From the delicious stations and decadent canapes, to The open bar, the night could not have been better! All the rooms we visited due to family and friends, everything were in tip top shape and provided chic and elegance to our guests. We ended up in the Penthouse suite which was Simply a perfect way to end our day and would recommend It to anyone thinking of spoiling themselves. All in all, everybody was kind, friendly and made sure that Our day was one to remember. This includes the Dawn and her team, the bartenders and servers, The front desk and even the valet. Even though we live in Montreal, we will be going back, even if for one night! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “needs to be refurbished! Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: toyBeirut
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the place d'armes and did not like it. The general ambience of the room is black, the windows are very small, our window was broken, the down corner of the bathroom door was broken, the swoer pressure is very weak... The room was a suite with a sofa bed, we arrived in the evening exhausted from a long trip... the sofa bed was not done for our little girls, we had to call housekeeping... The second day we asked to change rooms, the first one had 1 small window and the view was a parking lot... The 2nd one was slightly better, 2 small windows... but why is the decor so dark!!?? The TV is a fat old one... Overall...really needs to be refreshed upside down!

Reviews.Title: “Very good rooms, excellent restaurant, gliches in service.”
Reviews.Author: LDMS
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the old part of Montreal, convenient to restaurants, sites, and transportation. Three historic buildings joined and restored. Very spacious rooms, although ours had inadequate lighting in the seating area, excellent baths, dramatic well designed public areas. The latter, including the bar (this is a happening spot for the younger set), tend to be loud. No service elevators means the staff park their carts in the hallways and use the main elevators. Sloppy client profiling and tracking: our breakfast package was dropped, I was repeatedly called by the wrong name by Room Service, and substantial charges incorrectly billed appeared on my final tab - the last corrected by the concierges. Hopefully, these types of errors will be corrected. The restaurant Aix, the rooms, and the value are worth a few bumps on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Vibrant!”
Reviews.Author: PatriiciaN
Reviews.Content: Vibrant and seductive boutique hÃ´tel. A hidden gem in the Old MontrÃ©al. Well located, sympathetic valet, courteous friendly concierge, trendy Suite 701 where business and local people mingle. Have a great cocktail and learn some french. Wait for the road work to be completed on the historic Place d'Armes across the street if you plan to sleep in!!!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment - overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: lsmout
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel at the end of July and were frankly quite happy to leave. The staff are hard work - although they speak English on reception many of the staff around the hotel don't or pretend they don't so eventually you just give up. Perhaps that is want they want you to do. We found the staff on reception unhelpful and abrupt and the overall service poor. Perhaps it is the French/Canadian way - just like many hotels in France? Over the years we have stayed in countless hotels in North America both Canada and the US where we travel extensively and this is the first hotel we have stayed in that we have disliked. The room we had was very dark and the dark wood/laquered furniture just adds to this. The beds were hard and the bathroom although it had a nice big shower was also very dark. Our windows looked straight out onto an office block and on the basis that we could see them so they could probably see us you felt you had to keep the blinds down or closed all the time so whenever we were in our room we had to keep the lights on. On our first evening the light in the closet and one by the bed did not work. They came and fixed them next day but the one in the closet was left hanging out by wires and stayed on permanently for the next 4 days. They also left bits of ceiling tile all over the floor which was still there for the next 2 days until we picked it up. Don't they check these things when they prepare the room for the next guests or just rely on you to report them? There were only 4 hangers so we had to ask for more. Day 1 our room was cleaned at 9.30am as the maid was going in as we left for breakfast. Day 2 she turmed up at 4.30pm - after one visit to reception and 2 phone calls to housekeeping later. Apparently rooms are done any time between 9-5pm and you have to ask if you want it done before noon but they only tell you this when you complain the room has not been done when you get back after a day out. Breakfast was included in our stay but is a waste of time. Poor selection of not very fresh cereals and breads and lukewarm coffee or water for tea. They also give you a bill to sign each morning so they can charge the hotel for this as they claim to be 'separate' from the hotel, forcing you to feel compelled to give a tip for someone to bring you a lukewarm beverage and the rest is self service. Drinks, food and the mini bar are over priced. The 'happy hour' advertised on the website no longer exists. We used the bar only once in the end as it always seemed to be full of noisy buisness people staying over after conferences or meetings in the building next door. The same was true at breakfast when we always seemed to be sitting next to someone having a business meeting. The roof garden was locked for some reason during our stay despite the fact that the weather was very hot. I would also suggest you check your bill when you leave and what has been charged to your credit card. Despite running through the items with me at the desk that all seemed correct, the woman on reception then printed the bill, put it in an envelope and handed it to me. Luckily we were not leaving for a couple of hours and so when we went out for lunch I took the bill out and had a look and saw that I had been overcharged by almost CSD$900!! I am just glad I looked before we left so I could get the refund on ly card straight away. She didn't even say sorry when I went back to desk just - 'oh yes that is a mistake don't worry I will do a refund'. This hotel has a good reputation locally we heard but we thought it was very average and although it is in a good location for the Old City and Port there are better hotels in the city I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not quite what I remembered”
Reviews.Author: AdrianTorontoOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Place D'Armes for two nights in early August 2010, in room 2206, part of the atrium overlooking the reception area. The room was spacious and modern. Weakness were that the lighting is quite dim and there are only wooden blinds without drapes, so quite a lot of light comes in from the street. Finally, on a Saturday night, the lobby was loud which made it hard to nap in the early evening. Ate two meals at the hotel; one on the roof top terrace and one in the casual bar/resto off the lobby. In both cases, the service level was somewhat inattentive. On a previous stay around April 2010, I ate in the formal restuarant in the basement, which was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Charming yet modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: thelarsleys
Reviews.Content: The hotel s made up of three buildings, so my guess is that each section is a bit different. We were in the third, and our room was incredibly spacious, with exposed brick, a fireplace, full couch and seating area, and a beautiful bathroom with a waterfall shower. It is located a short distance from the subway and the old city neighborhood is has lots of restaurants and areas for walking. The only issue we had was that the wireless didn't penetrate the walls well (which was logical, given the thickness and the brick).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the historical center of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Cibal
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in the heart of Montreal, we really enjoyed this hotel. The most important in our view is that the employees always tried their best to help us in a very friendly way. During our second night other guests became very noisy. We called the reception and the issue was solved quickly without leaving any bad feelings to anybody. Renovations in the bathroom are necessary (stained ceiling and walls) but it is not a question of cleanliness. The windows were really dirty but some digging was on going on the Place d'Armes nearby. The bars on the ground floor and on the terraces are sometime crowded. Be aware that if you want a martini at 6pm on Thursday, you will have to fight for it. This should however not stop you. We had a small lunch at the bar on the ground floor. Excellent value for money, clearly better than the other restaurants we tried in the tourist area nearby. We will certainly choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, service and food; junior suite with balcony was a delight”
Reviews.Author: WhatAWriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and enjoyed each one greatly. We shopped the online specials and prepaid in advance to get a junior suite with balcony for $259/nt ++ tax, etc. This suite was very spacious, with a fabulous and well-appointed bathroom with a snazzy, deep jetted tub and huge separate shower. The outdoor balcony had cute furnishings for dining or simply sitting. The balcony is not large, but serves the purpose of sitting outside with a drink or room service. The view to our right was Montreal's first skyscraper, and to our left we could see the lights of the old port and distant hills. Although you do not have a water view, this hotel has a better location in our opinion than staying in the touristy old port area. We were one block from the Basilica de Notre Dame (be sure to see that!), and just steps away from Place D'Armes (being renovated during our visit). We could walk to the port, restaurants and nightspots easily, but we were just blocks from the Metro and Chinatown, too. Inside our suite, there was a sitting area for watching TV, with a sofa, coffee table and two armchairs, plus a small table and chairs by the windows. We switched on the faux fireplace just for ambiance.The bed was wonderful; we slept great. The hotel's restaurant AIX is highly rated and expensive, but very, very good. We did not eat in the bar restaurant, but I think you can get reasonably priced fare there. Room service appeared to be from the same kitchen as AIX, so the food also was very good but reasonably priced. In fact, we started each day with room service and even dined on our balcony one evening. The concierge was extremely helpful, and bell/valet were, too. My only complaint was that the desk in our room had an electronic outlet where you were supposed to be able to plug in chargers, but this was not working, as well as the refrigerator. I mentioned this to the front desk, and they came up and messed around with the wall outlet. The refrigerator started working, but the desk outlet jacks never did. You would think hotels would understand the urgency of having live outlets for today's "information" world. However, the hotel does have two free Internet-connected computers in a hotel lobby-way, and you can print boarding passes and other documents for a small fee. Other than this complaint about the computer desk outlet, we absolutely loved Le Place D'Armes in Montreal and will stay there again if we return. By the way, I tried to book a junior suite online and the system said it was unavailable, but I called the hotel directly and they had one. The operator said the hotel held back a few rooms for those who call directly. So, if you don't get the room you want via the online booking system, call.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location and hotel to stay in olde montreal”
Reviews.Author: MelbournianScooter1
Reviews.Content: Was on a 3 day training program that was held at the hotel and also stayed an additiuonal 4 nights with my wife. It was a fantastic place to stay withing 100 mteres of the subway so was really covenient but for those who want to walk to Saint Catherines Street it would be approx 15 min walk. Only problem we had was the fire station close by and went off at all hours a couple of nights. A bit of road construction was also occurring which made noise also but isn't the fault of the hotel. If you include the breakfast this is well worthwhile too and of good quality. As an aussie I didn't realise the tip requirement at the the bar and the lady bartender was pretty rude about it and could have handled it better.

Reviews.Title: “world class”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 days had the penthouse suite i was there for a party the hotel crystal was booked so i stayed there this hotel is worth every penny. on the smaller scale of a hotel but very modern rooms nice big bathrooms i really enjoyed my stay not to mention i even had a few friends back to my room after and never had a issue with any other guest or the hotel. I never tried the hotel restaurant I never eat at hotels when i am in Montreal, place d'armes does have a nice cocktail bar down stairs to ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, style”
Reviews.Author: Seitchik
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in an historic building with a fantastic location. Nice rooms, very friendly and service-oriented staff. Great little touches like chocolates on the pillow and turn-down service. Very helpful concierge. I was in Laval for business and went to Montreal for the weekend. I walked to restaurants, bars, the river, shopping. Close enough to walk to Mont Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Very special”
Reviews.Author: ferrarihotpants
Reviews.Content: Super staff, and great rooms- crazy clean! Good deal on the breakfast in bed- go for the studio rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of $100 extra cost for children”
Reviews.Author: ottawaon
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Place d'Armes several times in the past and have recommend this hotel to others. However, you should beware that starting in July 2010, the hotel charges an extra $100 for 2 children!! staying in the same room as the parents. This is according to the online booking tool. During previous visits, the rate for 2 adults was the same as 2 adults and 2 children. As well, standard rates no longer includes continental breakfast, as they did in the past. Continental breaks is available by booking a "bed & breakfast" package which cost more than a room without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great value”
Reviews.Author: zoooka
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel located at Le Place D'Armes which is in Old Montreal. It is located approximately one block from a Metro station and about one block from the Notre Dame Basilica. If you head north a few blocks, you're in the heart of Old Montreal where many shops and restaurants are located. A few blocks from the Metro station is Chinatown where you can find inexpensive and quick eats. Because Montreal has such a wonderful Metro system, staying close to one is a convenient starting point to other areas of the city. This a modern, attractive, hotel in a historic building. There are plenty of staff at the lobby available to efficiently and kindly get you checked in and are comfortable speaking English with you if necessary. There is a very bustling, trendy bar on the first floor. Although we stayed on the second floor, it was surprisingly not so bad. I did hear some faint beating music but definitely not loud enough prevent a good night's rest. The room was a standard room with a king sized bed. The ceiling was high and flooring was dark wood. The room was clean and the bathroom roomy. The only complaint I would have would be that the cleaning staff were quite late. Once we got back at 5pm and our room still hadn't been made yet. Rainspa: adequate/no frills spa has a steam room 2 bathrooms with a very small shower and no hairdryer. Masseuse Genieve very friendly and did a great job. I definitely would recommend this hotel. For $150 cad/night, it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night aweful the next”
Reviews.Author: Bbear332
Reviews.Content: Stayed here since we loved the nelligan in montreal and this is owned by the same group. Had a fantastic experience the first night, beautiful suite, spa tub, rain shower, fireplace, comfy king bed and even the pull out was very comfortable and beautifully set for the kids ( we have three). Decided to come back again after 2 day stay in Quebec city. The temperature in the room was 84F. After calling downstairs and having someone come up, he said it should go down shortly. Well at 11 pm it was at 81F and felt like a sauna. The nice young lady downstairs, the only one on duty, said there was no one to fix the heat or to prepare the same Type of room for us(it was not clean). She offered a two double bed room on a different floor to keep the kids comfortable. We carried the sleeping kids, aged 1, 4 and 6, to another floor, what a scene that was! The temperature in the original room never dropped past 79F. In the am when I went down and explained to a much incresed staff what happened they said it does happen sometimes and they are sorry. I tried to tell them it was very inconvenient and was definitely not the experiewe expected. I thought they would offer something to make up for the trouble. They have not until I asked if they would do something. After talking with the manager, the young man offered a 20% discount on our room rate. Definitely appreciated it, just wished they had offered it on their own, without us having to ask. We are not the type to want something for nothing, just wanted a comfy and peaceful stay like the first time.

Reviews.Title: “An Almost Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hospgirl93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel mid week Feb 16th and 17th with some female members of my family for our anual spa getaway. The concierge gave us some great suggestions before we arrived. The valet and door man greeted us as soon as we pulled up and started unloading our bags for us. Check in was quick and easy and the gentleman was friendly and accomodating in finding two rooms for us on the same floor. The Rain Spa was very relaxing and we all enjoyed our services. We ate at the hotels breakfast one night for dinner and it was more than expected, the service was great and the food delectable. We only had two issues durring our stay. First we had charged the spa serviced back to our room and even though I had left a credit card for incidentals with the desk they locked us out one of our rooms. The girl at the desk that night was not apologetic at all and informed us that it was the only way she had to contact us. Well clearly she didn't try calling the room as we were in the room left to visit our other room and came back to be locked out. I had to go down to the front desk get a new key, go back to the room to get my credit card for her, and then back down to the front desk. The same girl checked us our in the morning and when we informed her that the jets in our tub didn't work she didn't apologize for that either. It doesn't take that much effort to say "oh I'm sorry". Beyond that on employee everything was wonderful, we all felt completely pampered. Lesson of the story is aparently don't charge anything back to the room or you will be locked out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: mre1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for a conference. My conference was at the Sheraton Centre Ville, but I was much happier to stay in the old city, as there were more restaurants and nightlife in this part of town. Montreal is such a compact city, that walking into the financial center from this hotel was only 15-20 minutes. For those planning to stay in the downtown central core/financial district, it seems to largely shut down at night. The hotel had an excellent free wine and cheese service 5-7 pm and a large breakfast buffet for free. The staff were always helpful. We had a 5th floor room, with excellent up to date furnishings and a huge bathroom/jacuzzi tub. My only complaint about the room was not enough lighting. Considering the location, freebies, and excellent style, it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: rubyredtoo
Reviews.Content: I spent two night in a king comfort room. My room had a fireplace which was electric so more just a decorative space heater than a fireplace but interesting element to the room. The space was large including the bathroom and shower. The decor in my room was modern bit felt a bit dark to me. I saw another room by the elevator that had exposed brick walls which looked more inviting than the decor in my room. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and the staff is extremely nice and helpful. My only negative experience was with one room service order that they lost and it took a second call and a full hour from the original call to get the order but it was an error by the restaurant AX more than the hotel. All other room service orders we easy and fine. There is a fire station near the hotel and one night it was silent, another night three sirens went off as the truck left on a call. I was not bothered by this since I already live in a noisy city but some people may have an issue with it. In fairness the sirens are not blaringly loud and all in all I would book another stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyni
Reviews.Content: Special thanks to Rene, the fabulous concierge, who faxed all my tickets to me in NY, as I had left them behind in my room. Ask for daily updates of what is on in Montreal, printed direct from his computer. Computers with internet available to all. Rooms are clean, comfortable and the service is fabulous. Location is great. Price is a bit high, but worth it. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dhfr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Place d'Armes Hotel for 3 nights in October 2009. This hotel embodies Montreal - ultracool and sleek, while maintaining its roots in Old World charm. All of my friends who stayed here were equally impressed. Unlike other reviewers, I encountered only the warmest and most inviting service. Everyone was more than willing to go out of their way just to make things more convenient and comfortable for me. I had a flawless experience and will definitely stay there again. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Impressed”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I heartily endorse the many positive reviews of the Place d'Armes on Tripadvisor: this is simply one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in 30 years of business travel. In my experience, a key indicator of what makes a good hotel is the reception you receive upon your arrival. At the Place d'Armes, there was no wait for check-in, and the front-desk staff are professional and efficient: you can tell that they have been carefully recruited and trained. (And dare I say that your language has no influence on how you are treated. ) As noted in other recent reviews, the hotel is sleek and modern; the rooms are large and luxurious; and the complimentary buffet breakfast is very good. I will definitely visit the Place d'Armes in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Tres bon!!”
Reviews.Author: tooltime02723
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy staying in an upscale hotel that has great rooms, helpful staff & a convienant location look no further than Le Place d'Armes Hotel. My wife and I had the occasion to stay here over the Columbus day weekend and thought it was the best hotel we have ever had the pleasure to stay in. The rooms were well appointed, the bathroom was super with a wonderful walk in shower and the exposed brick wall gave the room a warm comfortable feeling from the moment you enter. Breakfast (included in our room fee) included select juices, hot & cold cereals,fresh fruit, breads/muffins/bagels and coffee. We had a nightly complimintary wine and cheese offered in the bar (one wine per person per night) which we availed ourselves to on only one night as we were out on the town. We stayed in building #3, which was very quiet (I have read some reports here about the nightclub being very noisy at night...which is located in building #1) The Place d'Armes was located a block up from Notre Dame cathedral, and a short walk to old Montreal and the metro. We got an all day pass on the subway($9.00 per person)and was able to cover much of the town during our stay. Check out the Jean Talon farmers market, the bioreserve located in the old Olympic grounds and St. Joesph's cathedral for some interesting points of visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jooph
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyd the hotel. Nice rooms with a mixture of old and design new. The hotelrooms were brilliant, good location, excellent breakfast, perfect beds.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant comfort in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Xoe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 2-day stay at Place D'Armes before boarding Holland America's Maasdam for a 7-day cruise from Montreal to Boston. The hotel's location is a short walk to Notre Dame Basilica; we could and did walk to all sites of interest in Old Montreal. We also took a 3-hour Gray Line tour to see places of interest in other parts of the city. Our room was spacious with fine old-world touches. All staff were personable and helpful. There were computers for guest use, without charge. A nice plus was an included breakfast with good choices to start our days. In the photo of the hotel exterior, notice the red umbrellas on the top floor. This was a restaurant/bar with marvelous views, open from noon into the evening -- another nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenlats
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel. We were upgraded due to my membership with Tablet Plus, which put us in a large, executive suite. Great exposed brick, comfy bed, big tvs, awesome bathroom, half bath, etc. Only issues were the clock radio didn't work, our maid did not come back to clean our room one day, the safe broke, and the shower/towel rack fell down. Otherwise the rooftop bar, downstairs restaurant and bar are very cool. It's also an excellent location to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Long on slick, short on charm”
Reviews.Author: alan93
Reviews.Content: I suppose it just wasn't my cup of tea. Very slick and chic, but cold, cold, cold. Lots of hard, smooth surfaces in public area. Dimly lit corridors and room. Very noisy in breakfast room. Maybe my unpleasant concierge experience colored my view: after a day of travel and settling into the room, we asked for casual dinner recommendations in the area. The concierge made a computer entry, then took a phone call which involved him chatting, then opening an envelope and counting out the money inside of it while we were standing and waiting. I finally had to say "excuse me, but could you just point us in a direction? We're hungry!" He looked surprised and handed us two printouts. That said, the room was spacious and beautifully appointed, though on the dark side. The bathroom ( again dark ,with black tiles) was nevertheless, huge and luxurious. Room service was prompt. It seemed a perfect hotel for a business trip, but could use some warmer accents, in my opinion. The location was excellent, a block from metro stop, but there are other hotels in the old Montreal area that looked more charming to me.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: uvabrian
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife here off-season so the room price was great relative to the summer rates. The location is perfect if you want to stay near the old part of Montreal and it isn't too far to the subway and is a reasonable walk to Blvd Levesque. The room was flawless. Perfect bed and furniture. Rain shower in the huge bathroom. The hotel bar was a cool place to relax after exploring the city. Comparable to a W hotel in terms of style and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Here- Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: gfkr2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Place d' Armes Hotel and Suites for 4 nights as part of a business meeting at the Convention Center, which is only a stone's throw away (nice). The service throughout our stay was great. The staff was friendly and eager to please us. We asked lots of questions on directions, restaurants, parking, whatever and couldn't shake this staff. I especially appreciated Henri at the front desk who more often than not was the "lucky man" for my numerous inquiries and idle chat about his city. More Things we like about the Pd'A: The location on the edge of Old Montreal and still close to the Metro station one block away at the convention center. The Gym on the 5th floor where I couldn't get the HDTV to work in the gym and call the front desk. A staff member was there in one minute apologizing for the TV not working when he knew the snafu was caused by my own hi-tech incompetance. The evening wine and cheese; a very nice gesture and a great place to relax after a busy day. Ditto for the free continental breakfast in Suite 701 with plenty of breads, cereals, fresh fruit to fill everyone except a hungry lumber-jack. I liked that there were always fresh apples in the gym and lobby; The Roof Top Bar was trendy and unexpectedly classy with a great view of Notre Dame Basilica; A working Wi-Fi with a stong signal everywhere on premises; The bed which my wife said was one of the most comfortable she had ever slept-in; general upkeep and cleanliness everywhere. Things that could have been better at the Pd'A: We stayed in Building 2 and had no exposed bricks on any the charm in other rooms noted in these reviews. We paid for a deluxe suite and felt the room was really a standard/superior room; I was disappointed the hotel didn't give us a nicer room considering I told them it was a "major anniversary" at the time of booking; the the fireplace didn't work for reasons unknown; the jet tub wouldn't hold water due to a leaky drain rendering it totally useless during our stay; the huge overhead shower didn't work well due to low water pressure; the room lighting was too dim for our liking. These items only slightly downgraded our stay. If you are staying in Montreal for a convention or there for leisure, I highly recommend you stay in Old Montreal. We visited a number of other downtown hotels during our stay, which were similar to what you find in any big city. The charm of Old Montreal can't be beat and I have no reservations recommending the Place d' Armes to anyone looking for a classy and trendy hotel near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the Old Montreal section in this hotel that is only 1 block away from the Notre Dame Basilica and about 3 to 4 blocks from the waterfront area and all the streets for restaurants and shops. With taxes included the price was approx $200 per night and we thought it was a good value due to the great location. Parking your car runs $21 per night. The hotel is an older building but it is well maintained. Our room was large and the staff was very accommodating, Every day your stay includes a free continental breakfast (bagels, breads, muffins, fresh fruit, etc.) that was very good and every evening from 5 to 7 pm you have a free wine, cheese and french bread reception. Both are a nice touch and add to the value of your stay. The hotel has an open air roof top bar serving a light food menu and there is also a full service restaurant in the hotel. If you are visiting Old Montreal for a taste of French Canadian hospitality this is definitely worth considering. We always stay a 4 star plus hotels and resorts and we were happy with this choice. We booked through hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Style, comfort, and location”
Reviews.Author: Cranbear
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s nice to walk into a hotel room and be impressed! Both the size and the decor of our room at the Hotel Place dâ€™Armes were exceptional. The furniture was large, dark,and metro-modern, and the soft furnishings were plush and comfortable. The bedroom had a large sitting area with a sofa and an easy chair, plus an electric fireplace -- not as tacky as it sounds, and it offered both heat and charm on a winter evening. The bath fittings were sleek and modern, and the shower stall was larger than most hotel bathrooms. High ceilings in both rooms made them feel even more spacious. My only reservation is that the lighting was a little too low and dramatic -- it was rather difficult to read in the sitting area. The hotel was converted from three historic commercial buildings; the coversion maintains the charm of the old architecture while adding a definite urban-modern style. Service at the front desk was always cheerful and helpful. The restaurants recommended at the front desk were exceptionally good. A decent continental breakfast (pastries, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit salad) and an evening wine-and-cheese reception was included with the room. Hot breakfast was available at an additional cost. Hotel Place d"Armes is on the edge of Old Montreal, just across a park from the Church of Notre Dame. The restaurants, bars, shops, and museums of Old Town are a short downhill stroll (even in the dead of winter it was very do-able). NEARBY: For a great dinner, try Le Petit Moulinsart, about four blocks from the hotel. The restaurant specializes in mussels, but every dish we tried was excellent. The chef went out of his way to accommodate the vegan among us; she said her meal was absolutely outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty hotel, disinterested staff”
Reviews.Author: mimibeaven
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of other reviews on this website and the 2009 frommers guide. The location is great, very convenient for going anywhere, a Metro station is nearby, the Vieux Port and Vieux Montreal are a stroll. My problem was really about the cleanliness of the hotel and the general disinterest of the staff. We had booked a deluxe suite for our 3 night stay (we have two children). On arrival the room was not clean, the carpets had not been vacuumed and the sink in the main bathroom was not cleaned properly. I called reception and someone came to show me the room next door. The carpet there was the same so we opted to have housekeeping come and vacuum the original room as our children had already started settling in. The receptionist did not apologise and was not particularly interested in the problem. On observing the rest of the hotel it was clear that cleanliness is not a big thing here, most common areas were grubby and not well cared for. The general staff disinterest was not limited to the receptionist either. Servers at breakfast really were not happy to be there, no smiles, disgruntled looks when anything was asked for, everything was too much to ask for. Nobody ever addressed us when we entered the hotel either apart from once. I am not sure if I am asking too much but it doesn't cost anything to appear interested and it has put me off recommending this hotel so I guess that should be a problem for them. I wish we had found the hotel in all the reviews but unfortunately we did not.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lovesanicehotel
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel specifically for its location near to the Old Town. On arrival we were not disappointed as it was situated on a lovely historic square opposite a beautiful old church. The hotel is three buildings cleverly converted, but I unfortunately cannot remember which number part we stayed in. The communal areas were chic, clean and included great extras such as leather couches and a pool table. Every day wine and cheese is served, for which you receive a token. We were never around at the right time but they always let us have our wine later on return, although it wasn't exactly the best! The staff were helpful, and the breakfast in particular was very good. They put out a great spread of high quality items to choose from, and we found it a great way to start the day's sightseeing. We had a suite as this was all that was available. The room was fantastic, well appointed and cleverly decorated in a modern but warm style. The bathroom was large and clean, but the water pressure was not really up to the rainforest shower head and the jacuzzi tub sounded like a rocket taking off. They looked great but were really no more than gimmicks. However the shower was huge and there was a normal shower head to use, and the bath made for a relaxing soak with the bubbles off. We really enjoyed the seating area. One drawback was that the room was a little dark as the windows are near to another building. There was enough lighting to deal with this though. On leaving we declared all our mini bar items so I was pretty annoyed to find a charge on our card when we got home. However when I raised this by email with the manager it was refunded immediately. This is my only reason for a one rather than five star. Although a little disapointed by this behaviour, I am impressed with how they handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevieBNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Situated in the old town, close to metro station. Lovely stay at this hotel, rooms very comfortable and large with ensuite also. Had a couple of bar meals which were of very good quality. Staff very helpful and friendly. Would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Satin
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money. Breakfast and wine and cheese were included. Excellent service. Great location! Would return, if we are ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Back Again... and Again... and Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Genius0013
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married at Place D'Armes in June of this year and spent two nights there. All I can say is amazing! The hotel staff was unbelievably amazing and made our day and stay simply perefct. Special thanks to Dawn who was simply remarkable. She helped us with the entire wedding (which was planned and pulled off perfectly all in just 3 weeks of planning). The staff at the front desk are courteous and willing to help with any and everything you may ask for. As mentioned in pervious reviews, there is free wine and cheese served during a select time during the first evening, but seeing as it was our wedding day, we didn't take advantage of it. The room we stayed in was 3303 (seperate room with king bed and flat screen tv, powder room, living room with another tv and dinning table in the corner, rain shower and jaccuzi tub in bathroom) was simply wonderful. We actually booked a smaller room, but the staff gave us the upgrade as a very nice gesture seeing as it was our wedding night. We received chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary and sparkling water which was nice. The entire hotel's decor is stunning (I love the brick walls) and I didn't want to leave. We will be returning on our anniversary next year and plan to every year after that.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Bon! Lavish hotel... Wonderful Experience and Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: tracitrace
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! It had a trendy, young, elegant vibe. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were spacious and plush. Our room wasn't ready when we first checked in, so the front desk upgraded us to a nicer room that was ready, so that was awesome. The bar downstairs was fun, and they had a nice, complimentary wine and cheese reception in the evening and good continental breakfast in the morning. The location of the hotel was perfect! It was walking distance to the old port, the Notre Dame church, and pretty much everything else worth seeing in Montreal, including the metro station which gets you everywhere you want to be!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Base for Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: eastporter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with wonderful service, particularly at the front desk. We drove in from Quebec, and had planned to drop the car off at a rental location in the heart of the city. When we asked the concierge for directions, he said - don't drop it off there, there's too much traffic because of the Jazz Festival. He called another (closer) location, confirmed that they'd take the car and gave us great directions to it. He and the other concierges also gave us great recommendations for restaurants, and got us a reservation at one of the local hot Italian ones (I wasn't that crazy about it, but that wasn't his fault - it got high marks in Zagat as well.) The room was comfortable, there was plenty of light for reading in bed (our usual pet peeve) and there was a view of the basilica. My only minor complaint is that the wine at the complementary happy hour wasn't very good - but the continental breakfasts were delicious. The hotel is a great base for walking around Vieux Montreal, and is very close to the Metro for other excursions (go see the botanical gardens - well worth a day.)

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Montreal to date”
Reviews.Author: kmls
Reviews.Content: We had a one-night stay at the Hotel Place d'Armes in Montreal. We will definitely choose this hotel next time we are in town. With the exception of a very poor wi-fi connection in our room (which had us give up on the Internet for the duration of our stay), everything was perfect. The room was spacious with high ceilings with a nice view of the downtown area while not being too noisy whatsoever. Keep in mind the hotel is in Old Montreal, so there is a decent walk to be had if you want to hit the downtown shopping areas of St Catherine and St Denis. The staff was extremely friendly, courteous and helpful, and even added a special touch to our stay as it was my spouse's birthday. The spa is very decent too. All in all, the Hotel Place d'Armes gets an A+ ! Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “amazing deal at unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: georgesorkin
Reviews.Content: I am a budget traveller with Beverly Hills taste, so I have a quest for finding the best possible deals at the lowest possible price. With the help of Tripadvisor -I don't leave home without it- I discovered this real gem after finding a fantastic rate with Priceline: US$130,00 a night with continental breakfast and wine and cheese evening hour included. The location can't be beat. Accross the street from Notre Dame Cathedral, 2 blocks from the subway station, walking distance to Old Montreal, China Town (no big deal), des Jardins Complex Mall , St Catherine St, in brief, the best of Monntreal is at your doorstep. Since we are explorers and don't spend a great deal of time in our rooms, be booked the standard room. Yes, as pointed out in other reviews it is in the smaller side, but it's so well appointed and functional -even elegant- that by no means we consider that to be a downside. Fluffy pillows, great mattress and comforter, good TV, a safety box, extra-clean, well-supplied bathroom with a lot of towels, a robe and high-quality toiletries. What else can one expect for such a great deal in such a great area? Breakfast and wine and cheese hour is served in the Suite 701 restaurant. It is continental breakfast, but with a good array of croissants, muffins, rolls, begels and cheese plus a really, really good coffee. The wine and cheese hour gives you the chance to enjoy a decent glass of wine and a variety of excellent Quebec cheeses while you meet other guests. I also like the 2 computers available for guests in the ground floor and last, but not least, the super-efficient and friendly front-desk crew, always ready to help you with any question or need you may have. Since everyone of the front-desk crew members were so attentive I just can't remember the names of all of them, but I remember Jose, the multilingual employee who was always ready to satisfy everyone of your needs promptly and with a big smile. Great job, Jose, thanks for everything. Overall, we were extremely happy with our stay. Le Place d'Armes deserves all the great reviews it received from other Tripadvisor members. And when I go back to Montreal, why bothering to shop around? I will just book with this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Experience”
Reviews.Author: Airbuscaptden
Reviews.Content: For that special trip with a loved one, this place can't be beat. While a little pricey, it offers a memorable experience. Located in the heart of Old Montreal, it is an easy walk to all the major tourist sites and restaurants. It is very convenient to the metro. Even with street repairs occuring during the day, the rooms were very quiet. All of the staff was very helpful. The toiletries come from the on-site spa and are very nice. We would definitely stay again if we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: Chafman
Reviews.Content: Le Place d'Armes is without any doubt the best hotel in the $150-$200 price range. Its location is ideal for business and leisure as you're in the heart of the Financial district and a walking distance to the Old Port of Montreal. The hotel is just a block away from a subway station and facing a line-up of taxis. The service is very professional and amiable. I've never had any kind of problem although I stayed there more than 15 times in the last two years. The rooms, although all different, are very spacious and have a unique cachet of old building / new material. The bed is a real king-size bed and is very comfortable. A delicious breakfast, High-speed Internet, and an afternoon cheese-and-wine are all included, making this hotel my number one choice by far. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a comfortable stay, a luxurious setting, and a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful upscale hotel in old town”
Reviews.Author: jdancerBoston
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent location in Old Town Montreal. Within walking distance of all of the historic areas, restaurants and shops. Nice continental breakfast and wine and cheese in the evening included. We were upgraded to an enormous suite--so comfortable. The service at the desk and of all personal was professional and friendly. Car parking was valet and a little expensive. Might have been able to find a less expensive lot with a little research.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Helo02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Place d'Armes a couple of times now and have been very pleased with each stay. Staff is great and polite. Room are in very good condition, with the beds and bathrooms being a highlight. Some of the electronics do need some updating (Like IPOD ready clocks and more lcd TV's), but overall a very good hotel. The food and bar are excellent on the first floor. Meet friends at the bar, and ended staying there two hours longer than planned before going out to the clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy!”
Reviews.Author: vacsrus
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on a boutique hotel Web site. We met friends also traveling in Montreal and felt a bit embarrassed by / apologetic for what a nice place we had! Our room was large, and the bathroom was huge -- the shower, with a rainfall head, was practically big enough for two, and there was a deep whirlpool tub. We had plenty of towels. (Note to maids -- shampoo bottles, soaps have fallen behind the tub ... do a better check when you clean. But over all, the hotel is tidy.) There was turndown service and chocolates each night. Bathroom and sleeping quarters are a bit dimly lit, but nicely decorated, if almost a bit too trendy/contemporary/predictable. The bar attracts a young professional crowd and was very loud during our first-night wine / cheese sampling. The sampling, in fact, was held in a lower level that evening, but the sound carried. Breakfast in the bar was fresh and convenient. If I could find another great rate, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but void the Rainspa”
Reviews.Author: houzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this lovely hotel in Feb.. The service was superb and all the staff that we accounted were very attentive. Unfortunately, bad experience happened in the Rainspa. Part of the attraction on their website was the spa service at very reasonable prices. With that kind prices, I did not expect services equals Mandarin Oriental or Aman Resorts, but neither did I expect the worst experience ever. The reception area was cramped. Other guests and I had to stand there waiting to be called. I booked a 60-minute facial and 60-minute body scrub. I was not given any robe to change, neither was covered by any towel during the treatment. It was rather bizarre and unprofessional. But these shortcomings are rather trivial comparing to cheating on the time. I was given only 40-minute facial, then was sent to the steam room. Had I not come out the steam room by myself, I think the "esthetician" would be happy that I stay there till the end of hour. For the second part of the treatment, she finished 15 minutes short. Luckily, each room, though dark, has a clock so I had sense of time. But I would imagine for most people in a treatment room, the last thing on mind is to track time. When I complained this to the receptionist, I was offered 25% discount as prorated charge. What surprised me later was the management's response on how I should feel properly compensated for the loss of the time of treatment because they offered me discount accordingly. When you are on a family vacation, you make proper arrangement to dedicated two hours on your wellness. They short changed you, giving some symbolic discount, then they think they are fair. This utter nonsense just shows you that THE RAINSPA DOES NOT understand. Sometimes, the employee's bad behavior is just the reflection of the management attitude. So my advice is, stay in the hotel, but forget about THE SPA unless you want to find out how bad it is yourself.

Reviews.Title: “love at first sight”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple425
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Place d'Armes last year and are looking forward to our second stay in a few weeks. I chose the hotel based on it's website, which I feel was refreshingly honest. The location is exceptional, across the street from the Notre Dame Basilica, shops and restaurants. The concierge was exceptional, he helped us find an amazing lounge and funky neighborhood fairs. The weather was gorgeous during our stay so we spent much of it on the hotel's rooftop terrace. My ONLY complaint is the few pesky bees that enjoyed the view (and my cosmo) as much as I did! Bottom line: We loved our room, the view, the location, the gym, the spa, the patio and the bar! FYI, leave the kids at home, they won't appreciate the glass, rainfall shower. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “We were wrong. Not family-friendly.”
Reviews.Author: donenbaked
Reviews.Content: Our first room had great expectations. Great linens, fine appointments in both lobby and room....We were wrong. It was terrible. With an 8 year old and 2 adults, you would think they would place us in an area far from the nightly rooftop lounge. Again, we were wrong. We were right next to the elevator, right next to the hallway to the lounge. Upon complaining of the ungodly hour that we still were hearing those many Happy Travellers, (and you have every right - it is your holiday!) we thought the staff would do something. We were wrong. Our first visit was horrid - 3 am and paper-thin walls. Would we ever go there again? You are right. NEVER. AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: wolfie73
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the Suites which we got using one of the major credit card upgrades. Amazing bathroom with rain shower and a large tub. Modern room, clean bathroom, great service, great beds and blankets. The only thing that it lacks it is a pool but it can be overlooked. Location is great, the old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “glamorous but slightly dated”
Reviews.Author: winston_7
Reviews.Content: Located in the beautiful 19th century waterfront area of the city ("Vieux Montreal") the Place d'Armes is a successful make-over of several old commercial buildings dating from the late nineteenth, early twentieth century. It is much frequented for office parties and business meetings, and its ground floor is well designed for the purpose. The rooms/suites are capacious, bathrooms are very well designed and beds are comfortable. Looking over the hotel, one would place it at about the height of early nineties style, cool verging on cold. But if you are going to place yourself in the height of fashion, you'd better keep up, and there signs that the hotel is becoming ever so slightly dated if not unfocused. Paint is flaking off chairs and on the occasional corner, and the staff while mostly very jolly and helpful, does not seem to be under central command.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous boutique hotel in old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: adventuringone
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in Montreal and this was one of the four recommended hotels. It definitely was the best of them all. Had a great double room, sharing with a colleague in the 2nd building, and loved the complimentary wine and cheese, wireless internet and continental breakfast in the morning. The staff were exceptionally helpful and gracious. One night after having a late nightcap in the lounge, I left my gloves on one of the banquettes. Upon returning to my room, I received a call from one of the staff in the lounge and within minutes someone was at our room with the forgotten gloves. Can't wait to return to Montreal and to Place D'Armes! The only downside was hearing loud music one night from one of the nightclubs outside. We were on the 5th floor and could still hear it. The only problem in a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and ambience”
Reviews.Author: nancyandashesh
Reviews.Content: You can't get any better location, service, breakfast, or atmosphere than this hotel. We can't wait to go back! The bed was so comfy I actually ordered their sheets (never done that before!), the rooms preserved their historic past with hardwood floors and enormous window seats--but the furnishings were simple modern chic. Huge bathroom! We felt very luxurious, but the price is reasonable for the city. Breakfast was amazing--the best croissants and bread and fruit and yogurt and cereal . . . we stuffed ourselves so much we barely wanted the wine and cheese at the evening reception (but it was free, so we went and enjoyed the surprisingly good wine!) They're located right next to a metro station, which is great for getting to the gorgeous, massive Botanical Gardens and to other places we didn't have time to see--next time! You can't hear the metro at all, and we could see the Cathedrale across the Square/Piazza/Place from us--nice view! Lovely soundproofed windows in the rooms--hotel very quiet despite the room right next door containing a family with young kids--we were surprised to see them coming back from bkfst, never heard a peep inside the room. Hubby borrowed a CD from the front desk to play in the room's cd player--nice touch. And after dinner one night, we asked the front desk person where to buy water--he told us everything was closed, but he went and brought us back several bottles of water for us to take with us the next day on a bike ride! (We used the tasty faucet water in the room to refill them). Highly recommend the bike ride along the Lachine Canal up to the Lachine Market. The farmer's markets here are amazingly stocked and if you ask the vendors what an unknown fruit or veggie is, they let you taste it! And the bread is delicious everywhere you go. Back to the hotel (sorry for the tangent): they have great lounges with free pool tables and a fire in the fireplace (yes, even in August--it was for looks only) and flat screen tvs and neat modern sofas. The spa looked nice, as did the rooftop bar--great views of the city and plenty of people watching! The breakfast room is gorgeous: ornate mouldings from the original bank building, tall tall ceilings--lovely setting. Seriously, this place is wonderful, and a 5-minute walk to train station, 10-minute scenic walk to Vieux Montreal and the waterfront. Enjoy! (Sorry no photos--had to delete from camera cuz ran out of memory while at the gardens!)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for a fabulous weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Silvermetal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading all the glowing reviews on this boutique hotel from fellow Tripadvisors. From the moment we walked in until the last moment we stepped out of the hotel the stay here was absolutely enjoyable. The hotel is in Old Montreal, less than a minute walk to Notre Dame basilica. Lots of good restaurants around and little shops and art galleries abound - all within walking distance. After checking in, we went up to our room to drop off our luggage, about 10 minutes later a bellhop dropped us off a plate of chocolate covered strawberries. We mentioned it was our anniversary - so I'm not sure if all guests get it or not. Either way it was nice touch. The room was cozy, with a electric fire place and a comfy king sized bed. The walk-in shower was nice, big enough for 2 people. We stayed for 2 nights, each night - housekeeping came to drop off some chocolates and a bottle of water. The wine and cheese was a nice as well. It was from 5 to 7 each night. You don't have to stay in the restaurant - we took ours back to our room to enjoy. The free breakfast was decent. Well stocked with bagels, croissants, danishes, fruits, and cheese. If you wanted omelets or pancakes, you can order off their menu - of course you would have to pay for that. The free breakfast was more than enough in my view. Valet service was good, sometimes our car was parked outside on the street instead of the underground lot. I didn't mind, but I'm sure people with luxury cars would prefer their car in a parking lot rather than overnight on the street. The hotel staff was excellent in providing directions to attractions in Montreal. Overall it was a splendid weekend in Montreal, coming back to the hotel every night was such a relief. The thought of coming back to a aesthetically pleasing room and comfortable bed just made the trip so much more enjoyable. Each time we stay in Montreal, we will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience 'The Good Life'”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCW
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a taste of decadence in your mundane life, I would recommend staying at least a couple nights here. First of all, it is in the heart of Old Montreal, which is a tourist's paradise; surrounded by culture and gourmet restaurants, shopping, the beautiful boardwalk along the St. Lawrence... It is literally next to the famed Notre Dame Cathedral. The rooms are fresh, immaculate and beautifully decorated. You can't help but squeal with glee and flop on the cloud-soft, white bedding when entering the room! Everything from check-in to check-out was a pleasure. Even though there is a gorgeous roof-top patio, a hot night club, spa and a delish 4* restaurant on premises, you don't hear a peep while in bed. They must have amazing soundproofing because even the usual sirens of downtown Montreal were not heard on a Saturday night! Parking is valet only. Just pull your car to the front entrance and the bellhop will arrange for your car to be parked in a secure, underground parking lot underneath the hotel. Parking is paid on a 24 hour rate, which is a good thing if you are only looking to stay one night but want to wander around for most of the next day. The parking rate is quite reasonable and totally worth it. Tips: Old Quebec is located south of the busy, commercial St. Catherine's street. If you are looking for a shop-till-you-drop kind of weekend, this may be too far away. The subway station isn't that close and it's a pretty long (but interesting) walk. Taxi is recommended. Also, if you are driving to and unfamiliar with Montreal, be sure to use a GPS. Montreal is full of one-ways and together with the traffic and french signs, it is sure to be very confusing. This hotel is highly recommended for the surprise romantic getaway! It will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Love these boutique hotels”
Reviews.Author: Rastadog
Reviews.Content: I love boutique hotels and this is one of the best. Okay, you pay a little extra (actually, a lot extra in some cases), but it's worth it. Hotel Place d'Armes is in the middle of Old Montreal, just a few blocks from the restaurant-laden Rue St. Paul and one block from the Basilica Notre Dame. Downtown Montreal, including Chinatown, is only a few blocks in the other direction. Our room was spacious with a king size bed, a sitting area and a work space. The bathrooms have a glass-enclosed shower and a separate tub. The staff is great. The maid comes by each night with candy and the next day's weather report. While we didn't eat there, the restaurant in the hotel makes most of the best restaurant lists. There's not much of a downside here. The morning continental breakfast is pretty average. I've had better at a Hampton Inn, but it is free. So is the wine and cheese thing in the late afternoon. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkpurse83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful boutique hotel this past weekend. I highly recommend it! We arrived early at the hotel and our room was ready for us, we didn't have to wait for the "official" check-in time. Once inside, our hotel room looked and felt like we were staying in a fancy decorated mini- apartment instead of a typical hotel, complete with a jet tub, a fancy desk and spa toiletries. The evening wine and cheese was wonderful, as was the continental breakfast every morning. The hotel is walking distance to Notre Dame Basilica and Old Montreal sightseeing, restaurants, boutiques, art galleries, etc. The metro is close as well. The hotel staff is wonderful and gave excellent customer service! It was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: johnski41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first time because of mostly positive comments on Tripadvisor and its close proximity to Old Montreal. Only minor problem was initially finding the hotel because a big yellow school bus was parked in the limited street space fronting the nondescript hotel entrance. We had a spacious deluxe king suite on the second floor & never heard any of the typical hotel noise even though the room was adjacent to the elevators which I might add worked just fine! Our 3 day stay included a delightful morning continental breakfast and an evening wine and cheese. Adding to the enjoyment was the opportunity to easily walk to most of the attractions in Old Montreal, Chinatown, and even many in downtown Montreal. All of the staff was helpful and friendly especially the concierge and doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, horrible elevator”
Reviews.Author: ninaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is lovely. Expect old hardwood floors, a comfy bed, big bathroom and TALL ceilings. The free breakfast is decent. The only complaint I have is the horrible elevator. I tried the stairs but they were locked (good thing there was no fire).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravel82
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at Place D'Armes on July 31, 2008 and loved it, the hotel is in a great location and the staff are awesome. We have very close friends in montreal and travel to Montreal frequently, we have stayed at many many hotels in Montreal and I this is now in our top 3. We were travelling through Montreal for our first wedding anniversary and my mom had made sure there was a bottle of chilled champagne and some chocolate covered strawberries in our room on check in and the staff made sure to wish us a happy anniversary. The room was awesome, we only had a standard room and I would recommend to everyone to spend the extra money and get a deluxe room as the standard rooms are pretty small (they are still great though) The continental breakfast was great. This place has a great feeling to it and the ambience is wonderful. I will be returning in couple of weeks for business and will definetely booking Place D'Armes for that trip

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: biztravel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights on our Montreal vacation. Our first to the city. We had a chance to look at the other hotels in Old Montreal and this is by far the best choice. If you stay in a downtown hotel you miss out on the charm and sites of Old Montreal. Downtown Montreal is just like any US city, big office buildings, cars, subway but Old Montreal is special. Location, location, location. Across the park from Notre-Dame Basilica, just down the street from the restaurants at Place Jacques Carter and a couple blocks from Chinatown and the Old Port. You are in the middle of everything and yet it is a great place. We never needed a car and if you want to explore other parts of the City, they have a complementary car service that will drop you off in downtown, Mount Royal or other locations. Complementary Wine and cheese every afternoon and continental breakfast were nice with exceptional wait staff. They have a roof top cafe for a change and a good view of the City. The rooms are nice, comfortable beds, new furniture and wireless internet service. They are small compared to US big name luxury hotels but this is a renovated historic building so you have a trade off. Service is very good and the staff quickly learned our names and greeted us each time as we came in from excursions or dinner. Thursday night their bar is The Place for locals and you would think you were at a hot club in NYC. Packed wall to wall and even waiting to get in on the sidewalk with guards at the door. It was just that one night but apparently every Thursday all the locals dress up and come to Place d'Armes. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Where Service Rules!”
Reviews.Author: JVen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four glorious nights at the Le Place D'Armes Hotel in Montreal to celebrate my birthday. The location of the hotel is superb--in Vieux Montreal across from the Basillica and within walking distance to everything in the old part of town. Our room was outstanding (room 3505). It was very large, with a fabulous bath, and extremely comfortable beds. It had a lot of charm with exposed brick but had a clean, contemporary flair. Our room included a continental breakfast every morning and a wine and cheese happy hour every afternoon. We really appreciated the free access to two computers and printers right off the lobby. I can't say enough about the friendly staff who made our stay so enjoyable. Marc and Maureen were the greatest!!! You couldn't possibly stay at a better hotel in Montreal than the Place D'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: tigbear
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five days in Montreal. The Hotel Place D'Armes has many strengths. Located in Vieux Montreal, it is close to the Basilica, the waterfront and all the sights of the old town. The hotel is attractively decorated, and our room was large and comfortable. Room service dinner was delicious. And the staff at the front desk were GREAT!! (especially Marco and Audrey). The flaws: continental breakfast buffet was OK but the service was non-existent. Most of the people working there seemed to have a very bad attitude - and it's essentially a buffet - all they really had to do was bring coffee and be pleasant. The air conditioning in the room was very noisy and got noisier as our stay progressed. Perhaps because it was very humid (rained every day!). By the last night, we were ready to leave. In all - it's a lovely hotel in a great location. Stay for a night or two, just for the experience - if you can afford it. But it's not perfect and many of the restaurant staff need to work on their attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Love This very personal hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I go to Montreal every year during this time of year. I always attend at end of June thru the first week of July. I have stayed at this hotel for the past 4 yrs and it is wonderful...I usually travel with a group of people. My group is usually people over 65yrs and also a nephew this is under 10yrs.. I like this hotel because it is small enough for the group to be comfortable and safe enough for the kid.. The rooms are very modern and clean. Most of the hotel packages include a complementary continental breakfast. and daily wine tasting w/cheese. I love the door men the front desk staff are also very helpful.. However, they need to work on the food service staff... And resently have opened the bar to an weekend evening crowd of young people who make a lot of noise at night. If you are in the third building you do not hear this noise. The spa is very good in this hotel and the staff is great. Overall, I do love this hotel, it is located just above the port about 3 blocks north of port. It is a 20 min walk to main shopping area and a few blocks from Rue Jacques Cartier...We have eating in the hotel roof grill restaurant, which has an amazing view and is very comfortable however, the confused waiter staff made this experience difficult to totally enjoy. We went the roof and night to enjoy the fireworks, which was very relaxing, but it was hard to see fireworks because a few building covered them. Try eating at the Modiave Restaurant at the old port they have live music and great lamb specials..Also this hotel has a sister hotel called Nelligan, which has a great restaurant (not cheap) but upscale food... I do recommend this hotel dispite my mixed comments.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 3hands
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on our last 3 trips to Montreal and at their sister hotel (The Nelligan) on 4 other trips. Both hotels are beautiful, both have very helpful staff, and basically we enjoy our stays - which is why we go back. Looking for a more romantic feel, stay at the Nelligan. Looking for a great all-round place - choose Place D'Armes. Beautiful large rooms. Nicely furnished. Great baths and showers (4'by6' rain shower). And as I previously stated, very nice staff. We have been both at peak tourist times such as during Jazz Fest and in the dead of winter in heavy snow storms. The service is always the same. You cant go wrong at either hotel, you just save a couple bucks at Place D'armes over The Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoshanna-rose
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in Montreal and could not have picked a better hotel to stay at. Our room was really large and the giant shower was something I had never seen before. The staff was wonderful. We received complimentary chocolate covered strawberries since we had mentioned it was our anniversary. A free cocktail hour with wine and cheese was available for two hours each evening. We had dinner one night on the roof and the meal was delicious and reasonable priced. The buffett contininental breakfast included croissants, muffins, bagels, fruit - more than we expected. The staff was helpful in getting us over to La ronde to view the fireworks. I loved the location. I had never stayed in the old city before, now I will never stay anywhere else when we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: brand_trvlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Place de Armes this past weekend in Montreal. Was there with my girlfriend and the hotel was impeccible. To echo some of the previous reviews, I travel for work and it's great to be able to find a hotel that has personality, class, and high style. And the rooms are extremely large which is wonderful (particularly coming from New York). The rooms and location can't be beat - large comfortable beds, sitting area with large windows, CD/DVD player, plushly furnished and a huge bathroom with a jacoozi tub and free-standing shower. In terms of location, we were there for Jazz Fest and could see the festival location from our window - both the festival (and the Latin Quarter), as well as Old Montreal, are very close and this hotel is perfectly located. Visited the roof-top terrace which was great for afternoon drinks, but a bit crowded later at night so we didn't stay long the second time.
