Also, the little touches such as free wi-fi, the breakfast (which isn't amazing but is certainly a nice touch to have), and the wine and cheese all add to the service to make the stay one of the better stays I've had recently. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveller17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the potential to be something very nice, but it is not there yet. Let me start by saying the location is fantastic - more on that later. We stayed 2 nights. The lobby is nice, the bellmen were very responsive and helpful as was the reception and concierge staff (mostly). The Suite 701 bar served us perhaps the best burger we've ever had (Kobe beef with guiness cheddar cheese and an onion remoulade) and was very "chic". There was a complimentary wine and cheese reception every evening from 5-7 as well. The terrace bar on the roof was very neat and hip â€“ if you are a bar-goer both the terrace and Studio 701 are for you. Our room viewed from the door looked nice, however upon closer inspection the area rug was heavily stained and just looked dirty. There were small stains on the white comforter, and the bathroom floor had strands of hair that were definitely not ours. A couple spiders in the shower, a bolt lock on the door and cordless phone that did not work all conspired to make the room less than satisfactory for the price. In addition we thought it a bit much that they charged you $1.25 for every call you made, even local and toll-free. There are no ice machines. If you want ice you call the front desk and they deliver it, in theory. It didnâ€™t cost us the tip for delivery however because they never delivered the ice. I had to go to the bar and get a bucket. There was also no mini-fridge, which are usually standard at hotels in this price range in my experience. When we mentioned a few of these things the first night they immediately sent a cleaning crew up and vacuumed everything. At check out we were ready to tell them about our stay, but the reception person never even asked us how our stay was. We did receive an email from the general manager after we returned home thanking us for our stay. When we replied to him with our issues, he took one of our nights off the bill. This was frankly unexpected and we were impressed. The staff was very responsive. The location of the hotel is excellent, lodged right between a metro stop and the old port/town area. It is across the square from the Notre Dame Basilica. The devil is in the details and it is here that this hotel falls down. If they can master the small things then this could become a very nice place. The hotel is made of 3 old office buildings (we were in the Scottish Life building), the quality of the rooms may be different on the other buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for a romantic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LoooveToTravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Place D'Armes during late April 08 for 3 nights. The location of this hotel was great...right across the street from the Notre Dame Cathedral...close walk to tons of cafes/restuarants/shops in Old Montreal. There is a McD's and a Starbucks just down the street. Relatively easy to find. The hotel is beautiful inside and out. We opted for their valet underground parking ($24/day) because we were lazy but literally 20 steps across the street is a public parking lot that charged $18.75. The only problem with the public parking was that the attendent was rarely there when we were there and the machine for credit cards was not working and we didn't want to risk a ticket. The hotel has a bar/lounge called Suite 701 which we only got the time to visit once. It was a nice professional crowd (think mostly suits and dresses), they have a rooftop terrace, and also with your stay you get a free glass of house wine & cheese nightly. It was easy to get the wine using our vouchers BUT the cheeses are located in a restaurant just down below Suite 701 along the bar and its really awkward when you go up to get some. We had some cocktails which were great and a poutine (with red wine sauce and pulled beef) that was AMAZING! The room was great. We had the basic room and it was very roomy and modern. Housekeeping was great. The only issue we had was that there could be better ventilation. The windows do not open and our "neighbours" opted to smoke pot every morning and the smell would seep into the front of our room. To each their own, I suppose. My boyfriend and I celebrated an anniversary while in Montreal and he arranged with the hotel to have roses delivered to our room one of the mornings as a surprise. However they forgot to deliver them and he had to talk to them to get them with me there. Some tips: -if you go out the main exit, turn right onto Rue St. Jacques and about in 2 blocks there is a great place called Egg-spectation that serves all day breakfast in addition to other foods; they had a great selection of food and it was delicious -also on Rue Notre Dame (parallel to St Jacques) we ate a delicious meal at La Sauvagine; they have a gorgeous gothic chandelier and excellent creme brulee; the staff however spoke little English -Gogo's Lounge on St. Laurent: wide variety of martini's and interesting shots; they do not have cover; they play a lot of wayback playbacks which are always fun; probably a 18-25 year old crowd -we walked home from St. Catherine's street one day and it took about 25 minutes...it was a nice walk and if its a pleasant day would highly recommend it -visit St. Viateur Bagel's, they are open 24/7 and have fresh delicious Montreal style bagels! Overall, we had a great time in Montreal. I will definately return and when I stay in Old Montreal I will definately stay at Hotel Place D'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic!”
Reviews.Author: twistman
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! We arrived, a valet took our car away and we didn't need it until we left 3 days later... Easy to walk from the hotel to the wonderful streets of Old Montreal. Much to do, eat and see within an easy walk. Excellent room service. Very accomodating and FAST! Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerca
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Place D'armes over the May long week-end, and I have very mixed feelings over it. The staff wasn't professional as they should have been. For instance, the spa staff rushed our mani pedis because we were the last clients of the day. The bar staff at 701 (the bar in the hotel) completely ignored us the first night we went to redeem our free drinks. The second night it was so packed, we could barely step food inside. Word to the wise, get there EARLY to redeem your drink tickets to avoid chaos. Finally, we felt we were bothering the staff at the front desk checking in and out, or maybe the staff is just incapable of smiling. While the rooms were beautiful, the service just didn't match up. I would rather have stayed at another 4 star hotel instead of this one, which I would rate a 2 out of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: betty64
Reviews.Content: What a hotel - my stay was nothing short of bliss. The rooms were lovely, the terrace on the roof spectacular - but the jewel in the crown is the staff. I lost my laptop in taxi - they found it. I had a fedex package go missing - they had it delivered, I wanted a nice Indian meal - they booked me one of the best places I have been to. Compared to the large impersonal 4 stars that I have stayed at this was a whole other level of quality. Free wi-fi, printers, drinks at 5:00 and a pretty nice breakfast. I am going back to Montreal just so I can stay here !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night when we were on a business trip to Montreal. The hotel was lovely with free wi-fi, breakfast and a wine and cheese reception. The location is perfect and the rooms gorgeous. I read a previous review which mentioned noise from the downstairs bar but I was on the 5th floor so it was very peaceful. I would definitely stay here again even though my room had only a shower and no bath (I would miss the bath if I was here sightseeing & walking miles each day) and no coffee maker in the room. But these are minor quibbles. It's a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Choose room carefully & check valet”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveling
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Montreal several times at the Nelligan, I wanted to try something new and had heard good things about the Place D'Armes. The hotel appears to have potential, and maybe i was just unlucky. I booked my room the same week of my stay, and was limited in terms of options. I was given a standard room which unfortunately was by the elevator. The standard rooms do not do the hotel justice in comparison to the pictures and write-ups on the hotel's website. I tried to change rooms - even upgrade but they could not accomodate. Later that night i unfortunately found out that you can CLEARLY hear the music from the nightclub if your room is above it on the 3rd floor (i assume there aren't rooms on the 2nd floor...it would be unbearable) - until 3am. As all travellers know, this sometimes happens and I'm simply encouraging other guests to make sure they are booked into something better than a standard room if their trip is for pleasure and they're looking to truly enjoy what is considered to be a nice hotel. Another thing to look out for is the valet parking at the hotel. At check-in I parked my car on the street at 2pm and handed the valet the keys. An hour later, the car was gone - presumably in the secure lot they advertise. At 11pm it was back on the street. I'm not sure why it (a less than 1 year old sports car) was brought back out - perhaps so someone else's (more important car?) could be put in? Regardless, I don't consider leaving my car on the street rather than in the advertised 'secure lot' as being valet parked. Unfortunately the car was also over 2 feet from the curb, on a corner, with the sideview mirrors sticking out - an accident waiting to happen on a busy city street. I let the front desk know about these issues when i checked out - they were apologetic, but not helpful. As I drove away, i had the luxury of watching the valet back another guest's car into the one behind it. He got out and walked immediately back to the hotel...not checking either for damage. Valet parking is something to be careful of wherever you use it....and apparently at this hotel especially.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveller123486
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lots of charm. Excellent, very friendly staff. Great complimentary breakfast as well as a complimentary wine and cheese every evening. Perfect romantic spot for couples. Spa was excellent as well. Very central location so lots to do and see in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat for Couples”
Reviews.Author: PaulinaB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to celebrate an anniversary with my fiance and we had a fantastic weekend. The previous reviews made me nervous but when we arrived everything was perfect. The staff -- Very courteous, helpful and pleasant. No obnoxious attitudes. The room -- Very spacious, well equipped (the cables needed to be hooked up to the TV to play DVDs), bed was superbly comfortable. The washroom -- Despite reviews that they are "too dark" - I found it just right, I don't expect there to be a 'kitchen-like' flood light in a washroom; the jacuzzi was great (it turns on by itself after you are done to clean itself, we thought something was wrong but everything was OK). Rain shower was great. Hotel samples were a nice touch and of good quality. The hotel itself was clean, tastefully decorated. We played a game of pool but that's about all we did in the general area. Breakfast at Suite 701 was just what you need- good MTL bagels, breads, yoghurts, cheeses, some cereals, great OJ/grapefruit juice. All fresh and delicious. We parked just down the street for $14 a day, valet was $24 but you can save $10 by walking 200m further. We both booked 60min Swedish massages at Rainspa. Again service was very good, no waiting around, full hour service. Genevieve was excellent - the atmosphere was so relaxing, my masseuse so effective that I fell asleep. I recommend getting a treatment and you can also use the Hammam (steam room). It was a nice place to relax after the massage but it's not as hot as steam rooms in bathhouses (e.g. Budapest). I would definitely recommend this hotel and come back for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great time there”
Reviews.Author: ginigma
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze and there was no wait, although we were the only ones checking in at the time, around 3:15PM on a Thursday. Parking is $25 (all dollar amounts will be in CAD throughout this review) per day for valet parking, but thereâ€™s a lot across the street for about $18. Since it was snowing when we arrived, valet it was! A bellman brought the luggage in and then up to our room once we checked in. Nothing special. The room was on the fourth floor of the middle building. It was a decent size room, with a king size bed, a leather chair, a small round table with 2 chairs, dresser containing the TV, DVD player, electric fireplace (nice ambience), minibar and some drawers. There was a table and chair with a phone, desk lamp (LED) and Ethernet jack for laptop use. I can see what others have said about the dim lighting, but I thought it was Ok. It provided nice atmosphere. The bathroom was nicely appointed with enough towels, soap, shampoo, etc. There was a sink, glass enclosed shower with a rain head in the center, which was pretty clogged so it wasnâ€™t that great, and a toilet. Overall a nice sized bathroom. The complementary wine & cheese every night was a little above Ok. You got one glass of wine and they had a few cheeseâ€™s setup. It wasnâ€™t all that special, but Ok. We had a late dinner in the lounge one night and I thought it was good. I had a burger. The complementary breakfast each morning was Ok also. A typical â€œcoldâ€� breakfast that most lower end hotel chains would serve. Thereâ€™s an ATM off one of the lobbies. There are two lobbies and one of them has a pool table and TV. They were quiet and relaxing. Checkout was a breeze and had no issues. The car was brought around by the time I was finished at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: BIGtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a two night mini-getaway. The first night we were woken up in the middle of the night by what we thought was "outside" noises. By 5:30 am, the noise had stopped and we tried to get back to sleep which was impossible. The second night we were woken up again by this loud "moving furniture" noise at 2:30-3 am! This continued on for over an hour and we couln't get back to sleep! In the morning when we went ot the "lounge" for our breakfast, we realised that this noise was actually comming from the lounge IN the hotel! The lounge is a bar at night and when the bar closes, staff would move the furniture for the morning breakfast !! Upon checking out, we expressed this to the staff who was helping us to which they denied we could hear this from our room and gladly took our credit card to debit our "sleepless" room for over 200$/night. They did not appologize or offer any appologetic gestures on behalf of the hotel. We go to Montreal every month or so for a weekend getaway. This was by far the worst two night's sleep we have ever gotten. There are many other beautiful hotels in the area or nearby that will be quiet and provide the four to five star service that they deserve (try hotel Gault or even the Hyatt, both have exceptional service and rooms!). As for this hotel, you could probably stay at a youth hostel and get more sleep than Place D'Armes.. I would save my money for a hotel who will properly give the night's rest to their clients!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday”
Reviews.Author: sitdowns
Reviews.Content: My husband, my son, and I went to Montreal to celebrate my birthday. We chose Le Place d'Armes after reading the reviews online. WOW! It was a wonderful experience from the moment that we arrived. Everything was perfect and first-class from the very friendly and helpful staff to the extremely clean, elegant, and comfortable room. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed in which I have ever slept. We felt like royalty. To top it off, the hotel is in a great location in Old Montreal within walking distance to shops, plenty of history, wonderful places to dine, and the Metro. I highly recommend this hotel. We are looking forward to our next visit to Montreal, which will surely include a stay at Le Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Place d'Armes - a find in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: scottam
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in a great location in Old Montreal. Hotel combines the charm of an old building with updated decor. Rooms have more of a homey-feel than hotel feel with wood floors and area rugs contemporary light fixtures and a shelving in the bathroom. Great location across from Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MFabulous
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed a nice long weekend at the Hotel Place D'Armes. We've stayed in just about every hotel in Montreal and decided to try this one, as we had never been there. The hotel is very well appointed, stylish and in the best location in Old Montreal. The staff goes out of its way to assist you and the experience is typical of an upscale boutique hotel. The breakfast in the morning is basic but very nice. After having some minor problems with our room, the staff apologized profusely and upgraded us to a better room. They obviously believe in the theory that its not what happens, but how you handle it. The only negative about the hotel is that the rooms are a bit dark and need more lighting. We were in a suite with a work station which was stuck in a dark corridor with no lighting. How someone would be able to do any work in a corridor with no lights is beyond me. Putting that aside, the hotel is terrific and definitely one of the best in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal -Le Place d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: ChazDP
Reviews.Content: Hotel Place D'Armes 55 St-JacquesMontreal, Quebec H2Y 3X2 I have stayed in Montreal a number of times....this was my first stay here. All I can saw, the Ritz, Four Seasons whatever...has nothing on this place. Hotel owners-managers all over need to see what a well run hotel feels like. From check in to the doorman...all polite, helpful and provided excellent service....this is my Montreal stay from this point on. The rooms were spotless, very very roomie, excellent baths-jacuzzi tub, roomie shower....just great. There is a lounge to have a drink or one to just relax and shoot pool. Great stay great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kelpartho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in October. We had room 1506 which had 2 double beds. The staff was very nice at check-in and throughout our stay. The bedroom was a little cramped because there was 2 of us and the bathroom could have used a little touch up paint (there was a section near the bathtub that was black and peeling off). We dined at the hotel restaurant and it was very good and we both enjoyed our massage at RainSpa. Notre Dame is across the street and the Convention Center (Palais de Congres) is a block away. The hotel breakfast was good, too. They had various breads, cereals, fruit and cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HaveFoodwillTravel
Reviews.Content: Me: a food journalist who travels frequently and eats-out too often. Overall: Spent four evenings in a Deluxe Suite, June 2007. Would definitely stay again. Staff: friendly, courteous, and helpful. The concierge (a golden key member) was exemplary in helping point out fantastic restaurants in the city, as well as providing an itinerary for a trip to the countryside. Very helpful! Rooms: Nicely appointed in a typical, modern boutique-hotel fashion. Beds and bedding were very comfortable. Lighting was a bit on the dark side, but adequate. Bathroom was large with 2-person jacuzzi and rain shower. Though acceptable for my use, many might find the lack of counter-space inadequate. Foodservice: Complimentary breakfast, Served in the bar area, was acceptable though I generally expect more from a hotel of this caliber. In this case, why offer something if it doesn't appear to adequately reflect your branding? Certainly does not reflect the "Deluxe Continental Breakfast" that they tout. Consisted of boxed cereals, mass-produced generic baked goods, fruits, assortment of juices(e.g., orange juice from a carton), coffee, and tea. Evening wine and cheese was a nice complement to the day. House wines were good. Provided for a chance to mingle with other guests. Restaurant, Aix Cuisine du Terroir, was good but not exceptional. Dined there once. Staff was helpful and attentive even though the dining room was quite busy. Food was properly prepared, but lacked the creativity and enhanced flavors that could set it apart from other restaurants in its class in this city. Views and atmosphere of the rooftop Aix la Terrasse are unparalleled! Pros: -excellent location! Bank/ATM located on the Place D'Armes. Metro station, providing quick access to all parts of the city, just over a block away. Vieux Port is only a short walk away. -Good accomodations with a amiable, and able, staff. Definitely use the concierge during your stay! -Jacuzzi tub a welcome respite at the end of the day -Nicely appointed rooms with comfy beds Cons: -Complimentary breakfast not on par with hotel's image -Provided wrong room on check-in. Problem rectified but should not have happened. -Rooms might be too dark for some people -Lack of counter-space in bathroom might find some scrambling for space.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: calidragon
Reviews.Content: I have already written one review on this hotel. I tried staying again in September and the results were the same. This hotel is as good as it gets. The rooms, location, ambience are all great but what really sets this hotel apart from its competition is the superb staff. All questions, requests, etc. were met with a smile and without exception handled to our satisfaction. The front desk personnel are among the best I have encountered. I travel often. I travel worldwide. I travel without a budget. I have yet to stay at a hotel which exceeds the enthusiasm of the staff at the Place D'Armes. Cali

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overhyped”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: Came here for a few days with the wife and baby. Superb location - you cant really get much better in the old quarter (saying this the old quarter is very small) The Hotel is almost opposite the Notra Dame Bassilica We stayed in a suite that was over 2 floors - it almost made the upstairs floor redundant and the room felt much smaller than I was expecting as I hadnt read that it would be over 2 floors Beds of reasonable comfort Free wine (1 glass only) and cheese between 5pm and 7pm which was a nice sort of touch but on 1 evening the place was packed Breakfast and food in the hotel I would describe as average - certainly no better The main thing that I didnt like was being charged an excessive amount for a Crib for the baby, which I didnt know I was being charged until I checked out and it came to about $120 which whilst its not much it really pissed us off. We stayed in 4 hotels on our stay in Canada and this was the only hotel that charged us for this - they should have mentioned at the start of our stay - this knocks it from 3-4 stars to 2 stars Hotel staff are friendly Montreal itself is nothing to rave about. It can easily be covered in a day. Old quarter, lake area and park, view over the city - not really anything. My wife and I were quite bored after the 1st day The highlight of our stay was eating in a superb restaurant - Bonapartes - excellent French cuisine - go for the sampler menu (which is more a many course meal) and Terriers wine (great). Its in the old town area a few minutes walk from this hotel If you are thinking of going to Canada for the 1st time - head for Vancouver............. and ignore places like Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: flguga
Reviews.Content: PROS Like many here, I liked the Hotel overall, the staff is very accomodating and helpful, lovely people, nice decor. I think the hotel is pefect for young gay couples who want to get married in Montreal. Me and my wife took your baby with us, and I felt like weI were from Mars. if you have a big party or kids, do a favor, find a hotel suite with proper family amenities and atmosphere. the happy hour in the lobby is cool, good looking staff (especially the waitress( very friendly and hot). CONS After 3 nights I just got little depressed with the darkness of the room. it was Ok at the first glance but you feel like you just wanna get out and have some light out! the breakfast is very poor. I did not get it how such a nice place offer only 3 bread options, 2 kind of muffins (COSCO quality), 3 types of tee. Any chain 3 star hotel offer a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay, from the enormous bathroom to the incredible wonderful concierges. We upgraded to a suite for very little more than the cost of a deluxe room and it was so worth it. We had a beautiful balcony where I would have coffee and read every morning and a bathroom the size of many hotel rooms with an enormous rain shower and huge soaking tub. It was utterly fantastic. A typical french breakfast was included and I must say the croissants were quite delicious. Comfy beds and a lovely couch. A fireplace I would love to try in the winter. Would highly highly recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service. Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler500
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and can't say enough great things about it for the price we paid (around $200 US / night before taxes). My wife and I have traveled extensively and we both felt that the service here was some of the best we have come across. The hotel decor is modern/sleek (although I would note that the rooms look like they are filled with furniture from a West Elm catalogue as opposed to expensive furniture). The rooms are very good size and have a fantastic bathroom with both a jacuzzi tub and separate glass shower (note - it is my understanding that the rooms in the different "towers" may vary in size). The hotel is located near the waterfront and the old town (this area is a little touristy but we felt it was a great location to be in). The hotel also houses a very nice spa. My only complaint about the hotel is that the views from the rooms are limited. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel for anyone traveling to Montreal (except those looking for an old classic hotel feel).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, very upscale and great perks!”
Reviews.Author: montreallover
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms with gorgeous tiled bathrooms. Capable staff and friendly. Good location and attention given to fine details. Meticulous operation. Reciprocity for continental buffet breakfast and cocktails with their sister establishments: The Nelligan Hotel and Auberg du Vieux Port. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon in Old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: zekimus
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Took my new bride for the first three nights of our honeymoon. We were top floor of the Alexander building with a balcony and huge room. I esp loved the TV over the bathtub. The lounge downstairs was top notch with free breakfast and a wine and cheese party every night. The terrace restaraunt had a fab view, and overall the place was very romantic for us. Fantastic service and the best hotel we stayed at on our trip. Great location on Old Montreal but close walking to rest of city too. Thanks crew! PS. There was a deal on the Montreal tourism website for 3rd night at half price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elfy
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the decor is contemporary, yet not sterile. Exposed brick, soft leather chairs, interesting art and objects on the walls. Our room was huge (deluxe suite catagory) with pleanty of room for a family of four. The down comforters are great and the bathroom, with it's huge shower was great, too. We enjoyed a drink on the rooftop lounge, overlooking the city. Breakfast was very good and again the service and staff were really great. I have been to Montreal several times and can't imagine staying anywhere else. Great location, rooms, food and service. Highly, totally recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: fourdarlings1997
Reviews.Content: Place D'Armes is a beautiful hotel in Old Montreal. We spent three nights there and the location is superb. The staff at the front desk and helping with the complimentary breakfast were very friendly and helpful. We were not able to take advantage of the free wine and cheese as the first evening was just too crowded in the bar and you had to wait to get onto the terrace and the following nights we were out. The room (king bed, rain shower-no tub) was spacious and clean. The chocolates were a nice treat and we received chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary and sparkling water. The only downfall is that the aircondioning unit was quite loud and placed so it blasted cold air right on the bed-so you were sleeping in a draft. Also the blinds didn't quite close all the way and light filtered in. Overall I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, awesome continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hmm73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous, with spacious beautifully appointed rooms, comortable beds with duvet covers, and a bathroom I wish I could have at home. The staff was courteous and efficient, and the hotel boasts a lively night lounge which has a rooftop terrace. We had massages at Rainspa, the spa located in the hotel, which were great. Overall an amazing experience and we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and hot”
Reviews.Author: ajmmd
Reviews.Content: We chose Le Place d'Armes in Old Montreal for its closeness to the Comedy Festival venues during our yearly trip to Montreal. We found the hotel to be a perfect location for easy access to the old city and quite a good choice for our daily walks around town. The hotel as mentioned in the reviews is actually 3 converted building with their own charm and functionality. The roof top Terrace was an outstanding place for lunch or just a beer/cocktail. We found the service helpful and always bilingual. The complementary wine and cheese was very appealing and we had NO problems lingering at the tables and chairs scattered around. The room was always clean and fresh and it appeared that the bar was the "hottest" one in the area for people watching in a city that really never sleeps! We will come back to this hotel in the future or try its "sister" Hotel Nelligan.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Old Montreal with all the Mod-Cons you could want”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLife
Reviews.Content: The Place d'Armes is a perfectly located hotel in Old Montreal that's the ideal hybrid for the business and leisure traveler. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are worth dedicating an evening to pamper yourself. Service is good, staff is friendly, and the restaurant is creative, clever, and never fails to please.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Falls Short of Great”
Reviews.Author: OCKevin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Place d'Armes for three nights in June, 2007. The hotel, which has a very nice Old Montreal location one block from the Metro stop, has a website which boasts of its commitment to luxury and finesse in every aspect of the stay. Pretty big words to live by. My own feeling after staying there is that, while it's a good hotel, it doesn't rise to the level of the top-tier hotels in Montreal and probably doesn't deserve some of the hype being given to it. Let's start where first impressions usually stick, with the Front Desk. I can best describe the staff as "Youth Brigade," young, not particularly well-trained, surprisingly not at ease speaking English, and always looking a bit overwhelmed behind the desk. At check-in, one young lady, apparently very preoccupied processing a dry-cleaning order, rather than saying hello, simply turned to the concierge for help in checking us into the room. The concierge, and older, slightly more jaded gentleman, obliged - this obviously wasn't the first time he had to swoop in to help the desk staff out. Our room was a Superior King room. I must say, the bed (pictured) was immensely comfortable, with plenty of pillows to make it seem like I was sleeping on a cloud. This more or less made up for less-than-excellent housekeeping. Our room had no less than four burned-out light bulps (two in the bathroom, one at the armoir and one at the bed's headboard). When we called housekeeping about it, we were surprised to find when we returned back from dinner to find they had only fixed one light (in the bathroom). Nightly turn-down service is a great touch for any hotel to offer. Here, it's fine - not great. One bottle of water (for two guests) and two pieces of Lindt chocolate. I would have hoped that the maid had noticed the electrical issues with the room and did something about it, but no such luck. The bathroom can best be described as large and cavernous, with dark tiles and dark marble floors. As big as the bathroom was, it was not particularly functional, with the counterspace at the sink barely adequate for even one guest to place toiletries. My wife and I just figured that the hotel may cater more to single, or business travelers than to families or couples, given the layout of the bathroom. Our "Refresh" package also included continental breakfast and a wine and cheese reception each day in the main-floor bar. Like the front desk, expect service from a youthful, not thoroughly trained staff. And woe to anyone who arrives for these services with only a few minutes left before they conclude! For breakfast, we arrived 10 minutes prior to them stopping service, only to find that the servers were aggressively beginning the cleaning-up process. Plates were removed hastily off our table before we were completely done. A server immediately grabbed a basket of bread away from the bar as I was approaching it to get another bagle. What's the rush? Lunch was still 2 hours away. The hotel does live up to its lofty self-proclaimed standards in two areas, though. The first is the excellent restaurant Aix Cuisine du Terroir located in the hotel's sub-level. This is a serious restaurant, which merits the critical praises it's been receiving, with superbly rendered main courses and desserts. Try the house-smoked salmon, sesame grilled tuna or rack of lamb. For dessert, be prepared to be wowed by delectable maple syrup pie and ice cream. Service was consistently attentive and cordial. The second was the small, but well-appointed Rainspa, complete with an impressive Turkish-style steam room that you can't miss as a spa guest. I had a 90-minute Swedish massage by Lize, a very knowledgeable and conscientious physical therapist. So overall, we had a good but not great, experience at this hotel. If a hotel is going to pose itself as "luxury," it should offer more than what this hotel does.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: pablosek
Reviews.Content: After a six hour drive, we finally pulled up late at night to this grand entrance, that's beautifully lit (it felt like we were in a movie). The Valet takes our car, and the bell boy takes our bags. All within 45 seconds. We walk up to the front desk, where a lady asks for our name. Immediatelly we are congratulated on our anniversary and referred to by name. Our paper work (which has been awaiting our arrival) is briskly handed over, inluding the key cards and coupons for the complimentary wine/cheese (which we didn't even get to enjoy). We arrive in a very large deluxe room, dimly lit, classical music playing in the back ground. Chocolate covered strawberries waiting on the side table, Lindt chocolates on the bed. Double soaker tub with jets in the middle of this beautifully chic bathroom. Add wine, strawberries, and a beautiful woman, and this was the most perfect evening on our little escape. Breakfast was delicious, ample, and in bautiful surroundings. The hotel has quite a bit of classical architecture present (like the outside, and partially inside), but it is beautifully blended with modern design. Very chic- perfect for Montreal. We only stayed one night and progressed to Old Quebec the following day (Fairmont Chateau Frontenac) and Charlevoix the day after (Fairmont - Le Manoir Richelieu). Needless to say Place D'armes set the stage for a wonderful weekend. To be honest, I think it set the bar for us in terms of overall feel and accomodation we expect in a hotel. My expectations have been exceeded. We will be back one of these years to stay there for the Grand Prix.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Stay, some ups, some downs”
Reviews.Author: kristinayee
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two brothers and I just got back from a wonderful Memorial Day weekend trip to Montreal. We had a great time - the Hotel Place D'Armes, overall, was GREAT. There were a few MINOR details that the hotel could have fixed. Here is our review: PRICE - We paid $195 canadian dollars per night excluding taxes. HOTEL - The hotel is 3 buildings that are combined. We stayed in building 2. I'm not sure which are the newer areas and which are the older, but our building was very nice. The other buildings are connected to the main reception area - you walk through sitting areas to access the different elevator banks to each building. There are a lot of common/seating areas that are very nice! LOCATION - The location really could not have been better. The hotel is a short walk to the hustle and bustle of Old Montreal and all the shops and restaurants. The port is just beyond Old Montreal, really close, where you could find Cirque Du Soleil, the Labyrinthe, the Science Centre and more. Notre Dame Basilica is just around the corner and Chinatown is 2 blocks away. As for Downtown, it's definitely walkable at about a mile away (to the Underground City), but if you don't want to walk, the closest metro is only 2 blocks away (Place D'Armes stop) and a short ride into Downtown. ROOM - We had four people and stayed in a Superior Room with two double beds. The room was very large, none of us felt cramped while we were there. You walk in and there is a large closet with an iron, ironing board, 2 bathrobes, hangers, drycleaning bags, umbrella and safe on the left. Immediately on the rigt is the large bathroom. The two double beds had down comforters and were very comfortable. There was a large entertainment center with a 27" television, DVD/VCR combo, minibar, wine glasses and mini-fridge. BATHROOM - The bathroom was prerty large. There was a large console with a flat sink and toiletries, enough counter space to put your toiletries, as well as a shelf underneath with towels and a hair dryer. The toiletries were very nice. It was a plus that they offered conditioner (many hotels only offer shampoo), for those of us with long hair. The shower was huge! It was large enough for 4 people and had a rain shower and a regular nozzle. Not ideal if you want to take a bath, but all of our group only took showers anyway. ENTERTAINMENT CENTER - The entertainment center was very nice. There was a TV and a DVD/VCR player. I thought the latter was great if you wanted to watch a late night video or something. We didn't bring any DVDs with us though because most hotels never offer this, and weren't able to take advantage of that. There were also surround sound speakers installed around the room, that I bet would be great if you were watching a movie! DECOR - The decor was very modern with leather headboards and dark furniture. Very sheek. There was also a fake fireplace that you could turn on. That was a nice touch. LIGHT - A bunch of people complained about the lights in the room not being sufficient. We didn't find that to be the case. There are a bunch of table lamps, a couple of floor lamps, some wall lamps and plenty of overhead ceiling lights. There were also two very bright reading lights by the bed. The lighting in the bathroom is another story - it is very dim and not great for makeup, etc. The hotel could stand to make the bathroom lighting a little better. BREAKFAST - The hotel offered free continental breakfast until 10:30 on weekdays and until 11:00 on weekends. Some of the reviews didn't think it was that great, but we thought it was perfect. It included, toast, bagels, various jams, fresh fruit, croissants, muffins, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, muesli, cereal, coffee, tea and juice. By the time the four of us were done, we were stuffed! BREAKFAST CAUTION - On our first day eating breakfast, we were presented menus by the waitstaff which had larger breakfasts than the continental breakfast on the counter, french toast, omelettes, etc. We didn't think this was included, but the menu said at the top (basically), "Free breakfast is provided to our hotel guests, but for those who are joining us from outside hotel, here are the prices." So we proceeded to order lavish breakfasts (all four of us!), only to get a bill at the end for $50!!!! Ultimately it was our fault for not double checking, but the waitstaff should make it clear that ONLY the continental breakfast is actually included since the menu seems to contradict this. WINE AND CHEESE - As a very nice extra touch, the hotel gave us coupons for a free glass of wine and cheese for everyone in our party for every night that we were staying there. You could take advantage between 5-7pm. If you aren't around during that time, you can still get the free wine in the lounge, just not the cheese. SERVICE - Service was hit or miss. Everyone at the hotel was polite, but not necessarily nice or excited to be there. We did actually have a couple of issues with service. 1. The first night we took advantage of the free wine/cheese in the lounge, we asked if we could substitute something else for the wine. We were told that we could get a small glass of beer. Two members of our party, who don't drink wine, got the beer. The second night, we tried to do this again and were abruptly told that substitutions were not allowed. I told them they had let us the night before, but the waitress didn't seem to care and wouldn't allow it. 2. The second night we went to get wine and cheese in the lounge (it's help yourself), the bartender literally grabbed the plate our of my husband's hand and said, "are you guests of this hotel?" We said, yes, of course and the bartender said, "Well I need your tickets." My husband said, my wife has them, i'll bring them right back, but the bartender wouldn't let him get any food until we produced the tickets! 3. We were only given the supposed daily newspaper outside our door one night while we were there. 4. Upon checkout (we never received the bill under our door, as promised for "express checkout"), we were charged for a bottle of champagne from the mini-bar that we never drank. It was promptly taken off, but I wonder how many people this happens to that don't notice. Some of the past reviewers said this happened to them too - just beware. 5. On our last day, the phone rang for one ring at 7am, waking us up. Thinking it was just a fluke, we went back to bed, only to have the phone ring again once every hour for the next 3 hours! Since it was our last day and we were up already, there was nothing really to be done, but explain it to the receptionist upon checking out. He didn't really seem to care though. 6. When we presented the valet with our ticket for our car, it took them 25 minutes to bring the car back. Kind of annoying since we really wanted to get on the road to head back home. TURNDOWN SERVICE - Every night we would come back to the room and the lights would be dim, music would be playing and chocolates, a bottle of water and the next day's weather forecast would be set beside our bed. A very nice touch! The only problem was that the maid clearly didn't check to see how many people were staying in the room, because s/he only left two chocolates and one bottle of water for four people. We're not complaining about getting free stuff, believe me, just pointing it out! INTERNET - There are two free computers with high-speed internet access in the lobby. If you bring your laptop, though, you can access the high-speed internet in your room, either by cable or wireless. The cable is free, but for the wireless, there is a daily charge. We just used the cable since it reached the bed anyway. PARKING - We paid $21 per day to valet park our car. The website doesn't mention this, but we found out ahead of time since we didn't assume anything was free. A few of the reviewers before me were surprised and annoyed by the charge, but parking in a large city is never free. SUMMARY - I would definitely stay at this hotel again, the rooms were great, the amenities perfect, the breakfast and wine and cheese definite plusses. The only thing that slightly annoyed me was the service and the lack of attention to detail. None of that really impacted our stay though, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great character, great location”
Reviews.Author: go_leir
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a conference, and stayed at the Place d'Armes. The hotel had great style and character. The hotel is located in a limestone building between Old Montreal/cathedral and the convention center (1 block). My room (a single but with plenty of space) has exposed brick walls on 2 sides, black wood floors with rug, very comfortable bed, elegant furniture, immaculately clean black-and white-bathroom. The desk (manager?) was extremely welcoming, friendly, helpful - offered to reserve a taxi for later as I was checking out and recommended timing, smiles, greetings, opened doors on arrival ... genuinely helpful. Breakfast was included and good quality. Bar was architecturally pleasing, cute but not super friendly waitstaff. I ate in the hotel restaurant one night - food was pretty good, on the pricy side. Public spaces were elegant with the smell of lilies. Nice touches - on arriving in the room at night, classical music was playing, dim light was on, and a free bottle of water and 2 chocolates was waiting. Perfect! Downsides - not many - the lighting was poor in the bathroom for makeup. Dual phone/internet jack was confusing. Window didn't open.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: zplasty
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in this hotel on their romantic getaway package. Beautiful hotel (even by South Beach standards), Extremely hip and chic. Staff and concierge were extremely helpful and polite. Room service was excellent. Highly recommend the hotel resurant Aix - I still think about the pan seared fois gras with maple syrup. Very close to the old city and metro. Our room was huge and very confortable. Bathroom was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: cpg126
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is the most wonderful place to stay in Old Montreal. My husband and I debated over staying here or somewhere else downtown but after a great anniversary weekend, we did not regret our decision. I loved staying in Old Montreal rather than the busy downtown area. The hotel had beautiful appointed rooms; exactly like in their pictures. The shower was amazing and the beds were very comfortable. They also had a great continental breakfast included. I especially loved the chocolate croissants. The wine and cheese in the evening also added a personal touch. The staff was friendly and granted our every request. When we visit Montreal again, we will definitely stay at Place D'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRoberto
Reviews.Content: What a great sophisticated hotel in the heart of old Montreal. I've been there three times now, winter and spring and thoroghly enjoyed the ambience, location and feel of the area and the hotel. Wine bar at 5 was a great perk as was the terrific breakfast. My colleagues stayed at a more traditional chain hotel and guess where they went for evening entertainment and meals? Exactly, the Place D'arms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice introduction to Montreal and wonderful ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: Saipu
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival I was greeted very kindly in French. I felt at home, the moment I stepped thought the door. It was cold, but I didn't notice because my room was cozy and comfortable. I made appointments at their spa, Rainspa. Their spa is a wonderful experience. Must I say, please do experience the "Hammam", which is Montreal's only Middle Eastern steam bath. It was a treat and extremely relaxing. Also, when you awake, please have brunch at Eggspectation, which is in very close proximity to the hotel. Try the Belgian waffle with authentic Canadian maple syrup. When you're day winds down and you want a healthy selection of quality cocktails and some good fisn n' chips, go downstairs and dine at Suite 701.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: GreatChoice
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. Right in the heart of Old Montreal. Location, 30 minute walk to almost any where. The room, wow, we had the KIng size bed in a very large room, the extra space with the couch and extra chairs are really worth it. Reception and overall hotel great. Food at AIX, it's a wow......very good, great wine list, service top notch. Night Club, a real hot spot, packed on Saturday night. Overall the only place for us to stay in Montreal. It might cost a bit more than the other "Chain" hotels but the over package is well worth the cost. We will be back...........

Reviews.Title: “Be very very smart”
Reviews.Author: junnah
Reviews.Content: Summary statement: I'm conflicted because despite several avoidable problems, we had a good time in the city of Montreal. One major taboo was crossed by the hotel staff and I would be extremely reluctant to stay here again. We booked via a package on LuxuryLink. I called in advance to setup spa and dinner reservations with the concierge. On arrival there was no record of any arrangements, so we did them over. We did not end up with the same times but part of traveling is to be reasonably flexible and we made it work. Montreal in August is a beautiful city. We had a great time seeing the city. Highly recommended. The food in the hotel was good, especially our meal at Aix. It's a delight to have a drink on the rooftop; one need not be a guest to do so. Staff was generally friendly but there was a wide range of experience. The checkout was a small disaster with billing errors due to not looking up the package contents that I had already purchased: the rebate on the tax should have been applied to the whole package, not just the charges from our stay. Be wise about the tax policy; the mechanism offered at the front desk does not come close to giving you the best return. The grand taboo? Twofold really. We were resting comfortably in our room late one afternoon, after the room had been cleaned, and the door was abruptly opened by someone from the outside. No knock. Weird. As soon as I called out, "who's there?" the door closed. Had to be staff since a keycard was used. The second part? My video iPod was stolen out of my carry bag. Apparently the twenty dollar tip we left for housekeeping the first night of our four night stay was not enough, or represented that we had money to spare. The response by the management was lukewarm at best. I realize that I am a guest and that I could take more significant precautions such as using a safe. That's on me. The violation of my personal space and property is on the hotel staff. Not cool. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SputnikToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 2nd wedding anniversary and we enjoyed our stay immensely! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, impeccably maintained, and decorated beautifully. The staff are polite and accomodating- we had a small issue with our fireplace but it was resolved quite quickly. We had dinner on our anniversary night at the Aix and it was an overall amazing experience. The food was incredible, and the service was truly top notch. We told our waiter that it was our anniversary and he gave us 2 glasses of apple cider (alcohol) on the house. It is apparently a Quebec specialty and it was delicious! The room we had was a balcony suite, with king size bed, fireplace, and a patio. We weren't able to make use of the patio since it was cold and rainy, but the view was nice. The bathroom was by far the best part of the room. The shower was huge, and the whirlpool tub was heavenly. The bed was so very comfortable- I didn't want to get up! We also had a massage and used the steam room. Again the service at the spa was fantastic, very attentive and pleasant. All in all it was a great experience. I would definitely come back, as long as I can get the same room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GreenMountaineer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wife's birthday, and she loved the place. The location is great for walking to Old Montreal, and even up to St. Catherine Street. We had dinner in the bar (Suite 701) the night of our arrival. They have a limited menu there, but reasonably priced and very good. They also make a great martini! We booked the King Deluxe room. It was beatiful -- exposed brick, and a 20+ ft ceiling. Based upon other reviews, I requested a quiet room, away from the bar. And, it was very quiet. The service was exceptional all the way around. Valets were prompt and friendly. Front desk was prompt and polite, They even brought us a complimentary box of truffles for my wife's birthday. The product in the bathroom was awesome, and that's not something that I usually care much about. I can't think of anything negative to say about the place. We will stay again. Next time we will upgrade to the King Suite so we can get the big soaker tub!

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mac261
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Place D'armes. We were upgraded to the penthouse, so what's not to like! The room was obviously grand and beautifully maintained. I peeked into several of the other rooms and they were all very nice. We would have been perfectly happy in any of one of them. The staff were all very accomidating and helpful. We very much enjoyed the wine and cheese in the evening and the breakfast was lavish. We had dinner one night in Aix which was actually the best meal of our stay. That's saying a lot with so much good food in Montreal. Both my husband and I had a massage. They were great. We really enjoyed the steam room afterwards also. We don't care much for cold weather so we won't be there in the winter, but can't wait to come back in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dustin C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Place Dâ€™Armes for one night during a recent visit to Montreal. We booked a deluxe room with a double whirlpool bath, and we were not disappointed. The room was very spacious and the 15-foot ceilings made it seem even bigger. Our room was on the corner of the building and had four very large windows; so the room was very bright, when we wanted it to be. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We missed the complimentary wine and cheese that takes place between 5 p.m. and 7 p.m., but we still received a free glass of wine when we popped into the bar at 8:30 p.m. Our room rate also included a complimentary cold-buffet breakfast, which was really good. I highly recommend trying AIX, which is the restaurant inside the hotel. I do have one gripe from our stay. Our room was located on the second floor of the hotel directly on top of the bar, which operates as a nightclub in the late hours. We could easily feel the bass originating from the bar. We were both very tired, so we had no trouble falling asleep, but if you are a light sleeper, you may want to request a room on the third floor or higher. Other than this, our room was super quiet. All and all we had a great stay and would definitely stay at Place Dâ€™Armes next time we visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: wewalktogether
Reviews.Content: staff was courteous, accomodating, pleasant. room was spacious, bath was complete with both rain shower and jacuzzi. across from the Basilica, near to Metro, Old Town, the Port..........couldn't ask for more. turn down service every night with the next day forecast by our bed, it was a terrific choice of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good style and value”
Reviews.Author: Dickh
Reviews.Content: Excellent room. Lovely lobby and public areas. Bar is a zoo some nights, loud and mobbed. Cancelled restaurant reservation downstairs because of bar noise above. Rooms are spacious, junior suite, and well priced. Our room was away from the bar and very quiet. Free continental breakfast is nice. Front desk service good. Housekeeping is inconsistent. Only complaint on room is you need a flashlight to read in most parts of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect perfect romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: dennisonhicks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Place d'Armes for our 20th wedding anniversary and could not have been happier! Frederic (concierge) was very helpful in finding restaurants and even booked a horse and carriage tour of Old Montreal. Our room was gorgeous as was our bathroom.....with air tub and huge shower with rain head. Classical music was playing in our room when we walked in....it was a celebration we will never forget. We will be back!! The hotel staff were fantastic to deal with......complete class act! Mark and Karen

Reviews.Title: “Not good at first”
Reviews.Author: sparkyandlou
Reviews.Content: After booking room 3 months in advance, we were placed in a room directly over the bar which has a live band until 3:00 AM! After several calls to the front desk and told the music will stop at 12, then 2 and then "I don't know, it's not my fault:" the music stopped at 3:30 AM. Next morning spoke with front desk manager, Sophie, she assured us that music would not be again, we did not want to chance it, she moved us to a slightly smaller room on a higher floor away from the bar, sent us a personal apology note, a complimentary night stay and a bottle of port. Front desk staff are aware of bar problem, but choose not to make guest away prior to check in. Overall room was very nice, great location and Sophie rectified the negative situation to our full satisfaction. Stay here - but ask for a room above 3rd floor in building 1.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in my car.”
Reviews.Author: reul
Reviews.Content: This place looks better than it acts. It fails in comfort, convenience and trust. Although the hotel put us in the penthouse suite at the regular room's rate (they'd given away our room before our arrival), it was still poor value for the money. After our arrival, they kept us up for an hour - no exaggeration - while they searched for a polyfil pillow (I'm allergic to feathers and that was all the room provided.) They never did find a featherless comforter, although we were there for 2 nights and they sell them. They neglected to tell us at any time before presenting the bill that there would be a daily parking charge. They take guests' cars and whisk them away to an undergroud lot. A full half hour after they took my car, I saw it being driven down another street. (I'm sure; it was my license plate.) The hotel was happy to change a small amount of American dollars into Canadian, but said they couldn't change a similar amount back. The concierge had trouble recommending local places to dine, and I've have much better breakfasts at lower-priced hotels. It was also noisy enough in the street below to wake us up early in the morning, even through closed windows on the top floor. To top it off, when we arrived home we found an extra charge on our bill. When I called the hotel, they claimed it was a mini-bar charge. We never used the mini-bar. I can't help wondering if this charge was a mistake or a habit. If this hotel is the only place with a room the next time I'm in Montreal, I'll sleep in my car.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Swtbroccoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place D'Armes Hotel for one night for our anniversary and it was a pleasant experience. We had the superior king room on the 2nd floor. Not much of a view for us since our window faced the office building across the street (and our request for a room with a nice view made on our Expedia booking was not accommodated). Overall, the room was clean and nicely decorated. Though our room was located right over the bar/lounge, it was very quiet during the evening (but we stayed over on a Monday, so that may make a difference). I liked the fact that we can adjust the room's temperature. The buffet breakfast was quite good and plenty of food was available to fill you up until supper time. :) It was a pleasant experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Rainspa”
Reviews.Author: Cinz
Reviews.Content: I wanted to experience the spa services of this hotel. The hotel has good reviews and Rainspa has a professional web site, so I expected the same of their spa. What a terrible assumption! The spa itself is nice, clean and inviting. The treatments however, (we had facials, manicures and pedicures) were very mediocre. It was not worth the money they charge. You can get much better service in Montreal and at less of a cost too. When we left, we forgot an important piece of jewelery there, and when we went back to get it , it was no where to be found. More importantly, we were told that if the chain was found they would contact us, otherwise it was just too bad! Could you believe this kind of attitude? After we (my husband and I spend the better part of the day using their services the day prior). I just find it appalling. Nobody was willing to take any responsibility at all. Somebody has the chain - it did not evaporate into thin air. Needless to say, with service like this, we will not be going back anytime soon. And if you are debating between going to Rainspa or elsewhere, do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. Chances are, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: MetroTower
Reviews.Content: Le Place d'Armes Hotel was outstanding. From the minute we drove up and were greeted by the doorman, through an efficient check in at reception, to being guided to our wonderful room with patio overlooking Montreal, we were impressed. The room was fantastic, and the bathroom was spectacular, with an amazing shower and separate free standing bath tub. Our room was quiet and serviced promptly. We found the bar to be fun and friendly, the downstairs restaurant to be outstanding for dinner, and the hideaway lunch BBQ restaurant on the roof to be literally over the top. Do stay here if you are in the part of Montreal and seek a modern, sophisticated hotel with a certain elan.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Danno1767
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was fantastic. I was looking to get away for the weekend as a kick off to a week's vacation in the White Mountains of New Hampshire - thought Montreal would be a great way to do that. Researched several hotels on the Trip Advisor, AAA and other sites - and I felt as if the Place d'Armes seemed like the best value. It did not disappoint. I received a slightly better rate booking through AAA after comparing everybody. Only glitch was the hotel seemingly did not have my reservation - I did have my AAA confirmation, so be sure to print and keep it with you if you book through them. Kara was the associate I dealt with at the hotel at check in and assured me there would be absolutely no problem. Placed me in the Executive Suite for the inconvenience of the slight delay and was extremely pleasant. Rene assisted and was equally as cordial, pleasant and helpful. This was consistent with my stay regardless of the hour of day. I manage customer service for a living. I would hire both of these fine people in a second. (Incidentally, everyone spoke very good English, which was so helpful as my French is limited to pleasantries) Executive Suite was fantastic. If you are extremely picky, the carpet needed a shampoo, but the amenities and comfort were first class. I must suspect that the standard rooms are equally as comfortable based on my discussions with other visitors I met on my stay who were equally as complementary. Place d'Armes includes a breakfast buffet - continental style - which was fine. Coffee was hot. Staff there were friendly. Great start to the day. The restaurant transforms into a night club that stays open until 3am on weekends. This was PERFECT for how I wanted to enjoy Montreal. The interesting thing is that the noise that eminates from the club does not create a nuisance for those with rooms nearby. Well insulated. Great drinks. Beautiful people abound. I could not thank Kim and Prescill enough for the time they showed me on Sunday night - both bartend at the club in the hotel and on Sunday night after the bar closed at midnight, took me to the "local" scene that tourists do not visit. Everyone I came across was friendly, sociable and just simply fun to be around. If either of you read this "thanks! You guys really added to my weekend!" Jean-Phillip and Erik were helpful with the bags and car, too. A feature I love about this hotel is its location in Old Montreal. It is within a leasurely walking distance to the riverfront, museums, and open market areas of the city. It is kitty-corner to the Notre Dame Basillica which is a must see. And lastly, only a very short cab ride to St Catherine / St Laurent streets where the best Montreal night life is. I unfortunately did not get to visit Crescent Street which is also a night spot - but I hear it is worth a look. I did not try the restaurant for dinner. But I certainly hope to, because I will definitely book this great hotel again for my next trip to Montreal. After reading so many reviews and comparing prices, I was happy with my "value play". Great stay all around.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse was great”
Reviews.Author: bothofusluv2travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We were in the penthouse suite. What is not to like? A giant extended king size bed in a bedroom the size of a luxury home large master bedroom with a huge bathroom. The Jacuzzi bathtub itself is definitely meant for lovers, big enough for two with room to spare. A separate extra large shower stall (again super for those in love or who want to rekindle passion). A decorated living room with an eating area. A large hall with a comfortable working area complete with a large desk. A flat screen TV in every room including the main bathroom. A second bathroom (great for married folks when the wife is using the main bath when getting ready to go out) A nicely stocked bar. Floor to ceiling windows. We had a nice view of the city of Montreal. Outside our suite was a beautifully decorated barroom for use of the guests on the floor (you make your own cocktails in your room and can relax there, there is no bartender or stock in the room). a nice buffet breakfast is served downstairs in the morning. The cost was $250 Canadian (less than $215 US). What a bargain! Located in old Montreal for a european flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the outside, a headache on the inside...”
Reviews.Author: csviokla1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a clean, crisp feel to it on the surface but we found it was more than a little problematic when we dug a little deeper. First, the positivies: large, comfortable, clean rooms - it does not have the feel of a boutique European hotel in the least (at least not in appearences). It is obvious they spent a lot if time and expense on the decor and they keep it clean so it was a pleasure to return to after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The staff is friendly - for the most part - you wouldn't be hard pressed to find attitude either. For example, trying to explain that I had been billed for 2 rooms when in fact I had only stayed in one seemed to have gone right through the maitre'd as if I had commented on the weather. You will find that some of the people that work the front desk are unable to handle anything more than routine questions and procedure. You MUST speak with a supervisor if you have a complaint. My husband and I complained about the broken air conditioner as soon as we checked in - we were told an engineer would stop by to fix it that day or we would be moved. The following morning - when nothing was fixed, we went back to the front desk to check the status - after furiously trying to find our original complaint in some sort of a log book for 5 minutes the woman asked us if we would like for someone to look at it. Frustrated and confused we said "yes" and were assured the engineer would be by to check it that day. Returning around 5pm that afternoon we found - again - nothing had been done. This time we spoke with the supervisor and explained our issues. We were immediately upgraded to a suite at the same rate and given a complimentary bottle of wine with the hotel's apologies. We were happy with that. Then came check-out. We were charged for an extra room which I had mentioned to the blase maitre'd on my way out. My husband, who checked out later did not realize I had already paid for a night - and the nightmare ensued. I called up for the next week explaining the issue. After being assured we'd be credited for a night's stay I saw no credit 2 weeks later. Calling up and explaining it again I find the woman I spoke initially had not made any action to credit my account. Finally - a month later - my card was credited. I would stay here again if we found the same great rate (Expedia)- for the comfort and proximity - armed with the knowledge to check everything three and four times.

Reviews.Title: “Found a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Stu Lang
Reviews.Content: My wife have visited Canada 14 times including 10 to Montreal. We have enjoyed each one but for the one we just completed in early July, we wanted a hotel close to the Old City area. Our AAA guide book listed several 4 & 5 star hotels, among them Place d'Armes on Rue St. Jacques. It was described as an attractive 44 room hotel with a price within our range. We booked 5 nights on line. On arival we were astounded to learn that the smallish establishment had acquired 2 adjoning building, merged them & totally remodeled it into 135 rooms that were the most tastefully decorated, comfortable rooms we had ever stayed at in Montreal. Besides the beautiful new appointments, there were 3 excellent dining rooms, a gym, bars, free breakfasts & perhaps the most pleasant & cooperative staff we ever encountered. We have travelled to several parts of the world but Canada is our favorite (also close, 1 hr, 20 mins. by air from Philadelphia.)In he past we have driven or rented cars there. This time we could walk to many of our favorite sites or take the excellent Metro system. One small problem with our room was corrected within hours by the maintenance staff. We strongly endorse this hotel & look forward to returning in the future. Stuart Lang Huntingdon Valley, PA

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike55401
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Place d'Armes over the new year and was pleasantly suprised. Originally had planned to stay at Hotel Nelligan but since they were booked they directed us to their sister property, the Place d'Armes. We loved almost everything about this property. Beautiful rooms, wonderful fireplaces, huge bathrooms, great service. It is very close to the Old Town. It is a bit removed from the shopping district in Montreal though. Nevertheless, Montreal has a great subway and the hotel has a station just one block away. Noise was not a factor in my room, and it was New Year's as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable place to explore this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, good staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynguyz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Place D'Armes is wonderfully decorated with a modern serene sensibility. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent and overall we had a pleasant stay here. However, like many boutique hotels it focuses a bit too much on the superficial and not enough on the foundations of the enterprise. We had to be moved from our first room because their was some kind of a water leak under the bed that began to smell very musty and also because our DVD player didn't work and they told us we could bring dvds -- which we did. After some confusion as to whether we were moving or not, we were efficiently moved to the new room to discover the hot water wasn't working in that area of the building. Fortunately, it was back by the next day but then we discovered that the whirlppool wasn't working which we decided to not bring up. The showers, by the way, are great -- very roomy with a rainfall shower head that was most pleasant. There were some little confusions too with our bill when we checked out -- little things like that which make the hotel seem like it might be falling apart on the inside and that management is a little discombobulated. We were very pleased though that they gave us a discount for our troubles. The hotel is nicely located between View Montreal and the Jazz Fest -- very convenient. If you're fussy I wouldn't stay here but if you don't mind a few rough edges, it's a pretty pleasant hotel. I would rate this 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Like Paris without the ChainSmoking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes, which we picked because of TripAdvisor, was excellent. Beautiful. Great room. Great staff. Restaurant AIX outstanding. Location excellent. Our room was a top-floor suite and nearly as large as our apartment in New York. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: tsoi888
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently decide to take a road trip to Montreal with our two young sons ( 9 months/3 years old). Upon arriving at the hotel we were treated with the great service this hotel is know for. The doorman and bellman both waited patiently as we unloaded our car. You can imagine how much gear we had to bring with two small kids. The bellman showed us to our room that was quite nice. My sons were so happy to get out of the car and be able to stretch out in the large king size bed. We had ordered a crib that was suppose to be in the room but was not there. The bellman told us he would look into it right away when he got back downstairs. No joke, within 15 minutes, a man from housekeeping brought up the crib. When my husband tried to tip him he refused to take it. The location was perfect for us and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “FANCY CONTEMPORARY HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my nusband stayed in this nice contemporary hotel for 3 nights and found it fashionable, comfortable and convinient. There are an expensive restoraunt "AIX" with a wonderfuly presented delicious french causine, fancy bar 701 filled with locals all weekend nights. Continental breakfast is included and it has a great selection you would't normaly expect from such type of breakfast. We were delighted! Service generaly was nice and staff was very helpful. Location of this hotel is the most convinient. Notre-Dame Basilica is just across the street and old Montreal is short stroll away. We'd definetely recommend this hotel to anyone, the only drawback is that this place is kind of expensive given current exchange rate and vallet parking they provide is also expensive. If you travel by car it would be better not to use hotel service for tax refund because you would be able to get a full refund (without any service fees) in canadian duty free shop on the border instantly and in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: TomB11
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: Nicely appointed, street noise comes right through the wallls, clean & comfortable. The Hotel Place d'Armes is a recent retrofit of three adjacent buildings. The furnishings throughout the hotel are modern: dark woods, conservative colors, and interesting lighting. There is a bar on the first floor that is setup for breakfast in the morning, and transforms into one of Montreal's hotspots at night. The hotel offers wine and cheese reception coupons for happy hour. It is a nice offer, but I never used the coupons, because the local culture is to work later and proceed directly to dinner [which lasts at least three hours]. The hotel hosts a fabulous restaurant which is directly beneath the bar. For those who love heavy meat dishes, go for the lamb or wild boar. If you can't get enough Copper River Salmon, then definitely have the artic char. The rooms at the hotel are fairly large -- although I can't speak for them all. The decor and feel are very much 'W Hotel', but without the Heavenly Bed or Heavenly Shower. The bed is a pilow-top, with high thread-count cotton sheets, and a down comforter in a cotton douvet [all white on my stay]. There is a desk with high-speed Ethernet, dial-up, and power. The chair is executive-style and comfortable. There are two types of lighting: regular incandescent and LED. The regular lighting is built into the large furniture, which provides good enough light to see where you are walking and that you are picking out the right color socks. The LED lighting is a very cold color, and does not add much to the feel of the place. There is one large armoire with drawers for clothes. Iron and ironing board are included. The in-room safe, slippers, robe, and laundry bags are tucked into various places. There is enough room around the armoir to drop three large suitcases and not impede the primary path from door-to-bath-to-bed. The mini-bar is setup with enough booze to forget any bad business day, as well as the day after. The entertainment center includes shelving with books, red wine, wine glasses, ~27-inch TV, and fireplace. The room I was in had surround sound. The bath is entirely stone. The shower runs the length of one wall with a step entry at the end away from the regular shower head, with an overhead raindrop shower. Counterspace is a limited, but the shelf under the sink provided room to set things not being used. Despite all these nice things, everytime a bus drove by, I felt compelled to check if the windows were closed. Another nice touch [sic] was the 6AM shock of construction on the terrace above my room.
