Since the company I was visiting provided an extremely discounted rate at this hotel, the decision was made for me on staying here. At regular rates, I would have stayed at the W [five blocks away] and visited the Place d'Armes for the restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Classy option in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel in a good location for a tourists visit. Similarly to the previous reviewer we got a very good deal of $180 CAN per night. We had booked a Superior King room and got a room on the fourth floor of the second building (People's bank building). There was no exposed bricks in the room, but it was a good size, elegant furnishings with some trendy touches. The hotel is not aimed at the 20-30 old crowd and hence the design is maybe not as trendy or as hip as many other boutique hotels. The bed was extremely comfortable, but the pillows did smell a bit musty and even after requesting new pillow cases the smell remained. The room did not have a bath in it either, and although the shower was large it would have been nice to relax in a bath after a day's sightseeing. However, the bathroom design was very stylish and hip. The wine and cheese voucher was a pleasant touch and the wine was drinkable enough, and I agree that the cheeses were nothing special. The breakfast was very tasty and having it in the hotel's bar made a nice change to the usual breakfast room scenario. All in all this is an excellent hotel and I would definitely recommend it if a good price is available. Some small things (loud AC unit, bath in room, pillows) can still be improved which explains the 4 stars and not the maximum rating. However, the Place d'Armes is a great hotel which makes for an excellent base in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel - better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: brewmester
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the price. We stayed in the 2nd wing on the 5th floor in a Superior Room with King Bed. The hotel was several blocks away from the main part of old Montreal. It's a short walk, a few blocks from Chinatown. And it's almost across from Place de la Congres (Convention Center). Very convenient. The room was clean and chic. Faux fireplace was a nice touch. Free wireless internet was a plus. Shower and bathroom were large. The view was good. The bed was comfortable. The gym was very decent, with free weights. Front desk staff were pleasant. Free wine and cheese every evening. We ate out so can't comment on the food. Breakfast was more than adequate. Their website doesn't do it justice. It was a pleasant surprise to find a hotel better than advertised. Highly recommend for the chic traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: jackarch
Reviews.Content: A very nice, modern, hip hotel in a great location. Was just there for two nights. Umbrellas in the closets, which came in handy since it poured the whole weekend! Booked two rooms. When checking in, one of them was very warm and smelled of stale smoke. Front desk quickly changed us to a better room. Bathrooms are ultra-modern with very cool showers and sinks. My only gripe is that the room, and especially the bathroom, were very dark! They need better lighting. Other than that, would definitely return. And at C$204 a night, the price was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to make a better choice”
Reviews.Author: AlainL
Reviews.Content: I like Hotel Place d'Armes so much that, even if I live in Montreal and work close by, I bring my wife a couple times a year to get away from the children. The rooms are spacious, have character and are well equipped. A welcome drink and very good continental breakfast are included. The Hotel is right on the Place d'Armes in the heart of Old-Montreal. From some rooms you can see Notre-Dame Church. The area is fantastic for people who like to walk on narrow streets surrounded by old stone buildings. Most buildings in that area are 200 years old. And the restaurants are just magnificient: Verses at Hotel Nelligan (same owner as the Place d'Armes), Les Remparts , Bonaparte, ... are all less than a 5-minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Beautiful hotel, inside and outside - Romantic atmosphere - brick walls, gorgeous shower, boutique leather furniture, premium audio and video system - Excellent service throughout both in English and in French - Very good breakfast - Located in Old City - right next to Notre Dame - We paid $140 a room via Expedia - a great bang for the buck. The price quoted by hotel was significantly higher ($200) - Free broadband internet included! (great for skyping on the road or checking your email) - Cheap valet parking ($20 CAN / night ) Cons: - Free wine and cheese (5-7pm in the bar) included cheap cheese and barely-ok wine. Conclusion: Excellent bang for the buck, beautiful non-corporate, truly boutique hotel located right in the Old City. One of the best hotels I have ever been to in my life!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: MomX3Vermont
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful romantic getaway at the Place D'armes last year. In Old Montreal near great restaurants and has an amazing brunch. Probably not a great place to take the kids, but for couples it is wonderful. Rooms are upscale with a great metropolitan feel (redone in the past few years). Have sent several couples here who all loved it. We'll definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “It doesnt get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: davjunk
Reviews.Content: Well I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel, it was just wonderful in every way. Perfect location, spotless, nice staff. Possibly the nicest place I have ever stayed. If you go to montreal and dont stay here you're missing out!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Place d'Armes a number of times and wanted to add my "thumbs up" to this list. Owing to work related travel, I have had the pleasure of staying in many prestigious hotels in the US, Canada, and UK. Hotel Place d'Armes is one one of my favourite hotels in North America, and perhaps the only luxury hotel that I could describe as value for money. The hotel is upscale and hip without being too pretentious. It has class and a few nice touches for patrons (e.g., a free breakfast that is simple but sufficient). Location is good for sightseeing and not too far from conference centres and business activities. While some of the rooms are quite small, all of those that I have stayed in have been extremely well appointed. Staff are helpful and generally unobtrusive. The evening wine and cheese is a nice way to relax before heading off for dinner. The patio in summer is a fantastic place to begin an evening in old MontrÃ©al.

Reviews.Title: “A great Thanksgiving at the Hotel Place d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fantastic 3 night stay at the Hotel Place d'Armes and as it was our first trip to Montreal it was a great initiation. The hotel is perfectly located in Old Montreal and only a block from the Metro which was invaluable during the cold weather we had. Our room was very well furnished and had a perfect view onto the Place d'Armes and the Notre Dame Basillica opposite. The housekeeping was always great and the inclusion of a next-day weather report with the turn-down was extremely helpful for planning our sightseeing. The staff on the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly at all stages especially in helping us with our restaurant reservations - it is worth noting that the attached restaurant, Aix, is definitely worth a visit. Our only slight let down was our first attempt at the complimentary wine and cheese offered by the management at the hotel bar, as the area was jam-packed with a private function that we were unaware of on our arrival. But overall we had a great time at the Hotel Place d'Armes and are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Knocked My Socks Off!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingSusan123
Reviews.Content: I love hotels. The Hotel Place D'Armes was maybe my favorite hotel room of all time. I paid only about $185/night for 3 nights, had a truly impressive room in the new building, got a free continental breakfast and cocktail hour, was in a great location in Vieux Montreal right near the Basilica, and was generally treated like a queen in all ways. When there was a little problem with my manicure at the spa (it was the first week they were open), they gave me a free pedicure. My room included a fabulous slate-tiled walk-in shower with one of those shower heads that feels like rain, and I adored the faux fireplace, leather club chair, and the nice touches like bottles of water and a weather report for the next day, which was left by my bedside. If you want to stay in Old Montreal and want comfy and pampering accommodations at a downright jaw-droppingly reasonable price, you can't do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Like the SOHO Grand in NY”
Reviews.Author: Shanehoustonlittle
Reviews.Content: Loved the 12' ceiling height in the rooms. Good bar and efficient service. Central Location allowed us to walk everywhere. Even though our room was on the street side of the hotel it remained very quiet. Would stay here agin.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven of Heaven in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Eudoxxia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in June of 2005, and thought I had died and gone to heaven! As my trip was for business (a stressful convention) the superior service and attention to detail was mch appreciated. The hotel lend me a laser printer free for the week, large deliveries were promptly brought to my room, and they made my stay so enjoyable I didn't want to leave. Delicious breakfast every morning, and a beautiful room made me feel like I was in Paris. And the lovely sound system, comfy bed and jetted tub took care of any stress I had accumulated during the day. The location, attentive service and amenities all make me want to return to this hotel just as soon as I can - and I am a picky person! One thing I did notice was that my room would be cleaned later in the day (2-3pm); I don't know if that's because of the location of my room or just standard practice. The restaurant attached to the hotel is delicious and well worth the splurge for a tranquil lunch or dinner. I can't say enough about this place - I recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere for better value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Place d'Armes over Labor Day weekend (2005) with five children. I booked the rooms through Travelocity as their rate was $75 (US) cheaper and when I called the hotel, they advsed me they could not match the rate and to book via the internet. I then emailed the hotel (using their "contact us" button on their web site) and requested a crib, a non-smoking room and dining recommendations. I received an autoreply that the recipient was away on vacation for a few days and would answer my email upon return from vacation. I never received a response. When I checked in and mentioned this disappointing failure (for $300 US/night, I expect a response), the concierge was very apologetic and stunned me by telling me that the person who didn't bother returning the email was in fact the hotel owner. I just don't see how ignoring guests is good long-term business. As for the room and hotel, it is tricked-out in modern and stylish decor. The concierge upgraded us to a nicer suite than what I booked and it was very roomy. However, housekeeping did not show up until 4:30 pm and the dinner reservations we asked to be made were never made. The crib was cheap quality and unsafe. It also lacked the typical extras (stuffed animals, baby bath, etc) usually provided by better hotels. The continental breakfast was adequate. No effort was made by the front desk to inquire if we enjoyed our stay or if they could get anything for us. Location was convenient to Old Town. Given the favorable exchange rate and abundance of fine hotels in Montreal, I'd research alternative hotels before spending much at the Place D'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing servce”
Reviews.Author: vbw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Place d'Armes. Based on previous reviews here, we were expecting a nice experience - we were sadly disappointed. Each day we returned to our hotel room in the late afternoon (3:30pm and 5:30pm) to find that our room had not been cleaned. Minor issues (but surprising for this type of hotel): we received turn-down service only one of the three nights, we received the morning paper only one of the three mornings, staff made little attempt to say hello or smile.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: kdnystn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on holiday and it was excellent. We payed $175ca per night but we were upgrded to a suite which was huge and very well decorated, appointed and furnished. The staff were the most genuine and helpful that I have encountered in a long time. The concierege (Luc?) noticed us waiting for a tour in reception - he came over, checked that we were ok, phoned the copmpany and organised a takeaway breakfast. Breakfast was nice with a good selection and I enjoyed the bar food too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Boutique Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: BlissPriss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Place d'Armes for business and was treated to lovely accomadations a friendly staff that treats every guest like a VIP and a luxurious atmosphere. Unlike other hotels I stay at for business, this felt like a mini vacation. I walked into my room and found music softly playing, a large standard room with natural lighting, a large comfortable bed, a large bathroom (shower only) and was delivered cookies and water that evening. I had cheese and wine in the bar and the bar manager was very friendly, remembered who I was and who I was seen with the following evenings so he could point me in my parties direction. He made sure everyone was comfortable, had a drink or food in hand, without being overbearing. Breakfast in the morning was full of choices, the food was good and the coffee was strong. I had a lovely stay and look forward to my return. I would stay here for business or pleasure without hesitation and highly recommend this hotel for either.

Reviews.Title: “if you're picky, stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: chictravler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in many hotels in different cities based on reviews we're read on Tripadvisor. This was one of them, and all the prior reviews were definitely accurate! We are VERY picky travelers who always stay in the most high end hotel we can find for under $200/night, and found this stood up to our expectations, and then some. This is a very nice, VERY clean boutique hotel in a perfect location with lots of great extras, for a very reasonable price. It is one block away from the Metro stop, and is located right in Old Montreal. There is FREE wine and cheese served in the hotel bar area (or the rooftop terrace, if you prefer) every afternoon. The continental breakfast (also FREE) was excellent- I don't know what others were expecting when they complained about it in their reviews. They had a very nice selection of bread, cheese, delicious muffins, bagels, lots of fruit, juices, cereal, etc etc. More than good enough to fill you up so you can enjoy your morning sightseeing! Free daily newspaper too. The room was very nicely decorated and spotlessly clean, and we were in the OLD part of the hotel. Valet parking expensive as usual, but good service. Overall we try to find nice, classy hotels that we look forward to returning to after a long day of sightseeing, and that are part of the experience of traveling to the city we're staying in, and this one was another perfect find!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - couldnt fault it”
Reviews.Author: Merseymike
Reviews.Content: Recently expanded, we were fortunate enough to have one of the rooms in the refurbished new wing, on the third floor. The rooms are large, the beds huge and comfortable, the shower equally large and luxurious. The location couldn't be better - opposite the Basilica, near a Metro. The hotel provides a Continental breakfast in the cost, and there is free cheese and wine each evening. The staff are helpful, friendly, and bilingual. I can't praise this hotel enough. Its excellent in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, big on service”
Reviews.Author: CampingCrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July 2005 (we paid 175.00 CD) and we were not disappointed! The staff is extremely helpful and willing to please, even when busy. They make you feel like they have been waiting just for you to arrive. The room was divine, and in our opinion, not at all small, although it was a little cramped with a rollaway bed. The room was immaculate and furnished simply and luxuriously. When our valet opened the door to our room, we were greated with classical music playing on the radio. After the long drive, partly in the rain, this room and this hotel was wonderfully refreshing! We were not disappointed in the evening wine and cheese. One of our party didn't drink, so instead of wine, enjoyed a soda with the abundant bread and varied cheeses. Two wines were offered for the complimentary glass, a red and a white. The breakfast was outstanding with delicious breads and pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juices, coffee, teas, and cheeses. I only have a few small complaints; we had to call three times to get our rollaway bed, and it was not a good bed, even for a rollaway. However, I slept on it and was comfortable enough. Local phone calls are 1.00 each, which I think is kind of chintzy, and valet parking was 17.00 a day. The charge for parking was not made clear on the website, and I wouldn't have even known about it if I had not read another review on this site. However, this is a city hotel, and even if they had parking on site, you wouldn't really expect it to be free. Other than these small complaints, I can't say enough good things about this hotel, and if I return to MontrÃ©al, most likely I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Superb Attention”
Reviews.Author: ale1974
Reviews.Content: It is a terrific hotel: the location, the staff, the breakfast, the bed, the linens, the bath, we pay CA$175 per night and it worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel D'Armes Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: cipi2000
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and stayed at the Hotel Place D'Armes summer 2003. When we first drove up we thought it was a dump from afar because it is located on the edge of a renovated section. What a delightful surprise. When the front doors opened we were in heaven: Gorgeous, modern lobby w/ comfortble seating, delicious snacks, friendly service, tastefully decorated room although a bit small but fine, a small workout room, a pretty public terrace overlooking the city and all in a perfect location at an affordable price. Highly recommend this lovely boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kashmir79
Reviews.Content: Possibly the nicest hotel experience I have ever had. The staff was incredibly helpful, the restaurant downstairs had lovely food, the location was ideal- I have absoulutely no complaints. I loved this hotel, and so did the other four people who came with me (ranging in age from 29- 63). I noticed that other people have remarked on the room size, but my opinion is this: when you stay in a boutique hotel in the middle of a city as beautiful and cosmopolitan as Montreal, you'd be a fool to stay in your room for any long stretch of time. The rooms are not spacious, but they are beautifully appointed and perfect for relaxing after a day of sightseeing. Bigger is not always better.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwoods1073
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a four night stay in a deluxe king room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spotlessly clean. The restaurant Aix downstairs has great, creative cuisine. The staff went out of their way to give good restaurant recommendations and offbeat places to see in Montreal. They were always very helpful and made you feel very welcome at the hotel. I will stay here again on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Romance Package was great”
Reviews.Author: BrendaH
Reviews.Content: Following is a very long review of our stay at the Hotel Place D'Armes on May 5 and 6, 2005. Hotel Place Dâ€™Armes is a very nice boutique hotel in a prime section of Old Montreal, a short walk to both the old port and downtown Montreal. The hotel is a little hard to drive to because of all the one-way streets, and the street is full of construction vehicles working on Phase 2 of the hotel, making it hard to find a place to pull over, grab your luggage and hand off your car to the valet; however, with a little maneuvering, it can be done. The staff at the check-in is very friendly and accommodating, quick with directions and always greeting us warmly after our outings. The valet was very helpful, going back to our car to retrieve items we had forgotten in our haste to avoid blocking the road when arriving. The lobby, public areas and guestrooms of the hotel are classically decorated and very pleasing. Coffee, tea, cappuccino and espresso are available in the lobby at all times, which is a nice bonus. We booked the "Romantic Getaway" for our anniversary for $660, which with taxes and parking, came to $800 for two nights. The package inclusions listed on the website are as follows: Accommodations for two nights in one of our loft style suites Continental breakfast served in bed Wine and Cheese Cocktail every night Dinner for two at Restaurant Aix cuisine du Terroir (service included) Two Â½ hour of massage in the comfort of your bedroom or our dedicated massage room Chilled champagne Accommodations Perhaps I'm wrong, but I've always assumed a loft indicates a second floor. The hotel does have some two-storey suites; however, when our confirmation was e-mailed, it stated "King Deluxe Room". I e-mailed the hotel and asked why it stated "King Deluxe Room" when the website stated "loft-style suite" and I was told that they are the same thing. In any case, our room was of average size, with a nice double-jacuzzi tub. All the photos of rooms I have seen on the web show what is likely a suite. However, that being said, the room was very nicely decorated. We had a corner room with three high windows and a nice view of the edge of the cathedral. The furniture is very attractive and well laid out, the bathroom nicely done, with good shampoos and soaps, etc., and best of all, the king size bed is very comfortable. Although I would not say our room was large, it was a fair bit larger than the standard room in which we had our massages. Although there is a lot of construction currently going on next door, we were never bothered by any noise. I found the room very comfortable and attractive. In our room documents were a couple of business cards with my husbandâ€™s name, and our hotel contact information, presumably to give out during business meetings â€“ nice touch. Continental Breakfast When we checked in, we were told that we had a choice of breakfast in the restaurant, or in breakfast in bed. We chose to go down to the restaurant, and, for a continental breakfast, we found it very good. There was a wide selection of fruit, breads, yogurts and beverages, as well as some cereals and hard boiled eggs. One strange thing we noticed was that there were no salt shakers anywhere and no salt packets. We asked a waitress for salt, and she appeared to look for some but evidently never found any â€“ she didnâ€™t come back in any case. Other than for the hard-boiled eggs, salt probably wasnâ€™t necessary. Wine and Cheese Cocktail At check in, you are given two slips that entitle you to your Wine and Cheese cocktail. The wine and cheese was served in the bar section of the restaurant; it might have been nicer if it had been in the lobby bar, which never opened during our stay. You receive one glass of wine per person; if the server asks you if you would like another, make note you will be billed ($18 plus tip for two glasses of wine). Dinner at Restaurant Aix Cuisine du Terroir At check in, you receive a voucher for your dinner, and you just need to tell the front desk when you would like to have the dinner. I had thought that we would be able to order from the regular menu; however, it turned out that the Romance Package has a set menu. We were give a choice of soup or appetizer (although once we made our choice, they brought us both anyways), choice of two entrees, cheese plate and dessert. We had the arctic char with risotto, and although the risotto was rather tasteless, the fish was good. I was too full after a bit of cheese to order a dessert, but my husband had one and it was very good. Other than the risotto, all the food was well prepared and nicely presented, and service was very good as well. Tips were included, but we chose to tip a little extra for the service. Two Â½ hour of massage Ah, the best part of the trip. Iâ€™m not really one for massages. Iâ€™ve had a few that left me less than overwhelmed; however, our massages at the hotel were excellent. Our masseur was very, very good and I was impressed enough that I may actually go for a massage again someday â€“ I definitely will if we return to the hotel. Champagne The front desk will bring up the champagne whenever you like; we had it delivered soon after we checked in. It was a half bottle of Moet & Chandon (not cheap) and was delivered on ice. It was very enjoyable. Summary Was the package worth it? Iâ€™d say yes, seeing as the King Deluxe Rooms are nearly $300 a night before tax. The standard room is nearly $200 a night and would probably feel a little small in comparison to your average North American hotel room. It turns out that the wine and cheese and continental breakfast are included for all guests, so the Romance Packageâ€™s extras are the dinner, champagne and massages, which Iâ€™m guessing would retail for much more than the difference we paid between booking just the room, or booking the package. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Old Montreal, and is a welcome refuge after a long day of shopping and sightseeing. Would I stay at Hotel Place Dâ€™Armes again? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break”
Reviews.Author: NSmith1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed he for a couple on nights at end of March. Excellent finishing details through out the hotel to the common parts and the rooms. Small hotel, but good individual service and attention to any requirements. Rooms stylishly finished and great value for money - beats most of the larger chains. Rate included breakfast and early evening wine and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail...5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars. Booked this hotel based on the recommendation of an industry expert in the boutique hotel field. Hotel was very nice, comfortable, and the staff were extremely friendly. Icing on the cake...concierge brought car back from valet parking on Sunday and it had been washedâ€¦it was sparkling! The hotel is small with approx 45 rooms. As a result, the general feel around the hotel was quiet. The main foyer / bar area is very impressive, however, the bar was not 'open' beyond the Director's Cocktail Reception in the evening (5:00PM to 7:00PM), which was unfortunate given the high ceilings and funky chandelier lighting. It is quite the space. Rooms were very â€˜Bombayâ€™ style â€“ which is not my taste and the bathroom was a good size with black and white â€˜art decoâ€™ feel to it. Products were Essentiel Elements of San Fran, which were replaced with new products each day â€“ no penny pinching on these items. Our room was on the 6th floor. Only point to note for future is the ice machines are located on the 3rd and 4th floors. By chance, when we were riding the elevator, it stopped on the 4th floor and there it was the ice machine sitting directly outside the doors of room number 404 and 405. Location was great â€“ across from Notre Dame Basilica and one block from Palais de Congres. Overall, a great weekend away. The restaurant is very good and again the staff here were also very friendly and accommodating. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Stay at the Place d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: Jornada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for five days during the first week of April. I was attending a conference at the Palais des Congres, which was conveniently one block away. My room was clean, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. Compared to similar hotels in the UK, the room was good-sized. The bed was comfortable and had good lighting for reading. In the closet was a terrycloth robe, slippers, and an umbrella. I found no fault with the room but would have liked more tv channels. The breakfast selection was wide and varied, with smoked salmon, fresh fruit, museli, croissants, etc. I had trouble tearing myself away from the chocolate croissants. After a couple days, the waiter knew my preference for tea over coffee. I won't say that the hotel staff was very friendly, but they were always polite and helpful. Examples: when I lost a button off my coat, they gave me a sewing kit. They volunteered to call the airport bus sevice for me, and when I checked out, handled the VAT refund process for me. Considering that I don't speak French, I thought that they were patient. I didn't want to leave, and I've had that feeling about hotels very rarely.
